loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia A. is fifty-six years old. She is married and has nine children; seven of them are independent, and the last two are still in school. Sophia has been working to help her husband support their children. She fries doughnuts and sells them in schools in her community. She buys the necessary materials from Kumasi. She has been in business for twenty-two years. Sophia wants to use the loan to buy her materials in bulk, in order to cut down on transportation costs. Sophia belongs to the community group called All Nation Trust Bank group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral so as to access the loan, and support one another in handling repayment. She was attending her group meeting when her photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her food business.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida I. is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children. She has managed to send four to junior high school, but the rest have dropped out of school because of financial constraints. Currently she lives in Atebubu in the Brong Ahafo region. But her original home town is Bawku in the northern part of Ghana. She came to settle in Atebubu about thirty years ago when she was forced to marry a man she was not interested in during her childhood. She ran away from home, and since then she has not returned to her home town. Rashida is a food vendor and has sold rice with stew in the marketplace of Atebubu for fifteen years. She wants the loan to buy supplies like bags of rice, spices, charcoal, and meat, so that her business proceeds can be used to pay her children's education fees. She believes your help can transform her life. She is member of the group called ‘Ima’ meaning Amen Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her food business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: Hawa Sané P. est une veuve remariée. Elle s’active dans l’achat et la revente à crédit (mensuel) de tissu teinté mais en même temps elle fait un commerce quotidien de salade et légumes. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt augmenter son capital afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Hawa Sané P. is a remarried widow who is active in the commerce of dyed fabrics, sold on a monthly credit plan. But at the same time, she sells salad and vegetables each day. She would like to use this loan to increase her capital to improve family living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in cloth and concurrently in salad and vegetables

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa K. is a 60-year-old widow and the mother of five children. She has been working extremely hard to provide for her children ever since her husband passed away. Indeed, as a single mother, Adwoa explains that without her husband it has been hard for her financially, especially when it comes to providing for the family. 

In order to pay for her family's basic needs, she sells footwear (mostly slippers), and she notes that she has been operating this business for the past twenty years. More specifically, she hawks her goods to households in her community, and she sells her footwear at the local market when the market is open. To do so, Adwoa buys her goods from the big cities. 

She is now seeking a loan to increase her inventory of footwear so that she can trek to nearby towns and villages to make sales (rather than trekking so far to simply purchase her goods for resale). Notably, Adwoa belongs to the community group known as the All Nation Trust Bank group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. Her picture was taken at one of the group's meetings.

loans.use: To expand her business and to cut down on transportation costs by purchasing footwear (primarily slippers) in bulk

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. Both of her children are currently attending elementary school in Atebubu, where she resides with her immediate family.

To support her family, she sells food items such as beans, maize, rice, and groundnuts at the market square. In fact, she notes that she has been in this business for over three years now. Janet explains that she buys her food items from the wholesalers in her community and sells them to food vendors for a profit.

Janet is now seeking a loan in order to increase her working capital so that her dream of buying goods in bulk can be achieved. By doing so, she will be able to sell her goods to a large number of customers (i.e., she will increase her market share) and will thereby increase her profit margin. Notably, Janet belongs to a group in her community known as "Assurance". In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To expand her customer base and to increase profits by purchasing goods (e.g., beans and groundnuts) in bulk

loans.name: David Salomon

texts.es: El Sr. David tiene 33 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Villa Reconciliación, estado civil casado su esposa trabaja como operadora de zona franca, tiene dos lindos hijos de 8 y 19 años de edad ambos estudiando. Sus planes para su familia es ampliar su vivienda y tener un mejor nivel de vida para ofrecerles a sus hijos. Don David de profesión disector de cadevoras pero se desempeña como soldador con una experiencia de diecinueve años,  inicio de la mano de su padre a trabajar y así adquiriendo el conocimiento para desempeñarlo por propia cuenta. Sus metas para el futuro de su negocio incrementar el volumen de la producción comprando Herramientas de primera calidad.Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar herramientas como: maquina de soldar, soldaduras, mascarías y guantes, generándole una mayor utilidad y un mejor servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. David is 33 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. He is married and his wife works as an operator in the free trade zone. They have two beautiful children, ages 8 and 19, who are in school. Their plans for their family include expanding their home and improving their quality of life for their children. David is a coroner by profession but he has worked as a solderer for nine years. He started by learning from his father, and soon began working independently. In the future David would like to increase his production and buy high quality tools. Thanks to the Afodenic loans, he'll be able to buy tools like: soldering iron, welding, masks and gloves, all of which will create utility and better service for his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools like a soldering iron and prime materials

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. is sixty-two years old. She lives with her husband in Obuasi. Her four children have all completed school and are gainfully employed. As old as she is, she still works to make some money and also to keep herself active. Abena enjoys trading a lot and has been in the business of trading in maize. She has been trading for ten years. Abena buys her goods directly from maize farmers in her community and those in the nearby towns. She distributes her maize to small ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators in her locality. She wants to use the loan to procure more bags of maize so that she can meet the increasing demand of her customers. Abena belongs to the community group called All Nation Trust Bank group. In this group, members guarantee each other as collateral so as to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment. She was attending her group meeting when her photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: La dame Awa G. est mariée, mère de 02 enfants. Elle veut avec ce prêt renforcer son capital d’embouche ovine. Cette activité lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille et subvenir aussi aux nombreuses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Madame Awa G. is married and the mother of two. She wants to use this loan to boost her capital for feeding sheep. This business enables her to make improvements in the living conditions, health, and schooling for her family and also to meet numerous day-to-day expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy, raise, and sell sheep

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa R. is forty years old. She is married and the mother of three kids -- one is her biological child, and she also is taking care of her late brother's kids. Currently all the kids are in school. 

She and her family live in Atebubu. Where they live is a typical farming community, where most settlers do farming, specifically crop farming. But Hawa opts to deal in supplying cloth, a business she started fifteen years ago with an amount of $20 at that time. Now Hawa can boast of its business expansion, which she accomplished with that little seed money with which she started her business. Since that time she has maintained product quality and customer relations. She requests the loan to buy more clothing materials like cloth, linen, and lace. Hawa treks her product to the surrounding communities to sell during their market days. 

Through the proceeds from her output she has able to build a three-bedroom house with the able help of her husband. She is prepared to sell everything on her to give her kids good quality education. She said she would be grateful for your support. 

Hawa belongs to a group in her community known as ‘Ruth.’ The group members agree to guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to sell.

loans.name: Adams

texts.en:
Adams I. is twenty-six years old and married. Adams lives in Atebubu in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana with his wife. It a mountainous community with serene atmosphere. Atebubu is a farming community and almost every male farmer ride on bicycle to farm. This has created a job for Adams. Adams is a professional bicycle repairer, and not only that, but he also sells bicycle parts. Adams has been in this business for the past four years, and through it he obtains his daily income to support his family. 

He travels to Alabar, a suburb of Kumasi, where he purchases his bicycle parts. He wants the loan to buy more bicycle parts to restock his inventory to avoid frequent traveling and to have more parts to service his clients. With the loan he believes he can be more resourced to expand his business. He is a member of a community group, ‘Ima,’ which means 'Amen.' Members guarantee for one another to access the loan and as social collateral to repay the loan. Adams would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more  bicycle parts for servicing and retail.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sr. María tiene 48 años de edad, habitante del barrio el recreo de la capital de Managua, estado civil casada, tiene  dos preciosos hijos de 8 y 12 años de edad, los planes para su familia es asegúrale un patrimonio y un futuro mejor para sus hijos.
Doña María se desempeña como comerciante tiene una pulpería con trece años de experiencia en atención al cliente, inicio su pulpería comercializando los productos esenciales de un hogar los granos básico y verduras, sus objetivos para con su negocio es incrementar el volumen de ventas con nuevos y variados productos de consumo a diario y en ocasiones satisfaciendo la demanda de los clientes. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar nuevos y variados productos como: productos enlatados,  frutas, artículos de belleza y otros productos de uso, aumentando los ingresos y ofreciéndole mayores beneficios  l obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old. She lives in the neighborhood called El Recreo in the capital city of Managua. She is in a common-law marriage, and she has two precious children of 8 and 12 years old. Her plans for her family are to ensure an inheritance and better future for her children. Doña María works in sales. She has a general store and thirteen years of experience in attention to clients. She began her store selling essential household products, like grains and vegetables. Her goals for her business is to increase the volume of sales with a new variety of products for daily consumption and for special occasions, in order to meet the demand of her clients. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, she has managed to buy a new variety of products like canned food, fruits, beauty products, and other useful items, increasing her income and offering her better benefits and a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of items to sell, like canned food, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Laidy

texts.es:
La señorita Laidy Martínez de 20 años de edad vive todavía con sus padres. Terminó la carrera de técnico en farmacia y luego sus padres le habilitaron una farmacia, la cual está administrando desde hace dos años. Su proyecto es seguir estudiando el año próximo la carrera de Bioquímica.

El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de medicamentos en general, perfumes, artículos para regalos, lentes, shampoo, acondicionador, golosinas. De esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes mas variedad de productos, aumentar sus ventas y con eso aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Laidy Martínez is 20 years old and lives with her parents. She is a pharmaceuticals technician and works a pharmacy her parents opened for her, which she had managed for the last 2 years. Her goal is to keep studying to obtain a degree on Biochemistry next year. Laidy is requesting for a loan to purchase drugs in general, perfumes, gift shop items, glasses, shampoo, and candy. This way, she will be able to offer a variety of products to her customers, increase her sales and therefore her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drugs in general, perfumes, gift shop items, glasses, shampoo, and candy

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: El señor Marcos labora para una empresa de pisos y acabados, su esposa la señora Berenice trabaja para una compañía de la ciudad, ellos están solicitando este crédito ya que desean construir una barda en el frente de su casa para mayor privacidad y seguridad de la familia.
texts.en:
Marcos works for a flooring business, his wife Berenice works for a company in the city. They are seeking a loan as they wish to construct a fence in front of their home for greater privacy and security for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buid a fence in front of their home

loans.name: Abel De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Habel de Jesús Reynosa tiene la edad de 22 años, habita en el sector de la Francia ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la esposa trabaja para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar, el también recibe el apoyo de su papá ya que desde muy pequeño se dedica a la agricultura y ellos juntos han logrado establecer su cultivo de piña. Don Habel tiene planes hacia un futuro, de poder establecer mas cultivo y poder construir su vivienda ya que ellos viven en cuarto que le regalo su papá, y su mayor anhelo es poder gozar de una casa digna y un poco mas grande. Con la solicitud de préstamo va invertir en los cultivos de piña en la compra de insumos de abonos y venenos para los cultivos y así vender a mejor precios la producción
texts.en:
Señor Habel de Jesús Reynosa is 22 and lives in the area called Francia in the town of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife, who works to help him with their home's expenses. He also receives support from his father, since they have worked together since he was very young in agriculture to grow pineapple. Don Habel has plans for the future of having a bigger crop and building his home since they now live in a room that his father gave to them. His biggest dream is to be able to enjoy a decent house that is a little bigger. With the request for this loan, he is going to invest in his pineapple crop and buy fertilizers and in this way sell what he produces at better prices.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his crop like fertilizer to produce a good pineapple harvest

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr: Samba est un transporteur inter-urbain qui exploite l'axe Ziguinchor - Sao Domingos (Guinée Bissau) et Ziguinchor-Cpa Skiring. Ce habitant du quartier de Tiléne, marié et pére de 4 enfants gagne sa vie grâce à son activité. Il sollicite ce prêt pour améliorer un peu le confort en réfection les siéges.
texts.en:
Samba is an inter-urban carrier who serves the line Ziguinchor - Sao Domingos (Guinée Bissau) and Ziguinchor-Cpa Skiring. A resident of the Tiléne district, he is married and the father of four. He is making a living, thanks to this business, and is requesting this loan to improve his comfort a little by repairing his seats.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Transport

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Señora María de 41 años de edad está felizmente casada hace 20 años con el Señor Esteban Martínez de  47 años. El matrimonio tiene dos hijos, de los cuales uno  de ellos tiene un taller de motos en el cual le va muy bien y ayuda con los gastos de la casa a sus padres. 
 Doña María se encuentra al frente de una Despensa  en el cual se inició hace 2 años con un ahorro que contaba  Actualmente ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada.  Como sueño personal desea ampliar su negocio y poder así ofrecer más variedades de productos  a su clientela.
La clienta solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías varias como frutas, pan dulces, sidra ya que en estas fiestas de fin de año posee gran demanda de estos productos. También hortalizas y carne.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old. She’s been happily married to Esteban Martínez of 47 for 20 years. They have two children. One of them owns a successful motor shop and helps his parents with the home expenses. María works at the grocery shop she opened 2 years ago using her savings. Today she has a vast clientele. Her dream is to enhance her business so she can offer a larger variety of products to her customers. María is requesting for a loan to purchase miscellaneous products such as fruit, pantone, cider and other items for sale that are usually on demand during the end of the year festivities. She will also purchase vegetables and meat.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase fruit, meat, cider, panetone, etc...

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is 32 years old. She is divorced and has no children. Usually she sells clothing at the market, but during Christmas holidays she sells decorations. This is something she likes to do, and it yields good profit -- about 4,000 UAH during the holiday season.

Larisa would like to get a loan of 5,500 UAH to increase her inventory. The decorations she offers her clients are not very expensive and are in high demand. Larisa believes that the loan would help her to make good sales this holiday season.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of decorations this holiday season

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia E. is 45 years old. She’s married to Miguel Bogado of 46. They have 5 children. She has owned a shop for 16 years. Ofelia began selling used clothes at a local market and was very successful. With time, she and her husband bought a truck to provide their customers with a freight service that was used to purchase products directly from the factories, being cement one of their main products, which they sell as retailers and wholesalers. The loan will be used to purchase cement in bulk for retailing. Their project includes buying another truck to satisfy the demand of their fixed clientele for load transport. It is their desire to live in a country with less corruption so more business companies could invest in the local market, which would generate more jobs.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Ofelia E. con 45 años de edad, está casada con el señor Miguel Bogado de 46 años. Ambos son padres de 5 hijos. Se dedica al comercio hace más de 16 años, comenzó vendiendo ropas usadas en el mercado, el cual tuvo mucho éxito y con el tiempo se compraron un camión con el cual realizan servicios de fletes y también es aprovechado para realizar compra de productos directamente desde las fabricas, como por ejemplo el cemento, el cual es comercializado al por mayor y menor. El dinero del préstamo será destinado a la compra de cemento en cantidad para su posterior venta. El proyecto que tienen es la compra de un camión más ya que cuentan con clientela segura para el servicio de transporte de cargas. Desean un país con menos corrupción para que haya mayor interés de empresarios extranjeros en invertir en el paisa para generar mayores fuentes de trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase cement

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Mme Aissatou D. est une brave dame qui tient un petit commerce en face de son domicile. Avec cette activité elle soutient son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de leurs 3 enfants. Cette résidente du populaire quartier de Boucotte demande ce crédit pour augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mrs Aissatou D. is a brave woman who runs a small shop opposite her home. Thanks to this business, she helps her husband in providing for their 3 children. She lives in the popular Boucotte neighborhood and seeks this loan to increase her income.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El Sr. Porfirio S. de 48 años, está casado hace 24 años con la Sra. María Dávalos de 42 años de edad. La pareja tiene dos hijos, una mujer de 19 y un varón de 15 años de edad respectivamente, la mayor se encuentra estudiando el primer año de la universidad, mientras que el menor se encuentra cursando el 9º grado del nivel medio. 
Don Porfirio fue empleado de la fábrica de Coca Cola de esta ciudad, hasta que se cerró la fabrica en el año de 1997; y con la liquidación de su  antigüedad emprendió su negocio de venta de terciadas (materia prima utilizada para la fabricación de muebles) entregando a domicilio y para esto cuenta con una camioneta en el cual se moviliza. Su señora se dedica a la  compra y venta de gallinas. 
El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de terciadas debido a la gran demanda que tiene, además comprando en cantidad se consigue a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Porfirio S. is 48 years old. He’s been married to María Dávalos of 42 for 24 years. They have two children, a girl of 19 and a boy of 15. The oldest is currently attending her first year in college and the youngest is in 9th grade. Porfirio was an employee of the Coca Cola Company of the city, but the factory closed in 1997. Using the settlement money he received he opened a plywood business (selling raw material for furniture manufacturing) including delivery, for which he uses a small truck. His wife sells and buys chicken. Porfirio is requesting for a loan to purchase plywood in bulk to satisfy the high demand of his products, especially because he gets a better price if he purchase products in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase plywood material

loans.name: Agbelengo

texts.fr: Agbelengo A. est âgé de 33 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants tous à l’école. Il réside à Lavie, un village situé à environ 135 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Là, il taille les pierres que la population utilise dans la construction. Ce commerce est très florissant étant donné que la demande est très forte et il demeure le principal vendeur. Avec ce crédit, il espère accroître son exploitation afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Agbelengo A. is 33 years old and the father of two school-attending children. He lives in Lavie, a village located approximately 135 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. There, he carves stones used for construction. This business is very flourishing since the demand is high and he is the main supplier. With this loan, he hopes to expand his quarry to better meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his quarry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy oil palm trees

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Don Ramón C. de 43 años de edad está casado hace 20 años con Doña Celina Vázquez, de 44 años de edad. El matrimonio tiene 4 hijos de 19, 14, 11 y 5 años de edad; de los cuales, el mayor esta en el primer año de la universidad, el segundo esta en el 1º de la media, el tercero está cursando el 7º grado. y el último este año empezó con el pre escolar.
El Señor Ramón se encuentra trabajando en el rubro de la carpintería desde hace 9 años, se había iniciado en este oficio con un pequeño ahorro que contaba de su antiguo trabajo, que fue el macate (venta ambulante), el cual tuvo que abandonar por un accidente de tránsito que había sufrido. En su carpintería recibe la ayuda de su señora y su hijo mayor.
El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de materias primas, tales como: maderas, terciadas, pegamentos, clavos y otros. Ya que él distribuye sus productos en diferentes mueblerías y cuenta con mucha demanda por la buena calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramón C. is 43 years old and has been married for 20 years to 44 year old Mrs. Celina Vázquez. The couple has 4 children ages 19, 14, 11 and 5 years old. The oldest is in the first year of studies at the university, the second in the first year of high school, the third in 7th grade and the last began preschool this year. Ramón has been working in the field of carpentry for 9 years, starting his business with a small savings he had from his previous job as a street vendor, which he left because of a traffic accident. His wife and oldest son help him with his carpentry business. The client is seeking a loan to buy materials such as: wood, plywood, glue, nails, and more. He distributes his products in different furniture stores and has a lot of demand because of the good quality of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood, plywood, glue, nails, etc.

loans.name: Sandro

texts.es:
El Sr. Sandro Benítez de 29 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Marlene Speratti, ellos tienen una hija de 3 años.
   Don Sandro desde muy joven empezó a trabajar como empleado de un aserradero, él estudiaba y trabajaba al mismo tiempo, así llegó a pagar todos sus estudios ya que su familia es de escasos recursos, el estudió la carrera de mecánica dental, que es la profesión que está ejerciendo en la actualidad, gracias a la calidad de sus trabajos y a la buena atención que él les ofrece ya tiene una clientela que concurre a su consultorio  constantemente.
   El Sr. Sandro, utilizaría este crédito para comprar un sillón odontológico, lo cual le servirá para seguir mejorando su servicio.
texts.en:
Mr. Sandro Benítez is 29 years old, married to Mrs. Marlene Speratti, and they have a 3 year old daughter. Sandro began to work as an employee in a sawmill at a young age. He used to study and work at the same time, and in this way was able to pay all his studies as his family had few resources. He studied for a career as a laboratory dental technician, which is his profession today. Thanks to the quality of his work and to the good customer service that he offers he has a constant flow of customers to his office. Sandro will use this loan to buy a dentist chair which will allow him to continue improving his service.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dentist chair

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formo en el Barrio Constitución de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, se juntaron 18 señoras que  poseen  un gran espíritu emprendedor y deseo de trabajar en conjunto a ayudarse de forma solidaria y a ser responsables por un crédito, con el fin de un cambio en sus vidas en forma personal y económico.
Son personas trabajadoras, luchadoras y con mucha esperanza de cambio. Son Señoras de escasos recursos que viven una lucha diaria para mantener a su familia, con ayuda de sus maridos las mismas tienen el entusiasmo y muchas ganas de superarse  económicamente.
Solicitan créditos con montos entre gs. 300.000 y gs. 500.000, cada una. El detalle de actividades que realizan es como sigue:    
María Nidia R. R.	Modista
Saturnina M. 	Mueblería
Lucia Mabel Gómez	Vendedora ambulante
Norma Beatriz R.	Vendedora ambulante
Rosalba S. Peralta	Vendedora ambulante
Costancia L.	Vendedora ambulante
Gricelda González	Vendedora ambulante
Victorina O. Amarilla	Vendedora de remedios 
Marciana B. Irala	Vendedora de Frutas y Verduras
Dionicia Echeverría	Despensa
Sonia Narcisa R. R.	Vendedora ambulante
Claudelina M. Báez	Vendedora de Frutas y Verduras
Maria Hilda M.	Vendedora ambulante
Antonia Martínez	Vendedora de Frutas y Verduras
Ana Gómez Cáceres	Vendedora ambulante
Nilse Ramona A.	Carpintería
Crisilda O. Noguera	Vendedora ambulante
Bernarda R. Nuñez	Vendedora ambulante

Cada Señora integrante de este grupo tiene un trabajo especifico, y el préstamo será utilizado en forma individual por las mismas, las vendedoras ambulantes para la compra de más mercaderías para vender como artículos para el hogar, sábanas, macetas, colchas, ropas, zapatos, manteles, juguetes, entre otros. Las almaceneras para comprar productos que ya le están faltando en su negocio: frutas, verduras, remedios caseros o de venta libre, sidra, pan dulce, carnes, etc.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the Constitución neighborhood in the city of Caaguazú. Eighteen women came together who have a big enterprising spirit and the desire to work together in a supportive manner to be responsible for a credit, with the goal of changing their lives in a personal and economic way. They are hard-working, determined women with a lot of hope for change. They are women of scarce resources who live a daily fight to support their family. With the help of their husbands, they have the enthusiasm and the desire to get ahead economically. Each one of them is requesting a loan between 300,000 and 500,000 guaranís ($62 to $104). The activities that these women carry out are: María Nidia R. R.: Seamstress Saturnina M.: Furniture sales Lucia Mabel Gómez: Street vendor Norma Beatriz R.: Street vendor Rosalba S. Peralta: Street vendor Costancia L.: Street vendor Gricelda González: Street vendor Victorina O. Amarilla: Home remedy sales Marciana B. Irala: Fruit and vegetable sales Dionicia Echeverría: Grocery store Sonia Narcisa R. R.: Street vendor Claudelina M. Báez: Fruit and vegetable sales Maria Hilda M.: Street vendor Antonia Martínez: Fruit and vegetable sales Ana Gómez Cáceres: Street vendor Nilse Ramona A.; Carpentry Crisilda O. Noguera: Street vendor Bernarda R. Nuñez: Street vendor Each woman who is a member of this group has a specific job, and the loan will be used in an individual manner by each of them. The street vendors will buy more merchandise to sell such as: items for the home, sheets, flower pots, bedspreads, clothing, shoes, tablecloths, toys, etc. Those with stores will purchase products that they need for their businesses: fruits, vegetables, home remedies, cider, bread, meat, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit, vegetables, home remedies, bedspreads, sheets, items for the home, clothing, shoes, cider, bread, meat, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Independientes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formo en el Barrio Empalado Ari de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, se juntaron 18 señoras  dispuestas a progresar con la Ayuda de la Fundación Paraguaya, las mismas poseen  un gran espíritu emprendedor y  sobre todo el compromiso a ayudarse en forma solidaria y a  ser responsables por un crédito, con el fin de un cambio en sus vidas en forma personal y económico.
Son personas muy humildes y trabajadoras cada una trata de sobrellevar la situación económica de su familia con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Porque son Señoras que luchan día a día y sin perder el entusiasmo ni la fuerza de desistir cuando todo está mal económicamente. Las mismas solicitan un crédito de 500.000 gs. y 300.000 gs. Ellas están convencidas que el apoyo que reciben es único es por eso que  serán muy responsables y solidarías entre las mismas, tomando así un compromiso conjunto.

El detalle de actividades que realiza cada una es como sigue:
Brigida P.	Vendedora Ambulante
Aureliana B. Mendiza	Venta de Gallinas y carnes de Cerdo
Norma Beatriz L.	Vendedora Ambulante
María Cristina A. Bobadilla	Venta de Frutas y Verduras

Laura López L.	Almacén
Sunilda González de A	Vendedora Ambulante
Maria Estela González	Almacén
Gabriela V.	Vendedora Ambulante
Maura Ysabel Ríz Díaz	Vendedora Ambulante
Cristina C. de F	Vendedora Ambulante
Julia González Vazquez	Vendedora Ambulante
Patrocinia González	Vendedora Ambulante
Barcilicia L.	Vendedora Ambulante
Antonia Martínez	Vendedora Ambulante
Nicolasa V. de Díaz	Vendedora Ambulante
Magdalena López	Mercería
Fidelina Cáceres Hermosilla	Vendedora Ambulante
María Felisa López	Vendedora de miel de Abejas



El crédito solicitado será para uso de las integrantes en forma individual ya que cada una tiene un trabajo en que invertir el préstamo, las vendedoras ambulantes para la compra de más mercaderías para vender en estas fiestas de fin de año como juguetes, artículos para el hogar, productos de limpieza entre otros. Las almaceneras para renovar su stock comprando frutas, carnes, lácteos, gaseosas, verduras, gallinas y miel de abeja.
texts.en:
This group began in the Empalado Ari neighborhood of Caaguazú city and is made up of 18 women seeking to improve their lives with the help of Fundación Paraguaya. These women possess a great entrepreneurial spirit and above all are dedicated to responsibly managing their group loan, with the intent of changing their lives both personally and financially. They are humble, hard workers; each woman is trying to overcome her family’s financial situation with much effort and dedication. The women fight day after day, without losing enthusiasm or energy despite economic hardships. These same women are seeking a loan of 500,000 PYG and 300,000 PYG. They realize this is a unique opportunity and will be very responsible and committed to repaying the loan together. Each woman’s work is as follows: Brigida P. – cart vendor Aureliana B. Mendiza – sells poultry and pork products Norma Beatriz L. – cart vendor María Cristina A. Bobadilla – sells fruits and vegetables Laura López L. – store owner Sunilda González de A – cart vendor Maria Estela González – store owner Gabriela V. – cart vendor Maura Ysabel Ríz Díaz – cart vendor Cristina C. de F – cart vendor Julia González Vazquez – cart vendor Patrocinia González – cart vendor Barcilicia L. – cart vendor Antonia Martínez – cart vendor Nicolasa V. de Díaz – cart vendor Magdalena López – owns hardware store Fidelina Cáceres Hermosilla – cart vendor María Felisa López – sells honey The loan will be used to invest in each woman’s business. Vendors will buy merchandise to sell at year-end festivals, such as toys, home items, cleaning products, etc. The store owners will restock their fruit, meat, dairy products, sodas, vegetables, poultry and honey.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (sweet bread, cider, meat, poultry, fruit, vegetables, honey, cleaning and household items, bedspread, sheets, clothes, shoes, etc.)

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge F. tiene 37 años de edad, esta casado y vive armoniosamente con su esposa, Laura Blanco de 27 años de edad, tienen dos hijos menores en edad escolar, que participan de los quehaceres de la casa. 
Esta pareja se dedica a la venta de calzados y celulares a 50 metros del centro comercial nº 1 de la Ciudad de Cnel. Oviedo, conocieron el negocio a través del padre de Laura, quien es un gran emprendedor, luego de contraer nupcias ellos decidieron aceptar el desafío de iniciar el micro emprendimiento por sí solos, la experiencia de la señora, que proviene de una familia de comerciantes fijo el rumbo y sus conocimientos de ventas aseguran el éxito del negocio.
El préstamo solicita para la compra de calzados deportivos, y para iniciar un negocio de venta de celulares, venta de accesorios, etc.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge F. is 37-years old and lives happily married with his wife Laura Blanco, 27. They have 2 children, still too young for school, who help with household chores. The couple sells footwear and cellular phones in a shop 50 meters from Centro Comercial nº 1 (a shopping center) in the city of Coronel Oviedo. They started in the business through Laura’s father, an experienced entrepreneur. After marrying they decided to take on the challenge of starting a small business for themselves; Laura’s experience, coming from a family of small business owners, and her sales expertise will ensure the success of the business. The requested loan is for the purchase of athletic shoes and to start a store selling cellular phones and accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of footwear, cellular phones and accessories

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El Sr Nelson M. de 37 años de edad es casado, con Esperanza Valiente de 38 años han procreado tres hijos, todos aun en edad escolar, una en el tercer ciclo educativo, su cónyuge se dedica a la venta de prendas femeninas. 
Nelson hace más de diez años que se dedica a la fabricación de letreros y señales viales, heredó la actividad de su padre que aun le asesora en el trabajo, controlando la calidad de éstos, realiza convenios con los municipios de las ciudades de las zonas aledañas a Cnel. Oviedo, complementa sus ingresos con publicidades callejeras como pasacalles (letreros colgantes) y letreros estáticos. 
También realiza el mantenimiento de las señales antiguas y la sustitución de las que cumplieron su vida útil. El préstamo solicita para la compra de pinceles y pinturas, chapas, lonas, caños.
texts.en:
Mr. Nelson M. is 37-years old and married to Esperanza Valiente, 38, who sells women’s clothes. They have 3 children, all in school, and one of which is in the 3rd grade. For over 10 years, Nelson has produced signs and road signs. He inherited the business from his father, who still assesses the work quality and negotiates agreements with towns neighboring Coronel Oviedo. He complements his income with street advertising such as hanging and stand-alone signs. He also maintains and replaces older street signs. The loan he asks for will be used to buy brushes, paints, sheets, canvas, and pipes.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of brushes, paint, sheets, canvas, and pipes.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosenda V. tiene 67 años de edad esta casada con don Eugenio Ayala de 76 años de edad, ambos se ocupan de administrar el negocio, don Eugenio es el responsable de las compras, y reposición de las mercaderías en el local, la microempresa funciona en su domicilio desde que se creó, hace más de 10 años.
Tienen cinco hijos todos casados, la hija menor es la única que aun vive con ellos, y tiene también su propio negocio una farmacia. La señora Rosenda siempre se dedico a este rubro y desde 1.998 en su propio local, a pesar de su edad y la oposición de sus hijos, ella sigue emprendiendo con éxito esta actividad que conoce a profundidad.
El crédito será destinado a la compra de medicamentos de venta libre, sidras, vinos, cervezas fuegos artificiales etc. para comercializar en estas fiestas.
texts.en:
Rosenda V. is 67 years old and married to Eugenio Ayala, who is 76 years old. They both work in their business; Eugenio is responsible for the purchases and stocking the store, which is has been located in their house since it was started more than 10 years ago. They have 5 children, all of which are married. The youngest daughter is the only one that still lives with them and also has her own business, a pharmacy. Rosenda has always worked in this field, and since 1998, in her house. Despite her age and the opposition of her children, she continues to have success in this field, which she knows in depth. The loan will be used to purchase over-the-counter medicine, cider, wine, beer, fireworks, etc. to sell during the festival season.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of over-the-counter medicine, cider, beer, fireworks, etc.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El joven Victor M. tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su madre y hermanos, en la casa familiar, donde también se encuentra la microempresa. 
Es estudiante de la Universidad Nacional de Asunción en la facultad de ciencias contables. 
Desde diciembre del 2007, luego de la muerte de su padre se hace responsable de la administración de la empresa familiar, con la ayuda de su madre.  
Posee una carpintería-mueblería, donde fabrican muebles sobre pedido a  medida.
La empresa esta en el ramo desde 1985 y ahora además de fabricar los muebles, comercializan otros artículos tales como sillas de oficina, colchones y muebles de formica.
Es un joven emprendedor, pues aparte de llevar adelante la empresa de su familia, realiza trabajos de contabilidad para otras empresas.
texts.en:
Victor M. is 24 years old, single, and lives with his mother and siblings in the family’s home where we also find his business. He is a student at the Asunción National University studying accounting. After his father’s death in December 2007 he has become responsible for managing the family business, with his mother’s help. He owns a carpentry-furniture business, where he makes furniture to order. The business has been open since 1985 and now in addition to making furniture they sell other items such as office chairs, mattresses, and Formica furniture. He is an enterprising young man, in addition to carrying forward the family business he is handling the accounting for other businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood to make furniture, matresses, office chairs, etc.

loans.name: Peniel Group

texts.es: El grupo "Peniel " esta conformado por 15 miembros los cuales están precedidos por la señora Nelva Mery. En su Mayoría las socias se dedican al comercio D. diferentes productos como a la venta D. ropa, artesanías, comida, material escolar, mantas tejidas a mano y otros dependiendo D. la época del año. Las Socias saben que existe la competencia desleal ene el mercado pero ellas tienen experiencia en sus rubros y saben como enfrentarla, son personas muy honradas, responsables y cumplidas como lo han demostrado en anteriores financiamiento. El crédito esta destinado al mejoramiento D. la mercadería a la venta así como para el aumento D. sus insumos y materiales. Las socias tienen experiencia en financiamientos grupales por lo que saben el sistema D. trabajo y la responsabilidad que se requiere para obtener cumplir con los pagos y no fallar ni a la institución ni a los miembros D. su grupo.
texts.en:
The "Peniel" group is composed by 15 members managed by Nelva Mery L. P.. Most of their members are business men and women who sell clothes, handicrafts, food, school supplies, hand-maD. mats and others depending on the time of the year. Members are alert for dishonest competitors but they have experience in their fields and know how to face the hard times. They are very hard working, honest and responsible people as they have proven to be in their previous financing projects. The loan will be used to purchase more products for sale, as well as supplies and material. Members have group financing experience so they are familiar with the system and they are aware of the responsibility required to make timely payments not to let down the institution or the other members of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena L., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operative Capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua la señora Elizabeth A. se dedica a atender su tienda de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños de todas las edades.

Su actividad la realiza todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana y atiende a sus clientes muy alegremente ofertando sus productos. El motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la ropa ya que le urge obtenerla para ofrecerla y continuar con su pequeño negocio en desarrollo.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in the capital city of Managua, Ms. Elizabeth A. runs a store selling clothes for men, women and children of all ages. She works every day from early in the morning and attends to her clients in a friendly manner when offering them products. The reason that Elizabeth has come to Ceprodel is to take out a loan for the purchase of clothing, which she now needs to be able to continue offering products in her small store and help it develop.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Carolina De Los Angeles

texts.es:
El negocio de venta de verduras requiere de mucho esfuerzo por el motive de que debe darse una masiva publicidad ya que si no se vende por ser productos perecederos pueden dañarse por completo.

Consciente de esta situación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua la señora Carolina Villegas se dedica a la venta de verduras las cuales las comercializa en su casa de habitación y la razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere de la compra de los plátanos, tomates y chiltomas para continuar en su negocio . Espera que su crédito será otorgado y de esta forma se beneficiará grandemente.
texts.en:
The vegetable sale business requires a great deal of effort, as the shop owner must massively advertise his products as if they are not sold on time, due to their non-durable nature, they can be completely ruined. In spite and aware of this situation Carolina Villegas sells vegetables at home in the municipality of Sandino City in the city of Managua. She came to Ceprodel to request for help to purchase bananas, tomatoes, chilies and peppers to keep her business running. She hopes she will be able to obtain this loan, and she promise she will greatly take advance of it.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Elba Rosa

texts.es:
Elba Rosa D. es una dama muy esforzada que con gran esfuerzo se ha dedicado a su negocio de venta de ropa el cual ha logrado ir mejorando poco a poco a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido.

El desarrollo del negocio se lo debe a Ceprodel ya que le ha beneficiado con créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de la ropa para abastecer sus estantes. Hoy en día con el compromiso de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación ha decido una vez mas acudir a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de la ropa y así continuar con el negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Elba Rosa D. is a very determined woman who has dedicated herself with much effort to her business of clothing sales. She has managed to improve it little by little as time has passed. She owes the development of the business to Ceprodel since she has benefited from credits that she has used to purchase clothing to stock her shelves. Today with the obligation she has of bringing home an income, she has decided once more to turn to Ceprodel to obtain a credit to purchase clothing and continue with her business that needs her support so much.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luís tiene 21 años, habita en el  barrio Reparto Shick, de estado civil soltero, no tiene hijos. Los planes para con su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida y obtener con su esfuerzo un patrimonio para el futuro de la familia que tendrá. De profesión zapatero iniciando desde hace nueve años de experiencia en el ramo de la remodelación de zapatos. Sus metas en el ámbito profesional  es crecer, aumentar sus ingresos y alcanzar una mejor estabilidad económica Gracias a los prestamos  de Afodenic lograra brindarle a sus clientes una mejor atención y un servicio rápido con la compra de otras  maquinas de zapaterías.
texts.en:
Luís is 21 years old, lives in the Reparto Shick neighborhood, is single and does not have any children. His plans for his family are to improve his standards of living and use his strengths to obtain a legacy for the future family he will have one day. He has been a shoe cobbler for 9 years, working on repairing shoes. His professional goals are to grow, increase his income and achieve a better economic stability. Thanks to Afodenic’s loans he will be able to provide his customers better attention and quick service with the purchase of other shoe repair machines.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a machine and raw materials for his shoe repair business

loans.name: María Inocente

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora María Inocente se dedica a laborar fuertemente para llevar el sustento a su hogar y beneficiar a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar y esto lo está haciendo por medio de la instalación de un panel solar en su vivienda ya que en la zona donde ella vive no se cuenta con energía eléctrica.

Por este motive ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita  el pago del panel solar para continuar en sus labores y a la vez brindándole las condiciones necesarias a su pequeño para que se desarrolle.
texts.en:
In the area of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, señora María Inocente works hard to provide income for her home and to benefit her young, school-aged son. She is doing this by installing a solar panel on her home since the area in which she lives doesn't have electricity. This is why she has turned to Ceprodel to be benefited with a credit that will allow her to pay for the solar panel and continue with her work and at the same time offer the necessary conditions to her son so he will develop.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a solar panel for her home

loans.name: Zeyla Rosa

texts.es: Zeyla Rosa casada, tiene una niña de 4 años de edad, trabaja como maestra de educacion secundaria, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido que trabaja como promotor de un proyecto, ambos son muy responsables.  Con esfuerzo de ambos han logrado construir su humilde vivienda, pero necesitan brindarle mas condiciones a su pequeña hija, por lo que solicitan el credito para la construccion de un baño de concreto y techo.  Zeyla es conocida en su barrio por ser responsable, su mayor sueño es seguir acondicionando su casa, pues en el futuro es el patrimonio que dejara a su pequeñita.
texts.en:
Zeyla Rosa is married and has a 4 year old daughter. She works as a high school teacher. She relies on her husband’s support, and he works as a projector manager. They are both very responsible. With effort they have been able to construct a humble home, but they need to provide better living conditions for their small daughter, so they are asking for a loan to build a bathroom out of concrete and a roof. Zeyla is known in her neighborhood as being responsible, her greatest dream is to continue air conditioning her home, because in the future this is the legacy she will leave to her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bathroom

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
El señor Virgilio M. M. esta agradecido por el gran apoyo que le brindaron con su anterior crédito.
Su negocio ya esta establecido en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad por su edad ya no puede andar ofreciendo sus productos por las calles; el desea recibir nuevamente el apoyo para surtir su negocio con mas variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Señor Virgilio M. M. is thankful for the great support you provided him with his previous credit. His business is established in a central location in the city since he can no longer walk through the streets offering his products because of his age. He hopes to receive your support again to supply his business with more variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia es soltera, de 48 años de edad, tiene 2 hijas, una es profesional y la otra esta estudiando en la universidad; trabaja como conserje, alquila un pequeño cuarto para vivir con sus hijas, esta incerta en los proyectos del INVUR y la Alcaldia, y ha logrado la construccion de una vivienda, sin embargo no esta finalizada , está solicitando su credito numero 5 para poder comprar ventanas de metal y vidrio y anexar las berjas, en el futuro cuando su hija halla terminado sus estudios y encuentre un trabajo ayudara a su mamá a ampliar un poco mas la vivienda.  Antonia sueña con ver su casita con comodidades para sus hijas, pues es el patrimonio que les dejara.
texts.en:
Antonia is single, is 48, and has 2 daughters. One is a professional and one is studying in college. She works as a receptionist. She rents a small room to live in with her daughters, which is located in the INVUR and city projects. She has succeeded in having a home constructed, but it still isn't completed. She is requesting her fifth credit to purchase windows of metal and glass and to attach bars to them. In the future when her daughter has finished school and has found a job, she will help her mother expand the home a little more. Antonia dreams about seeing her home with comforts for her daughters since it is the inheritance that she will leave them.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of windows and bars

loans.name: Sarei's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarei C. is a leader of a group with four members who all live in Me Meang village in KampO. Chhnang province. She is 41 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Sum Yath, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice. They face a problem because their field is infertile and thus yields poor crops. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sarei C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her land more productive. 
One member of this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has an overall delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her land more productive.

loans.name: Maria Atanacia

texts.es:
Doña María tiene ya mas de 20 años con su negocio de abarrotes este ha sido su fuente de ingresos. 
Desea que su negocio tenga más variedad de productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir el negocio.
En la colonia donde está establecida la tienda  solo está ella así que tiene demanda de productos y buenas ventas.
texts.en:
Doña María has had her grocery business for more than twenty years, and it has been her source of income. She wants her business to have more variety of products to offer her customers, but she doesn't have the necessary capital to supply her business. In the area where she lives, her store is established as the only one, so she has a demand for her products and good sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Rafael es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos de edad escolar para los cuales quiere lo mejor para ellos.
Con sus ahorros ha construido un cuarto, pero le falta colocarle el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que el cuarto sea más seguro y duradero.
Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Señor Rafael is the father of two school-aged children for whom he wants the best. With his savings, he has constructed a room, but he still needs to put a roof on it. He has planned to make a concrete slab so the room will be safer and more durable. His hope is that his children will have their own room and will live better.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make a concrete slab

loans.name: Nupcia Nuvinia

texts.es: Doña Nupcia es casada, de 53 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos, 5 casados y 1 estudiante de secundaria, de los casados uno habita con ella y trabaja como vigilante en SERVIPRO, su esposo trabaja como CPF en un Hotel y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.  Nupcia esta solicitando su 3er credito y lo utilizara para la compra de perlines y puertas para su casa y tener mayor seguridad, los creditos anteriores los utilizó para comprar materiales de construccion, ella es una persona responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y desea continuar trabajando con AFODENIC, pues es la unica financiera que tiene politicas flexibles para con sus clientes, ademas su personal da un trato especial a los clientes por lo que se siente satisfecha.  El mayor deseo de doña Nupcia es tener un techo digno para cuando su esposo y ella esten jubilados.
texts.en:
Doña Nupcia is married, is 53, and has 6 children. Five are married and one is a high school student. Of the ones who are married, one lives with her and works as a security guard at SERVIPRO. Her husband works as a watchman at a hotel and helps her with the home's expenses. Nupcia is requesting her third credit and will use it to purchase beams and gates for her house to have more security. Her previous credits were used to purchase construction materials. She is responsible with her payments and hopes to continue working with AFODENIC since it is the only financier that has flexible policies with its clients. Its personnel also gives good treatment to their clients so they feel satisfied. Doña Nupcia's biggest wish is to have a decent roof for when she and her husband are retired.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beams and gates

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Van H. is the group leader of six members who all live in Kandal Kraom village in Kandal province. He is a fisherman. In his fishing business, he now faces a problem because he does not have fishnets and a boat with a motor to go fishing. Thus, Mr. Van H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy them for this purpose. He hopes to increase his income and improve the living conditions of his family with this loan.

His wife, Mrs. Chhem Saroeun, is working in a garment factory. Mr. Van H. is 31 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only two years old.

Another member of this loan group, Mrs. Navy S. did not come to take the loan but her husband did, so he is present in the picture instead of his wife.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and a boat with a motor for his business

loans.name: Jeaneth Del Carmen

texts.es: Jeaneth es soltera, de 44 años de edad, tiene una hija de 24 años de edad estudiante del 5to año de ingenieria en computacion, esta solicitando su 8vo credito para mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y el piso del dormitorio de su hija ya que pronto sera una profesional y quiere brindarle las condiciones basicas.  Con los creditos anteriores logro repellar y hacer la acera de su casa, poco a poco ha ido inviertiendo sus creditos en mejorar su vivienda pues con su salario se le hace imposible, pero con la atencion que ha recibido por parte de AFODENIC ha ido logrando cumplir sus sueños y espera poder llegar en un futuro a ser la propietaria de una vivienda digna para ella y su hija, que las madres hacen su mayor esfuerzo y sacrificio por el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jeaneth is single, is 44, and has one daughter who is 24 and in her fifth year of studying computer engineering. She is requesting her eighth credit to improve her home by putting on a new roof and putting a new floor in her daughter's bedroom. Her daughter will soon be a professional, and she wants to provide her with basic conditions. With her previous credits, she replastered and put a sidewalk outside of her home. Little by little she has invested her credits in improving her home since with her salary it would be impossible. But with the attention she has received from AFODENIC, she has succeeded in fulfilling her dreams and hopes to be able to arrive at a future where she will be the owner of a decent home for her and her daughter since mothers make their best effort and sacrifice for the well-being of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put a new roof on her home and replace a bedroom floor

loans.name: Cristhian Esmeralda

texts.es: Cristhian es soltera, tiene 23 años de edad, no tiene hijos, esta solicitando su 7mo credito, el que utilizara para iniciar la construccion de su vivienda en el terreno que esta poniendo en garantia, los creditos anteriores los utilizo para mejorar la vivienda de su mamá donde ella habita en su compañia, ya ques hija unica, pero considera que es tiempo de pensar en ella y aprovechar el tiempo ya que por su edad puede hacerle frente a la construccion de su propia vivienda, si el credito no es suficiente para cumplir con su objetivo, espera quedar siempre bien y continuar trabajando con AFODENIC hasta cumplir con su sueño de tener su propia vivienda con todas las condiciones que todo ser humano necesita para sentirse bien.
texts.en:
Cristhian is single, is 23, and doesn't have children. She is requesting her seventh loan, which she will use to start constructing her home on the land that she is using as collateral. She used her previous credits to improve her mother's home where she lives as well since she is an only child. She thinks that it is time to think about herself and to make the most of this time since at her age she can meet the construction costs of her own home. If the credit isn't enough to meet her objective, she hopes to continue working with AFODENIC until she fulfills her dream of having her own home with all of the conditions that every human being needs to feel well.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Shum Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chan S. is the village bank president for eight people who all live in Svay Ming village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chan S. is 48 years old and is a widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Since her children's workplace is far from their house, they pay a lot of money for a motorbike taxi. Thus, Mrs. Chan S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her children to use to go to work and she hopes to reduce her family expenses in this way.

loans.use: to add her savings to buy a motorbike for her children to use to go to work

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Mrs. Pech R. is a 33-year-old and lives in Roka village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Choeun Chea, are grocers who own a small store in their house where they sell grocery products. Since their business is going well, they want to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries for her inventory. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She has four children who are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries  for her inventory

loans.name: Mr. Vat Von Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people who live in Srae Kouk village in Kandal province formed a village bank and Mr. Vat V. is the village bank president. He and his wife, Mrs. So Phan, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Since it is now the rice harvesting season, they do not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest rice. Thus, Mr. Vat V. decided to request a loan to hire laborers to harvest rice on his field. He is 60 years old and the father of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.      
This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To request a loan to hire laborers to harvest rice on his field.

loans.name: Sambou

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambou P. is 37 years old and she lives in Lvea Sor Kraum village in Kandal province. She sells bananas in the local market. She is a widow with three children, one of whom sells groceries for the owner of a grocery store;  the others are enrolled in the local school. 

Although Mrs. Sambou P. tries to work hard, she still earns less income than she needs to support her family, and her family members still live in an old house. In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Sambou P. has decided to ask for a loan. She will use the loan money, along with her savings, to buy steel and timber to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy steel and timber to build a new house for her family

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom C. is the president of a village bank in Phum Dabprambei village in Kampong Chhnang province. There are sixteen people in her village bank.

Mrs. Mom C. breeds pigs. Since her pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she has decided to request a loan to buy more piglets for her breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions when she sells the pigs that she buys with this loan. 

Her husband, Mr. Prum Saren, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Mrs. Mom C. is 40 years old and the mother of five children. Two of her children are workers, two more attend the local school, and the youngest is just five years old.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Mr. Ket Kheav Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Ket K. is the president of a village bank in Phum Dabprambei village in Kampong Cham province. There are thirteen people in the village bank, all of whom live in the same village.

Mr. Ket K. and his wife, Mrs. Aum Neang, are grocers who own a small store in the local market. Since they have a lot of customers who have many demands, they want to expand their business. Mr. Ket K. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries for his inventory. He hopes to increase his income and to provide a better life for his children. 

Mr. Ket K. is 46 years old and the father of seven children, three of whom are workers in different positions, while the others attend the local school. 

Mrs. Srei Em S. did not come to the village bank meeting to get the loan, but her husband came, so he is presented picture, instead of his wife.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for his inventory.

loans.name: Mr. Choeun Kev Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of twenty-four members, is located in Phum Dabprambei village in Kampong Cham province. Each bank member plans to use their share of the loan for different purposes. 

Mr. Choeun K., the village bank president, was selected by the members. He is a laborer who earns a small income that supports his family. His wife, Mrs. Mao Yath, is a pig breeder. Since her breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. 

Thus, Mr. Choeun K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for his wife's breeding business. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions by selling the pigs that they buy with the loan. He is 41 years old and the father of three children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for his wife's pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sithat Ung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people who live in Phum Dabprambei village in Kampong Cham province comprise this village bank. Each of the members will use their loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Sithat U. is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Seim Oul, are laborers. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their household. 

To improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sithat U. has decided to request a loan to buy a cow to start a  breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. 

She is 49 years old and the mother of six children. Two of her children are laborers, three attend the local school, and the youngest is just five years old.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un S., 47, lives with her husband and two of her five children in the Siem Reap Province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make $5.5 each day. During the past year, the weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia and inflation has also been spiraling out of control. These factors have led to a difficult economic year for many Cambodians including Un S.. She is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer and gas for the farm. She hopes this will help increase her current profits and prospects for the future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and gas

loans.name: Tla

texts.en:
Tla S., 28, lives with her husband and their three children in the Siem Reap province. She is a farmer who makes $1.5 per day. Her husband works as both a farmer and a fisherman, earning on average $2 a day. One of their children is attending school, while the other two remain too young. Farming has been difficult in the past year due to poor weather conditions. Mrs. Tla S. is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers for the farm. 

Her husband is pictured.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mr. Arng Kim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Arng K. is the elected president of the village bank located in Phum Dabprambei village in Kampong Cham Province. The village bank consists of twenty members. He and his wife, Mrs. Moeurn Da, are laborers. He is 48 years old and the father of five children. Three of their children are laborers, one is enrolled in the local school and the youngest child is less than four years old. 

Even though they work hard, they are unable to earn sufficient income to support their family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Arng K. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase a cow to start cattle breeding business. He hopes to increase income and to provide a better life for his family later.

loans.use: To start cattle breeding business.

loans.name: Pheung

texts.en: Pheung S., 19, lives her husband and child in Siem Reap province. She is a housewife, while her husband is a carpenter who makes boats out of wood. On average, he earns $4 a day. To make more money, Mrs. Pheung S. would like to take out a loan of $500 to purchase more wood for her husband to build more boats.

loans.use: To purchase wood for boats

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam P., 45, is married and lives with three of her six children in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband are rubber workers and they earns a combined income of approximately $6 a day. Two of their children attend school.
Mrs. Tam P. would like to take out a loan of $600 to purchase rice. This rice will be sold to the rubber workers in her area. 

Her husband is pictured.

loans.use: To purchase rice

loans.name: Mr. Oeurn Kroeurn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Oeurn K. is the president of a village bank in Phum Dabprambei village in Kampong Cham province. The bank has twenty members.

Mr. Oeurn K. is 48 years old. He is a laborer who earns a small income that supports his household. To improve his family's living conditions, he has decided to request a loan to buy piglets to start a pig-breeding business. He hopes to increase his income and to provide a better life for his family when he sells his pigs. 

His wife, Mrs. SU. Ny, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. Mr. Oeurn K. has five children. One of the children is a laborer, three are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest is just five years old.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Mrs. Seng Eang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank that is requesting this loan consists of sixteen people who live in Phum Dabprambei village in Kampong Cham province. 

Mrs. Seng E. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Suon Savath, are laborers who earn less income than they need to support their household. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Seng E. has decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a pig-breeding business. 

She is 50 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a laborer, while the other attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Sa Roeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa Roeurn H. is 54 years old and she now lives in Svay Ta Thorm village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Eng Hoeun, are rice middlemen, who buy rice to keep in stock and resell later at better price.

Since this business is going well, they want to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sa Roeurn H. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more rice to keep in stock. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. 

She has three children. One of the children is employed in garment factory, another is a beautician, and the youngest is enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to keep in stock.

loans.name: Pao Yeang

texts.en:
Mr. Pao Yeang S. is 61 years old and he lives in Svay Ta Thorm village in Kampong Cham province. His wife, Mrs. Men Sokhum, is a grocer who owns a small store in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. 

Thus, Mr. Pao Yeang S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries for his wife's inventory. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. 

He has five children. One of the children is a driver, and the others are enrolled in the local school. His wife appears with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Srei Leak

texts.en: Mrs. Srei Leak Y. is a 22-year-old and she now lives in Tuol Sro Lau village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Sun Sok, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate cassava to earn a living. In the plantation, they face a small problem because they do not have enough money to hire laborers to work their field. Thus, Mrs. Srei Leak Y. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to hire laborers to work on their field

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap L. is 44 years old and she lives in Tul Sro Lau village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Leng Seng, are laborers. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn little income which cannot provide a good life for their family. To improve these living conditions, Mrs. Pheap L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to be a motorbike taxi driver. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She has five children, four of whom are attending the local school, while the other is too young to work or study because that child is at the age of five years old. Her husband is also present with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to be a motorbike taxi driver.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha V., a 47-year-old widow, lives in Svay Ta Thorm village in Kampong Cham province. She is a grocer who owns a small store in the market, and she wants to expand her grocery, as she now has a large customer base. She decided to request a loan so that she might purchase more grocery goods and expand her inventory. Mrs. Sokha V. has a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of her grocery store

loans.name: Sren

texts.en: Mrs. Sren C., 50, lives in Odam Raiy village in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder. Her business is doing well and she would like to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Yi Horn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. Mrs. Sren C. has two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other is a laborer.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Mrs. Sophal C. lives in Odam Raiy village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Him Seng Hat, sell cassavas and fish in the local village. They need a motorbike to transport their products. Thus, Mrs. Sophal C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike. The motorbike will reduce the amount of money they have to spend on transportation. Mrs. Sophal C. is 35 years old and the mother of a three-year-old child. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Ni

texts.en: Mrs. Ni C. lives in Svay Ta Thorm village in Kampong Cham province. She is a 34-year-old widow with three children: the oldest is a tailor, the second one attends the local school, and the youngest one is just three years old. Mrs. Ni C.’s oldest child has a problem because her sewing machine is too old and needs to be replaced. Mrs. Ni C. is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some material for her child's business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and some cloths for her child business.

loans.name: Chadudu H Group

texts.en:
Witness has owned a small pharmacy in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for four years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more medicine for her shop and to pay school fees for her children. She hopes the loan will also lead to increased profit.
