loans.name: Chu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Chu Thị L. 40 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị L. là chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Với việc chăn nuôi 100 con gà, 10 con lợn và 4 con bò, thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 3.800.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị L. mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Chu Thi L. is 40 years old. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2005. Currently, the major source of income of Mrs. L.'s family is from raising poultry/livestock and farming. With 100 chickens, 10 pigs and 4 cows, the income of her family reaches VND3,800,000 per month. In this loan cycle, Mrs. L. would like to borrow VND15,000,000 to invest in poultry/livestock raising.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising poultry/livestock

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi: Chị Dương Thị T. năm nay 54 tuổi, chị tham  gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1992. Hiện tại chồng chị làm nghề sửa chữa điện tử tại nhà còn chị chăn nuôi gà ngan với tổng thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng đạt 4.000.000. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn  được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm ngan gà và thức ăn phục vụ chăn nuôi,
texts.en:
Mrs. Duong Thi T. is 54 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 1992. Currently her husband repairs electronic appliance at home, and she raises chickens and ducks with the family average monthly income of VND4,000,000. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy more chickens and ducks and poultry foods.


Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising chickens and ducks

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hòa 53 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1995. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị có một cửa hàng ăn nhỏ, sau khi tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị Hoà đã mạnh dạn vay thêm vốn để mở cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh thịt chó. Với những  món ăn ngon, giá cả hợp lý nên cửa hàng của gia đình chị luôn thu hút được lượng khách hàng rất đông. Công việc kinh doanh phát triển tốt đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 53 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 1995. Before joining the Fund, her family had a small restaurant, and after joining the Fund, Mrs. H. borrowed money to open a restaurant selling dog meat. With delicious dishes and reasonable prices, her restaurant attracts a very high number of customers. The business is going well and brings a monthly income of VND5,000,000 to her family.

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND15,000,000 to expand her family's restaurant business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand restaurant business

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đỗ Thị Liễu 45 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đìnhchị Liệu là chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Với việc chăn nuôi 50 con gà, 10 con lợn và 2 con bò, thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 4.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài ra hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ lương đi làm thuê của chồng nên kinh tế rất ổn định.
Vòng vốn tới chị Liễu  mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Do Thi L. is 45 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2000. Currently, the major source of income of Mrs. L.'s family is from raising poultry/livestock and farming. By raising 50 chickens, 10 pigs, and 2 cows, her family's income is at VND4,000,000 per month. In addition, her family also receives income from the wages for temporary work of her husband. As such, the economic situation of the family is very stable.

In this loan cycle, Mrs. L. would like to borrow VND10,000,000 to invest in raising poultry/livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising poultry/livestock

loans.name: Ngo Thanh

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thanh Tý năm nay 56 tuổi, hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng là cán bộ hưư trí và 2 con đã trưởng thành. Năm 2002 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư kinh doanh bia và ga. Ngoài lương  hưu của chồng và sự hỗ trợ của các con đây cũng là một trong những công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị hiện any với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng/.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư cho kinh doanh.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thanh T. is 56 years old. She lives with her husband, who is a pensioner, and two grown-up children. In 2002, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in beer and gas distribution.Together with the pension of her husband and financial support of her children, the distribution business brings the main source of income for her family, currently at VND5,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle Mrs. T. would like to borrow VND12,000,000 to expand her business. .

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand beer and gas retail

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthol Kun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of 18-people is located in Damnak Sangkae Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Chanthol K. is the village bank (loan group) president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares to cultivate rice to earn a living. Because it is now rice harvesting seaS., she needs to hire laborers to harvest her rice for revenue. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Chum Sem, is a driver who drives a dump truck for a salary. Mrs. Chanthol K. is 50 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom help her on the plantation while the remaining two are attending the local school. Group member Mrs.Khy C. did not come to take her loan, but her husband did; so he is presented in the picture instead of her.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK (Kiva's Field Partner) has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest her rice field.

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Tạ Thị Báu  tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1994. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị rất khó khăn do chồng chị không  may mất sớm. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ chị đã đầu tư vốn để chăn nuôi và mở xưởng cơ khí tạo công ăn việc làm cho con. Hiện tại công việc chăn nuôi và sản xuất kinh doanh tại xưởng cơ khí cuả gia đình chị đang phát triển rất thuận lợi, ngoài việc đảm bảo việc làm cho con gia đình chị còn tạo thêm việc làm cho một công nhân với thu nhập ổn định.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000 để mua thêm gà về nuôi và mua sắt về phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất kinh doanh
texts.en:
Mrs. Ta Thi B. has participated in the TYM Fund since 1994. Before joining the Fund, her family suffered economic hardship because her husband unfortunately passed away early. After joining the Fund, she borrowed money to raise poultry and set up a mechanical workshop to create jobs for her children. Currently, the businesses of raising livestock and of the mechanical workshop grow smoothly, securing jobs for her children and one worker with stable income.

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND15,000,000 to buy chickens to raise and steel materials for the mechanical workshop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens to raise and steel materials for the workshop

loans.name: Mrs. Thouk Khlouk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people who live Damnak Sangkae Village in Kandal Province make up this village bank loan, and they will use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Thouk K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. She hopes to increase her income with this new loan. Mrs. Thouk K. is a 54-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

Mr. Tha C. did not come to take the loan but his wife did, so she is presented in the picture instead him.

This is a village bank loan including end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal O. the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments O. time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% O. Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her inventory and to increase her income with this new loan.

loans.name: Mrs. Soen On Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank in Damnak Sangkae Village in Kandal Province consists of 15 people. They will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Soen O. is a village bank president and she is a grocer. Since she has a lot of customers with high demand, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory and she hopes to increase her income with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Phorn Nhock, helps her in the current business. Mrs. Soen O. is 40 years old and the mother of a child who is working in a garment factory.

This is a village bank loan consisting of some end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal O. the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments O. time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% O. Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to expand the inventory.

loans.name: Mrs. Latt Morn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people who live in Preaek Khmer Village in Kandal Province make up the village bank and they plan to use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Latt M. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Because her business is going well, she wants to expand it and so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. She hopes to improve her living conditions after she sells her pigs. Her husband, Mr. Roueng Doeb, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Latt M. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest, who is only one, is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding and sale.

loans.name: Mrs. Serei Chheng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people who all live in Damnak Sangkae Village in Kandal Province are in this village bank and they will use this loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Serei C. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns two hectares to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Roeung Samnang, owns a threshing machine which brings in income. Unfortunately, his threshing machine now needs to be repaired so his wife, Mrs. Serei C., decided to ask for a loan to fix it and re-start the business. Mrs. Serei C. is 46 years old and the mother of five children two of whom are dump truck drivers while the remaining three are attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of some end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those receiving end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To repair a threshing machine.

loans.name: Shah Mohammad

texts.en:
Shah Mohammad is the son of R.. He lives in District 8, Kabul, Afghanistan His house is near the 500 Family High School. It is a popular school in the area. Shah Mohammad is 40 years old, married, having three children.

Shah Mohammad has a general store in which he sells different kinds of materials. He needs a loan to expand his business and have more success. He requests an individual loan of 50,000 Afghans (USD$1075) for a term of 12 months. With this loan, he wants to enlarge his shop and complete his inventory, so he may support his family better.

Shah Mohammad is very happy that this loan process is available in Afghanistan and he thanks all lenders.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop and complete his inventory.

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Un Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of 16 people is located in Damnak Sangkae Village in Kandal Province and Mrs. Mom U. is village bank president. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household. She is 37 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Phal Trai, is a well digger in the local village. In his business, he now faces a problem because he has insufficient equipment to dig the wells. So Mrs. Mom U. decided to ask for a loan to buy equipment for her husband's business.

This is a village bank loan consisting of some end-of-term (EoT) loans. Four members have EoT loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those receiving EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy well-digging equipment.

loans.name: Mrs. Sophos Khon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who all live in Damnak Sangkae Village in Kandal Province form this village bank. They will use the loan for a variety of purposes.

Mrs. Sophos K. owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Khoem Sarin, is a motorbike repairer who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sophos K. is 39 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting partly of end-of-term (EoT) loans. Three members have EoT loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those receiving EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Such loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. EoT allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her inventory.

loans.name: Mrs. Vy Yab Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of ten people is located in Phum Da Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Vy Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fisherwoman. In her business, she now faces a small problE. because she does not have enough fishing tools, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy nets and fishing lines to catch fish. She hopes she can gather more fish to support her family. Mrs. Vy Y. is a 48-year-old widow with 10 children, five of whom are working in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school and also help their mother when they have free time.

Mrs. Vy Y. will share this loan with the other group members, who will use their portion for a variety of purposes.

All the members in this village bank are seeking end-of-term (EoT) loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fishnets and fish lines to catch fish.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị  Hợi năm nay 39 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị Hợi là chăn nuôi và  dịch vụ cho thuê cốt pha với tổng thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Hợi mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 để đầu tư mua gỗ đóng cot pha cho thuê.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hợi, 39 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2006. Currently, the main sources of income of her family are raising animals and renting out bamboo scaffolding and wooden forms for use in construction (molds to hold concrete in the desired shape while it hardens). Their average monthly income is 3,000,000 VND (183 USD). In the next lending cycle, Mrs. Hợi hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (550 USD) to buy lumber which she will make into construction forms she can rent to builders.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business renting construction implements

loans.name: Mrs. Phin Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people who live in Tropang Chom Village in Kampong Chhnang Province form this village bank and Mrs. Phin C. is village bank president. She is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she now faces a problem because her field is infertile, which has a bad effect on her crop. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Phin C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the field and make her crop more productive. Mrs. Phin C. is a 30-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study.

Mrs. Phin C. will share this loan with the other village bank members, who will use it for a variety of purposes.

All the members in this village bank are seeking end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. The End-of-term (EoT) loan is AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to make the rice crop more productive.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị N. năm nay 30 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007.Hiện nay cả hai vợ chồng chị đều tham gia kinh doanh buôn bán hàng tạp hóa, bánh kẹo và đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu của gia đình chị N. trong thời gian qua. Với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng  gia đình chị N. đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống
Vòng vốn tới chị N. mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá phục vụ nhu cầu của nhân dân địa phương trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị N., 30 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2007. Currently, both she and her husband work in their shop, selling groceries and snacks. This is the main source of income for the family. With their income of about 3,000,000 VND (183 USD) per month, Mrs. N. and her family have been able to steadily improve their standard of living. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. N. hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (550 USD) to invest in buying goods that will meet the demands of her customers during the upcoming lunar new year holiday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery store inventory for lunar new year

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị LêThị Vân  năm nay 25 tuổi. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại Nghi Lộc tỉnh Nghệ An.Năm 2006 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bò và gà.  Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi và trồng trọt với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Vân mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thị Vân, 25 years old, lives with her husband and two young children in Nghi Lộc district, Nghệ An province. In 2006, she became a member of the TYM Fund and used a loan to invest in raising cows and chickens. Currently, the main sources of income for her family are raising animals and growing crops. They earn a total of about 2,000,000 VND (122 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. Vân hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (550 USD) to continue investing in raising animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cows and chickens

loans.name: Mrs. Morn Penh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn P. is the village bank president for nine people who are all living in Tropang Chom Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. All the members will use the loan which they have obtained for different purposes. For instance, Mrs. Morn P. is requesting a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory since her business is going well. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Chay Senh, helps her with the current business. Mrs. Morn P. is 61 years old and the mother of two children both employed in different positions in Phnom P. city, Cambodia. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of partially end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her inventory

loans.name: Nguyen Thi Hong

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng T. năm nay 28  tuổi..Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007.   Hiện tại hai vợ chồng chị đều đang kinh donh điện thoại di động. Do nhu cầu tiêu thụ điện  thoại di động và các dịch vụ của người dân ngày càng nâng cao nên công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị đang tiến triển rất thuận lợi với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. 
Vòng vốn tới chị T. mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh điện thoại.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hồng T., 28 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2007. Currently, she and her husband run a business selling cell phones. Due to the steadily rising consumer demand for mobile phones and related services, her business is thriving and now provides her family with an income of about 3,000,000 VND (183 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. T. hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (550 USD) to invest in her cell phone business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cell phone business

loans.name: Luong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thìn năm nay51 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng một con  đã trưởng thành.Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006.  Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nahạp chính cho gia đình chị là kinh doanh buôn bán hàng tạp hóa, bánh kẹo.... với mức thu nhập 1.500.000./tháng 
Vòng vốn tới chị Thìn mong muốn được vay8.000.000đ để đầu tư kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá phục vụ nhu cầu của nhân dân địa phương trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thìn, 51 years old, lives with one grown child. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2006. Currently, the main source of income for her family is a shop selling groceries and snacks. Their monthly income is about 1,500,000 VND (89 USD). In the next lending cycle, Mrs. Thìn hopes to borrow 8,000,000 VND (475 USD) to invest in buying goods that will meet the demands of her local customers during the upcoming lunar new year holiday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery shop

loans.name: Vuong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Vương Thị Vân năm nay 47 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006.   Hiện nay cả hai vợ chồng chị đều tham gia kinh doanh buôn bán và gia đình chị đang có một của hàng kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa, bánh kẹo... tại huyện Nghi Lộc tỉnh Nghệ An. Công việc kinh doanh cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu của gia đình chị Vân với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Vân mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vương Thị Vân, 47 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2006. Currently, she and her husband both work in their shop selling groceries and snacks in Nghi Lộc district, Nghệ An province. This business provides Mrs. Vân and her family with an income of about 3,000,000 VND (183 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. Vân hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (550 USD) to invest in her grocery store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy three more piglets

loans.name: Mrs. Uon Huot Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people who all live in Krang Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province make up this village bank loan group, and they plan to use the loan ifor different purposes. Mrs. Uon H. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Tim Phat, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm wine and palm sugar.

Unfortunately, in his business, her husband faces a small problem because he does not have enough equipment to climb the trees to gather the juice. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Uon H. decided to ask for a loan to buy bamboo to tie to the palm trees in order to climb up to gather juice.

Mrs. Uon H. is the mother of four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only two years old.

Another borrower, Mrs.Sang S., did not come to take the loan but her husband did, so he is in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to tie to the palm trees to climb up to gather juice

loans.name: Mrs. Yab Loeng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yab L. is the village bank president for ten people who all live in Krang Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. All the members will use the loan which they have obtained for different purpose. For instance, Mrs. Yab L. is requesting a loan to buy pig feed since her pigs are getting bigger and bigger and she hopes to provide enough food to her pigs so she can sell thE. for a better price.

Her husband, Mr. Chhin Thim, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and palm wine. Mrs. Yab L. is 47 years old and the mother of two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

This is a village bank loan consisting of partially end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy pig feed to fatten her pigs for sale

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
The group leader for these six borrowers is Mrs. Neang K.. All the members live in Trea Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Neang K. owns a small grocery store in the village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Buth Kea, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and palm wine. Mrs. Neang K. is 37 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only four years old.

This is a group loan consisting of partially end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for her inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Vy Khuth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of nine people and is located in Trea Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. All the members will use the loan which they have obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Vy K. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. C. Chit, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and palm wine. In this business, he now faces a problem because he does not have enough equipment. Thus, Mrs. Vy K. decided to ask for a loan to buy bamboo to tie to the palm trees in order to climb up to gather juice. Mrs. Vy K. is 50 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are construction workers while the remaining two are attending the local school.

End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients sT. to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.name: Mr. Sokha Rith Phan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Kroay Wat village in Kampong Chhnang province make up this village bank loan and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mr. Sokha Rith P. was selected by the group members to be the village bank president. He is a firewood seller in the local village. Since this business is doing well, he wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to purchase more firewood to resell. This will help to increase his income and improve their living conditions. His wife, Mrs. Pan Chida, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Mr. Sokha Rith P. is 34 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is only four years old. 

One member in this village bank loan has an end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. This client is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to resell.

loans.name: Mr. Den Doeung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of ten people, and is located in Tuol Pongror villag in Kampong Chhnang province. Mr. Den D. is the village bank president. He is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. For the vegetable farming, he grows watermelons. Since this plantation is doing well, he wants to grow more watermelons, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more seeds to cultivate. In addition, he would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to make the crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. On Ith, helps him with the plantation. Mr. Den D. is 30 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is at home because that child is only five years old. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The seven members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more watermelon seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Run C. is a group leader of six who live in Tropang Thmor village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Run C. is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. Since the second plantation is doing well, she wants to expand. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more watermelon seeds to cultivate. Her husband, Mr. Oeurn Pheap, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Run C. is 43 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining five attend the local school. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The four members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more watermelon seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sao Y. is group leader of five who all live in Sre Sa village in Kampong Chhnang province. She has 1 hectare where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Yong Pho, is a firewood seller in the local village. Although they try to work hard, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve this, Mrs. Sao Y. decided to ask for a loan, to add to her savings, to build a new house for her family. Mrs. Sao Y. is 40 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom work in a garment factory, while the others attend the local school. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The three members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en: Mr. Sophon S. is a villager in Chueng Khnar Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He breeds ducks and chickens. Aside from this business, he also breeds pigs and is currently raising seven pigs. Since this business is doing well, he wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig feed. Mr. Sophon S. is a 58 year old widower with two children who all attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en: Mrs. Saroeun S. is a farmer in Boeung Nay village in Kampong Cham province. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. She wants to expand her plantation because she doesn't earn enough income to provide a better life for her family. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy another piece of land to cultivate rice on. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Saroeun S. is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy another piece of land to cultivate rice on

loans.name: Moen

texts.en: Mrs. Moen Y. was born in 1947 and she now lives in Kok Romeat village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who can make a little income growing rice because she owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice on. She now wants to expand her rice revenue so she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy another piece of land to cultivate rice. She hopes to increase her rice revenue in this way. Mrs. Moen Y. is a widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice on

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok K. is a villager in Preak Ta Ong Ti Pie village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who has half a hectare to cultivate rice on to earn her living. Since her rice field is far from the irrigation system, Mrs. Sok K. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a pump and hose in order to water her field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Pun Phorn, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Sok K. is 58 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are car repairmen while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a pump and hose in order to water her field

loans.name: Sokhaem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhaem K. is a villager in Preak Ta Ong Ti Bie Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She now cannot do her planting because she does not have enough money to hire a laborer with oxen to plow the field.

In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sokhaem K. decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer. She plans to use the rest of the loan to buy more rice seeds and fertilizer. Mrs. Sokhaem K. is a 47-year-old widow with a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: to hire a laborer and to buy more rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Thary Hour Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people who live in Pou Kraom village in Kandal Province make up this village bank loan. They will use the loan for a variety of purposes.

Mrs. Thary H. is the village bank president and she is a vegetable seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Hok Sang, is a vegetable farmer. In his plantation, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to purchase fertilizers to make his crop more productive. Thus, Mrs. Thary H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for her husband's plantation. Mrs. Thary H. is 27 years old and the mother of two children who are aged three and five years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for a vegetable plantation.

loans.name: Sothy Keo's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothy K. is a group leader of five who all live in Veal Thom village in Kandal province. She owns a small restaurant where she sells Chinese noodles to the villagers and the passengers. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to make noodles for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Chea Sok, is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sothy K. is 43 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest is too young to work or study.

Mrs. Sothy K. will share this loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make delicious Chinese noodles.

loans.name: Mr. San Preab Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of eight people is located in Slaeng village in Kandal province. Mr. San P. is the village bank president who was selected by the members. He is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. Since his fields are both far from an irrigation system, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump to water his field to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Srey Phorn, is a housewife who cooks for the family. This couple lives together without any children.

One member in this village bank loan has applied for an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. The end-of-term (EoT) loan is AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy a pump to bring water to his fields.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Mrs. Channy P. is a villager in Toek Nim village in Kandal province. She is a fish seller in the local market. As her business is going well, she wants to expand it. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish to re-sell in order to fulfill her customers' demand. Her husband, Mr. Man Prak, helps her in the current business. Mrs. Channy P. is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more fish to re-sell in order to fulfill her customers' demand.

loans.name: Sokhan Chea's Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group of five is Mrs. Sokhan C. and all the members live in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sokhan C. is single. She is a primary teacher who can make a small salary to support herself. In order to improve her living conditions and increase her income, Mrs. Sokhan C. seeks a loan to conduct a souvenir shop.

Mrs. Sokhan C. will share this loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: To open a souvenir shop.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry K., who lives in Sdao Kanlaeng Village in Kandal Province, owns a small grocery store, and since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory and to repair the house. Her husband (presented with her in the picture), Mr. Khoem Hean, is a construction worker who makes a small income that helps support the family.

Ry is 50 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another works in construction. The remaining three are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her inventory and repair her house.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Mr. Leng T., born in 1983 and residing in Chek Village in Kandal Province, is a farmer with 1.5-hectares of land upon which he cultivates rice to earn a living. He is now requesting a loan to buy more rice seeds and fertilizer to support the field. Leng’s wife, Mrs. Loy Sokchan, helps him on the plantation.

Leng T. is 25 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is yet too young to begin studying.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Shina

texts.en: Mrs. Shina S., a resident of Chek Village in Kandal Province, and her husband, Mr. Ton Chom, are farmers who own 3 hectares of land upon which they cultivate rice to earn a living. Due to field infertility, Shina is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to make their crop more productive. She hopes to thereby increase their rice revenue with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her rice crop more productive.

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Mrs. Hak P. is a farmer in Chek village in Kandal province. In her plantation, she now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to make her crop more productive. She plans to use the rest of the loan to buy fuel for a pump and pesticide to kill insects. Her husband, Mr. Samrith Lonh, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Hak P. is 55 years old and the mother of three children who are all working in a garment factory.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer, fuel for her pump, and pesticide

loans.name: Seib

texts.en: Mrs. Seib S. who is a villager in Chek village in Kandal province is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer because her field is infertile. She plans to use the rest of the loan to hire a laborer to work on the rice field. Mrs. Seib S. is a 44-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a pork seller in the local market while the other helps her on the plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to amend her field

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Mrs. Yong C. is a villager in Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who now faces a small problem because her field is infertile. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Yong C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to amend the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Sem Suon, helps her in their plantation. Mrs. Yong C. is 52 years old and she has five children, two whom are working in a garment factory while another one is a grocer. The remaining two are attending the local school.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Mrs. Yong S., a villager in Thom Village in Kandal Province, is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. In her second plantation, she grows mushrooms. Since this plantation is going well, she wants grow more so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more mushroom seeds to cultivate in her field. Her husband, Mr. Yun Mo, is a fisherman who can catches a few fish to support the family. Mrs. Yong S. is 36 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom helps her in the field while the remaining three are attending the local school.

loans.use: to buy more mushroom seeds to cultivate in her field.

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.en:
Abdukodir H. is a 54-year-old cattleman who is married with 6 children. Owing to his father, who was a farmer, Abdukodir has been associated with this business since he was young. He purchases the cattle in the local market and then he raises and sells them. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. Every day, Abdukodir gets up early in the morning in order to feed the animals. And all day, until late at night, he is busy looking after the cattle.

Abdukodir says that he works with only one aim in mind: to provide his children with a proper education. Now, Abdukodir would like to expand his business and purchase three cows. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan in the amount of 4000 Somoni ($ 1200 USD) and with your help he hopes to reach his aim.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand his business

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle and the small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Nurillojon

texts.en:
Nurillojon is originally from Isfara, Tajikistan. For 17 years he has been processing and selling dried apricots. Nurillojon is married with two children. Family effort has been the key to his business's growth since everyone collaborates and now, he has a steady customer base due to the quality of his products. At the high season, he even sends some of his products to Russia where dried apricots are very expensive. Currently, he is seeking a loan of 4000 Somoni (US$ 1175) to buy tables so he can buy more dried apricots in order to fill the high demand from his customers. He promises to repay this loan in 11 months. Be a part of this family's achievements! They sincerely thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy dried apricots to expand his business

loans.name: Risolat

texts.en:
Risolat is a very shy woman, but also very hard-working as a farmer and as the mother of 3 children. She and her husband produce fruits and vegetables. What they urgently need right now are fertilizer and other chemicals for the care of their crops so that they can produce a product that is in line with the demands of the market. Risolat needs your help to buy the fertilizer, which is the most expensive and most necessary input for producing her fruits. The goal is to achieve better profits and benefits in the market. Risolat doesn’t just need good land; she also needs a friendly hand to help her out.

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Isokhoja

texts.en:
Isokhoja happily works on his farm growing vegetables and wheat, crops that, when in season, help him pay their household expenses and necessities for his three children. His children are studying at school and need various supplies to keep studying. He wishes as a father that he can give his children what they need so they can progress through school and later work at jobs other than those in the agricultural sector. In this way, he thinks that many people consider him a hard-working and selfless father. Nonetheless, he now needs help in order to continue working. He needs to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, which are very important for growing products according to market demands. With your help, Isokhoja will be able to support his children's success.

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is 54 years old and struggles daily to increase the family income so her children may have all that is necessary to have a good life. She has always fought to provide for her family and educate her 4 children, and two of them today are working adults, thanks to her example. Her perseverance has given her family the assurance that she does everything possible to make their lives pleasant.

Thanks to the hard work she invests in agriculture, she was able to purchase a small plot of land that she is farming together with her husband. However, the produce has decreased and the family expenses are using up the little capital they have. In turn, this has reduced the amount of money available for purchasing fuels and lubricants, seeds and fertilizer for the new plot of land they have invested in. That is the reason that Malika is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni (900 USD) for a term of 9 months. The situation in which Malika finds herself has made her ask for help, with the hope that she will find sensitive collaborators to help her get through these hard times.

loans.use: Purchasing fuels and lubricants, seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
O. Rasul is married and has three children.  He is very proud of them since they are fighting to get ahead in life. With the hope that his children would attend college, he started a business of processing and selling dried apricots six years ago.  Through his business, he was able to make enough money to pay for their schooling.

He is experienced in this business, and this allows him to expand his client base day by day. Currently, Rasul requests a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1200 USD) for a 12 month term. The loan will be used for purchasing dried apricots for further processing before he sells them. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which include a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have access to microcredit loans. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy dried apricots to sell

loans.name: Komil

texts.en:
Komil O. is 47 years old, and lives with his wife and 6 children. He has been breeding cattle for more than 7 years, and he is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work, above all getting milk from his cows, which he sells in local markets. Komil keeps going thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his children, along with his wife who help him with caring for the animals. Now Komil needs a loan to purchase more cattle to expand his business. With your help this will be possible. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.en:
Born in 1952, Ruziboy T. is married and the father of six children. He is an agriculturist, a job he loves, and it has been the principle source of income for him for the last 32 years. He has 0.8 hectares of land where he produces different kinds of vegetables, and also he has a area of apricot trees on his land. Thanks to the experience that he has gained during the 32 years, he gets a rich harvest every year from his land. In light of the current high demand, Ruziboy would like to improve his land and production to meet the market. In order to do this, he is seeking a loan to buy fuels and lubricants, fertilizer, and saplings for improving and expanding his harvest. He would then be able to better provide for his children's schooling, health, and food. You could become an important part of Ruziboy's family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

loans.use: To purchase fuels and lubricants, mineral fertilizers, and saplings.

loans.name: Djura

texts.en:
Djura U. is 29 years old, and is married with two kids. Djura is a market vendor, selling teenagers' and kids' clothing at the central market of Isfara city. Having worked for over 6 years at the market, Djura already has enough experience to do his work successfully and has clients who always come to him. He is trying to satisfy the needs of any clients with various tastes and income levels. Djura’s kids are small now, but already he is working hard in order to give them a good education and to make them happy. Now, Djura is planning to increase his working capital in order to purchase new goods for selling. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan, which he promises to repay promptly. He thanks everyone for supporting him. Your generosity can change their lives. Be an important part of the growth of Djura’s business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: To purchase new goods for selling.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en:
Rahim is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He is a humble farmer dedicated to producing wheat, and he also has an apricot garden. Twenty years ago, with the support of his beloved father, he established the apricot garden on 1 hectare of land. Every year he makes a good profit from his land, and from his savings he purchased a car for the transportation of his crop. Currently, Rahim needs to invest large amounts of money, because he knows that on a larger harvest he will have better results. The fruit has to be of better quality in order to get more income from the sales. Rahim bases his efforts on the well being of his family, mostly his children. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer and saplings to expand his apricot garden

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is divorced and lives with her younger daughter. Oksana owns a retail business. She sells bath robes for both men and women at several markets. Her monthly income is about 10,000 UAH (1 UAH =~0.124USD).

Oksana has been in this business for 10 years. She started when the factory she worked at closed and she lost her job. Oksana started small, but her hard work and good choice of goods to sell helped her to develop this business. At the moment she has 3 business locations where she sells her goods.

Oksana would like to get a loan to increase her assortment of bath robes for sale. Oksana would like to develop her business even further so she can help her younger daughter get an apartment.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods for sale.

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en:
Chhean Y., 33, is a rice farmer who also sells a little grocery from her house. She currently earns revenue of $4 a day to support her family’s living and especially her kid’s foods. She has been running her business for nine years, thus now she has a lot of customers to buy her wares. She is married with two children, both of whom are teenagers and attending school. The family lives in Pursat Province.

Chhean Y.'s husband, Soung Vuthy, 32, is a primary teacher who also raises animals including pigs and cows for selling. With growing business of her husband, and to increase the family's income, Y. would like to request a loan for her husband to buy more piglets and a cow to breed.

The picture shows Y.'s husband because Y. was not available for the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and a cow to breed.

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Yem Rem, age 19, is a rice farmer. He makes a living growing rice as well as raising poultry. He will sell his poultry for slaughter three or four months after breeding and he has been doing this business since 2007. The business is going well and he earns approximately $5 a day. Yem Rem has no children and he is married to Mrs. Leap Tom, 19, a housewife. The young couple work hard every day.

Rem hopes to expand and improve his business. Hence, he would like to apply for a loan to buy more poultry to raise and to use the remaining money to repair his existing poultry cage.

loans.use: To buy more poultry and to repair his existing poultry cage.

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Yem R. is 40 years old and his wife is 53. They are both residents of Pursat Province. They are growing rice for a living and started their businesses in 1979 in an area near the border of Cambodia and Thailand. Besides farming rice, for another income source, they raise pigs and other animals. They currently have five children, three of whom are married and two are single. One single son is employed as a rice mill worker as well as helping with his parents' farming.

R. needs to apply for a loan to purchase two buffalo to use for their farming operation. If there is a remainder of the loan, he will buy more piglets to raise.

loans.use: to purchase two buffalo to use for farming

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en:
Tuon R. is 28 years old and is a resident of Pursat Province. She is a farmer who has been growing both vegetables and rice since 1999 to earn a living. Her husband, Som Ran, 25, makes a living selling carving wood, which he brings from the forest and, using a cart, he transports the wood to sell from village to village in their community, earning approximately US$ 3 a day. The family has no children as yet.

For another income source, R. is seeking a loan to purchase piglets to raise. She would use any remainder of the loan to buy a ox-cart to replace the old one her husband uses to transport carving wood to sell. R.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and an ox-cart

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Chhin K. lives in Pursat Province which is located west of Phnom Penh City. She is 50 years old and has made a living growing rice; she has been farming since 1979 in her village. She now has eight children; four are single and attending school, and four are married. One of her sons is employed as a salesperson for a private entrepreneur.

Farming is the main source of income for the whole family: growing rice crops twice a year, both dry season and rainy season. Normally, K. rents a pump from others and now she wants to own one for herself. To improve her farming business, K. would like to apply for a loan to purchase a pump to pump the water for rice crops. With any remainder of the loan, she would purchase fertilizer. K.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: to purchase a pump for her rice field

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida L. is 55 years old and comes from Buenavista, Oroquieta City. She has 6 children, 3 of whom are already working. She courageously went into business even when she was still single. From a small capital of PHP 3,500, she managed to build up a business buying and selling coconuts. Besides the coconut-buying business, she made use of coconut shells for charcoal as another source of income.

When she got married, the coconut-buying business was still feasible. Raising their 6 children with their little business is a challenge they have had to face. Her husband only rented a motor cab during the day and got very little income out of motor driving.

Adelaida saw an opportunity of putting up a "sari-sari" (variety) store. She feels that the store can help a lot as a source of income. She also has a videoke machine right at their store for rent. The PHP 1,500 monthly commission from the videoke machine can cover their electric and water bills. She says, she has to be careful in managing their businesses. She confessed, she joined Paglaum MPC out of financial considerations. But she is very thankful for the other loan windows that the Cooperative offers. She says that the education of her children was made possible because of Paglaum MPC.

Mrs. L. enumerated her dreams. She wants to own a chainsaw machine for added business someday. She wants to operate a real grocery store and above, all she and her husband would like to acquire a lot of their own where they can have their coconut farm.

loans.use: additional capital for her "sari-sari" store and for coconut-buying

loans.name: Loem

texts.en:
Loem P., 28, is a local rice farmer as well as raising pigs outside her house. She is the mother of two children, both of whom are still young and are pupils in primary school. Her husband, Lim Sokvoeun, age 28, sells carving wood, currently earning about US$ 4 a day to help feed the family.

To enlarge her business, P. needs to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding and two buffalo to hitch to a cart for her husband to transport carving wood to sell. The loan will help increase their income to cover this family’s living expenses sufficiently. P.'s husband is in the picture because she was not available.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for breeding and two buffalo to pull the cart

loans.name: Chhoeurm

texts.en:
Chhoeurm P. is 48 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province where she grows vegetables and raises pigs to earn a living for her family. She now has five children, four of whom are single and one is married and is living away. One of her sons helps with the family's work.

Chhoeurm P.'s husband is an oxen trader who normally buys oxen to raise for a while and re-sell for a profit and the business is going well. To enlarge the business and earn additional revenue, Phloeun needs to apply for a loan for her husband to use as additional capital for oxen trading.

loans.use: for her husband to use as additional capital for oxen trading

loans.name: Prim

texts.en:
Mrs. Prim L., 50, is married with seven children and lives in Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. She and her husband work in their farm growing rice and cabbage and raising pigs. This couple started their farming activity in 1998. By now they have enough experience in their work and are willing to expand more.

Four of their children work at a local factory and the other three are enrolled in school. Prim L. and her husband need more capital to expand their crops and their livestock. She has recently requested a loan to purchase vegetable seeds and more piglets.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seed and more piglets

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng S., 27, is a fisherman who lives in Kompong Thom Province. He has been fishing since 2005, and he uses fishing tools such as nets to catch fish around Tunle Sap Lake to sell in the market. He is married to Let Rat, 27, a rice farmer who is the mother of one lovely young child.

Rat has run her farm for a number of years; she has lots of experience and works hard every day. Right now, she hopes to reduce their expenditure for renting oxen. Therefore, she had a discussion with her husband and decided to apply for a loan to purchase a cow to use for her farming activities. She hopes she can get more oxen from the cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Asia Asghar Ali Group

texts.en:
Asia baji is a 28-year-old married lady and resides in a city called Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 16 years. Her education went to 8th standard pass but she couldn’t study further due to her father’s low income.

Asia baji's husband's name is A. A. and he runs a watch shop in the main market of Arifwala. He has 10 years' experience in this business. He sells both wall clocks and wrist watches in his shop. Aisa baji is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. None of her children goes to school.

Asia baji keeps herself busy sewing clothes. She sews clothes particularly for her neighbors and earns income. She saves her income in a committee and decides that when she gets the committee amount she’ll renovate her house. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more watches for her husband’s shop.

Asia baji is the group leader of some more women. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy meat to re-sell. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more watches for her husband's watch shop

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусаттор окончив первый свой кредит решил взять ещё кредит для закупа мелкого скота и корма для них.Сейчас у него более 30 голов мелкорогатого скота.Он рад сотрудничать с нами. Поняв что кредит ему идёт впользу он с радостью кредитуется в Микроинвесте.
texts.en:
After successfully repaying his first loan, Abdusattor decided to take out another loan in order to purchase small-horned cattle and feed for them. Now he has 30 head of cattle. He is pleased to work with us. Having learnt how the use of credit benefits him, he is happy to get his financing from MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Rukhsana M.shahzad Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji is a 28 year old married lady who resides in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 17 years. She completed her education until 10th standard and then she got married. Her husband's name is M. and he works in a cotton factory. She has three kids: two sons and one daughter. All of her children are getting an education in a local school located near the house. Rukhsana baji has a cloth sewing business. She does this work to make herself busy. This activity gives her a return in the shape of money. She saves her income for her children’s good future. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her sewing machine.

She is the leader of a group with a few more women. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Maqboolan baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Ghulam Qubra baji wants a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair a sewing machine used for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Hanifan M. Ayub Group

texts.en:
Hanifan baji is a 50 year old married lady and resides in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 10 years. Her husband's name is M. A. and he is a daily wage labor. Hanifan baji has one son who is a driver by profession, driving a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Hanifan baji also works with her husband. They both work hard for their son. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw along with money saved by her son.

She is the leader of a group with a few more women. Rani baji also wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. Zakia baji wants a loan to buy meat to resell. Lalan baji wants a loan to buy chairs for her barber shop. Samina baji wants a loan to buy switches and wires for her electric shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Bushra Shaheen Noor Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Bushra shaheen baji is a 34 year old woman who resides in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 4 years. Her husband's name is N. A. and he is a fruit seller by profession and has been selling fruits for the past 2 years. Bushra baji has no children. She stays at home and embroiders dresses. This work gives her a reward in shape of money. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her husband’s fruit selling business.

She is the leader of a group with a few more women. Shamim baji and Shazia baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk selling businesses. Sharfan baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to resell.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam P., 48, is a mother of four and works with her husband growing cucumbers, cabbage, and rice and also raising pigs. They started this work in 1990 and with their farming activity they can collectively make $6.00 of income per day.

Two of their children are students and the other two are employed as drivers, earning together $2.60 of income per day.

Mrs. Sam P. and her husband would like to apply for a loan from Kiva to purchase more seeds to expand their crops, which will expand their profit margin.

loans.use: To buy more seeds to expand her crops.

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar M. Arif Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar baji is a 40 year old married lady and resides in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 15 years. Her husband's name is M. A. and he has a business selling utensils. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. Parveen baji has five kids: three daughters and two sons. All of her children are getting an education in a local school located near to the house. Parveen baji also sells utensils in the community to help her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy more utensils to expand the business.

Parveen baji is the leader of a group with a few more women of her locality. Shahida baji wants a loan to buy material (cooking oil and sugar) for her sweetmeat business. Rani baji wants a loan to buy meat to resell. Ayesha baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Tahmina baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Nagina baji wants a loan to buy electric switches and wires for her electric shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy utensils to resell.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Khat S., 47, is married and lives in Saang District, Kandal Province, Cambodia. She works with her husband on her rice paddy growing rice, corn, nuts, and cucumbers, making collectively around $5.50 per day from her activity. Khat S. has six children. Two of them are students and four of them are employed as workers. Khat S. learned farming skills from her parents starting from when she was 10. Even thought it’s hard work, she really adores it and will never give it up.
