This year her output is decreased. Some of her crops were destroyed by insects and rats. In order to prevent that happening again and to increase her output margin, Mrs. Khat S. and her husband would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase insecticide, seeds, gasoline, and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase insecticide, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en:
Chhoem Ru is 28 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province. She makes Khmer traditional baskets from her house to sell at the market and has been in this business since 2000. She can currently earn an income of approximately of $3 a day. She is married to Hort Hi, a 24 year old construction worker who also farms rice. The family has two children, both of whom are teenagers and attending school.

Ru has requested a loan to purchase additional raw materials to make baskets for sale. And she plans to use remaining money from the loan plus with her saved money to buy an oxen to use for farming.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to make baskets for sale.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam L., 55, is married and lives with her husband in Toul Sangke district, Phnom Pehn, Cambodia. She started her business in 1979, selling fruits and cooking Num Ansorm, a Khmer traditional cake made from piece of pork, banana, sticky rice wrapping with banana leaf. This kind of cake is very popular and well known for locals. Sam L. can typically make about $5 a day of income from her business activity.

Her husband can moderately make $3 each day from working as a motor-taxi driver. Moreover, Sam L. has four children. One of them is enrolled in school, two of them are electricians, and the last one is a factory worker. For her monthly expenses, Sam L. usually spends about $110 on food and $20 on utilities. The expenses are covered 50% by help from her children.

Sam L. would like to request a loan to purchase more fruits to meet her clients’ needs and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Shahnaz Shoqat Maish Group

texts.en:
I am Shahnaz and I am a citizen of a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. I have been living in this city for the past 20 years. I am an uneducated lady; I couldn’t get education because we were hand-to-mouth. My husband's name is S. M.. My husband has a very good nature and he is a very kind human being. He is a wholeseller. He collects the stock from the wholesale market and sells on different shops on wholesale. He has been in this profession for the past 10 years. I have six children: three sons and three daughters. None of my children go to school. My elder son is a daily wage labor. My daughter helps me in household work and in the making of embroidered clothes as well. I and my daughters make embroidered cloth and sell it in cloth markets to earn a good profit. I have successfully repaid my two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy rice to expand my husband’s wholesale business.

I am a leader of a group with a few more women of my locality. Shakeela Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Anwari baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to resell. Khalida baji wants a loan to buy material (beads,colored thread and sketches) for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy rice wholesale for resale.

loans.name: Tat

texts.en: Mrs. Tat N., 34 years old, lives in Siem Reap Province, where she makes a living raising pigs. She can raise pigs twice per year and sell them for slaughter. She has run her business for over four years ago and has a lot of experience. N. is responsible for caring for three children, all of whom are singles. Her husband is on the staff of a volunteer organization and currently gets a salary of $210 per month. Raising pigs is the main way for N. to earn the money to make her family's living comfortable. Thus she applied for a loan to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Magadlaine Bashir Masih Gull Group

texts.en:
Magadlaine baji is 32 years old and married. She has been living in the city of Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband's name is B. M. G.; he works in a cotton factory. She is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is in the decorative embroidery business. He collects orders from big markets and signs a commitment to complete the order in 15 days. His mother Magadlaine baji helps him complete the commitment. Her other kids are in kindergarten.

Magadlaine baji successfully repaid her previous two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy materials (beads, colored thread, and sketches) to expand her son’s decorative embroidery business.

Magadlaine baji is the leader of a group of several women. Hamidan baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Rasheedan baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal selling business. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for a decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Preab

texts.en:
Preab P., 73, is a mother of two children. She is a widow and is too old to work. She lives with her two children in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. One of her children is a construction foreman and the other one works selling fruit to the people in her community. The two can collectively earn about $12 per day of income. With this revenue, they cover the family expenses, including repayment to Kiva.

Preab P. has lately applied for a loan for her son to purchase more construction tools to alleviate his workload and make it further, faster, and easier.

(Her son, in the white T-shirt, is pictured here because Preab P. was not available.)

loans.use: To buy more construction tools for her son to facilitate his work.

loans.name: Nasreen Amanuwail Masih Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is a 37 year old lady and resides in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is A. M. and he works in a factory. She is the mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. Her elder son is a driver by profession and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheel motor vehicle). The others are getting education in a local school located near to the community. Nasreen baji’s husband’s income is insufficient to meet the financial expenses. She helps him by sewing and embroidered clothes. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. She is very happy that she is fulfilling her duties very devotedly. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her son.

She is the leader of a group with some more women of her locality. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy chairs for her barber shop. Rebecca baji wants a loan to buy a handset for her PCO (which people use to make calls and pay by the minute) public call office. Sardaran baji and Majeedan baji each want a loan to buy wheat on wholesale to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Yous

texts.en:
Mr. Yous B. T., 35, is married and lives with his wife and a ten year-old child in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is the head of the family and works as a sculptor designing and making Buddha statues and historical statues from cement and will then sell up for a profit. From his business activity he can moderately make $3 a day of income. Moreover, his wife, Lay Sarorn has a business at home washing motor-bikes and vehicles and makes $3 a day of income.

Yous B. T. would like to ask for a loan from Kiva to purchase more cement to expand his business. Half of the loan will be used to fix a roof of the building where his wife has her business.

(His wife is pictured because Yous B. T. was at work.)

loans.use: To buy more cement to expand his sculpture busines.

loans.name: Musarat Mahmood Akhtar Group

texts.en:
Musarat baji is a 30-year-old resident of Arifwala, Pakistan, married to M. A., an auto-rickshaw driver, and the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her oldest son is in kindergarten while the others are not yet of school-going age.

Musarat baji has a business knitting bed sheets and sofa covers, saving part of her income and using the rest to pay her son’s school fees. She is now applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband.

Musarat is a group leader of two other women: Parveen baji wants a loan to buy milk to resell. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou R., 46, a mother of three children, lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, where she works with her husband making brooms from bamboo and grass which they sell to the vendors at various markets in town, earning about $10 per day on average. Sou R. usually spends $100 on food and $20 on utilities per month.

She and her husband would like to request a loan from KIVA to purchase more bamboo and a grass named sdoub to increase the volume of their products to meet their growing customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more grass and bamboo to increase the volume of her products.

loans.name: Shahnaz M. Ejaz Group

texts.en:
I am Shahnaz and I am 31 years old. I am married with five children: four daughters and one son. All of my children are attending a local school.  I have lived in a city named Arifwala for the last 10 years. I am uneducated. My husband's name is M. E..  He runs a sweetmeat shop in a food market. He has been in this business for the past 5 years. He learned this business from his father. I run a sewing center where I teach children how to sew dresses. I use my income to pay my children’s school tuition fees. I have successfully repaid my two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying for a loan to buy material (cooking oil, sugar and dry fruits) for my husband’s sweetmeat business. 

I am a group leader with two other women from my town. Sajnan baji wants a loan to pay for an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Kalsoom baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle named “Shahzore”. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for sweetmeat shop

loans.name: Khut's Group

texts.en:
There are four members in this group loan. Mrs. Khut N. is the leader of the group. She is married with two children, who attend school.  She is 35 years old and makes a living by selling fresh coconut in her area of Psakroam Market in the Siem Reap Province, where tourists stay to visit Angkor Wat Temple. She buys coconuts from villagers and then sells them. She earns approximately $5 a day. Her husband, Mr. Noun Dara, is a trailer-motorcycle (tuk tuk) taxi driver who earns about $7 per day. To expand her business, N. seeks a loan to buy more coconuts to sell. 

The other borrowers are:
Rours T., 47, makes a living by selling Khmer cake. She is applying for a loan to purchase construction materials for her husband's business.
Ros S. is 31 years old.  She sells cakes and is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make cakes to sell.
Keoun Choeun, 51, is a cake wholesaler. She is applying for a loan to expand her business. 

The borrowers live in Salakomreuk Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Zaitoon M. Sharif Group

texts.en:
My name is Zaitoon and I am 53 years old. I live in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. I own a two-room brick house in this city. I am married with six children: four sons and two daughters. My oldest son is an electrician. My second son drives a donkey cart and my third son works as a delivery man. My youngest son works in his father’s business. My husband's name is M. S.; he is a woodcutter by profession. He has 20 years of experience in this business. I stay at home and sew clothes to order. I charge $2 per dress. Sometimes my daughters help me in my business.  I have successfully repaid my two loans which I took from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying for a loan to buy an axe for my youngest son so that he will be able to cut more wood and earn more money. 

I am the leader of a group of four other women of my locality. Abida K. baji wants a loan to buy material (cooking oil and sugar) for her sweetmeat business. Razia baji wants a loan to buy biscuits and chips to sell to different shops. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy scrap iron for her scrap business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an axe for wood-cutting

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Mrs. Lay S., 69, is a widow and lives with her two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works as a landlord renting some rooms she built to the people in her area; she also works selling grocery products at home, making about $4/day of net income. One of her children is employed by a private company, making $5 a day. The other works with her selling grocery products.  Lay S. would like to request a loan to build more rooms to rent out, so that she can meet the demand and increase her profit.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent out for additonal profit.

loans.name: Kosar Begum Maqsood Ahmad Group

texts.en:
My name is Kosar begum and I am 38 years old.  I am married with four children: two sons and two daughters. All of my children are getting an education in a school near my house.  I own a two-room brick house and have been living in it with my family for the past 8 years. My husband's name is M. A..  He sells milk and has 5 years of experience. I help my husband get milk from buffalo and transfer the milk into milk pots. I’ve successfully repaid two loans which I took from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand our milk-selling business. 
 
I am the leader of a group with three other women from my town. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Sumera baji and Irshad baji each want a loan to pay the installments on their auto-rickshaws (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for a milk-selling business

loans.name: Pring

texts.en: Mrs. Pring H. is a villager in Andoung Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Since her field is far from an irrigation system, it is difficult to water her crop, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump to water her crop. Additionally, she will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Uk Kan, helps her with the plantation. Mrs. Pring H. is 46 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom work in a garment factory, while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a pump to water her crop.

loans.name: Atiya Abdul Latif Group

texts.en:
My name is Atiya and I’m a 36 year old married lady. I own a two room brick house in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. I’ve been living in this city for the past 5 years. My husband's name is A. L., who has a business f selling spare parts, and has 20 years of experience in this business. He buys spare parts from a big bazaar named “Bilal Ganj” and sells them in his own city.

I’m a mother of four sons and one daughter. All of my sons work as welders in a workshop. My daughter is 12 years old, and she stays at home to help me sew clothes. I am trying to transferring this skill to my daughter so that she is able to sew dresses independently. I do this work to provide some income for the family and to lessen the financial burden on my husband. I have successfully repaid my two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy more spare parts to expand my husband’s business. 

I’m a group leader of a few more women of my locality. Razia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Hamidan baji wants a loan to buy petrol to resell. Razia baji wants a loan to pay the installments of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to resell

loans.name: Veasna's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Veasna M. is a group leader of three who all live in Reussie Srok Village in Kandal Province. Mr. Veasna M. sells bananas, but he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy bananas to resell. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Veasna M. decided to ask for a loan. His wife, Mrs. Sim Ranin, helps him with the plantation. Mr. Veasna M. is 20 years old and the father of a child who is one year old.

Mrs. Sisara Choun, who is a group guarantee, is also presented in the picture with the group members. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bananas to resell.

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs. Kung M., is a villager in Angk Village in Kandal Province, and is requesting a loan to buy silk scarves for her business as it is doing well. Her husband, Mr. Samrith Ly, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. Mrs. Kung M. is 40 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a farmer, while the remaining two attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy silk scarves to resell.

loans.name: Zakia M.safdar Group

texts.en:
My name is Zakia and I’m a 35 year old married lady. I own a two room brick house and have been living in it with my family since 1998. My husband's name is M., and he sells wood. He has 5 years of experience of this business, and runs a wood shop near the community. People are used to coming to him to buy wood because in our community nobody has gas utilities. I have five kids: three sons and two daughters. None of my children go to school because of our lack of financial resources. I sewing clothes in order to improve the financial conditions of our family. I’m applying for a loan to buy wood to grow my husband’s business. 

I am a group leader of a few more women of my locality. Amna baji wants a loan to buy products for her laundry business. Farzana baji and Shazia baji each want a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for their vegetable selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood to resell

loans.name: Noen

texts.en: Mrs. Noen C. was born in 1963 and is now single and lives with her parents in Sambuor Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who wants to cultivate rice in the dry season. In order to do this, Mrs. C. is applying for a loan to buy more rice seed, fuel for her pump and pesticides to kill insects. She hopes to increase her income with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and other items.

loans.name: Holmamad

texts.ru: Холмамад окончив свой первый кредит хочет получить ещё повторный займ.Он использовал кредит на расширение своего бизнеса по ткорму и продаже скота.Поняв что займ ему помог,он с радостью хочет продолжить свой бизнес.Следующий займ он хочет использовать для закупа крупного рогатого скота.Пока сейчас скот дешёвый , он хочет успеть его закупить.
texts.en:
After repaying his first loan, Holmamad would like to take out another. He used the first loan to expand his business, the fattening and selling of cattle. After seeing how the use of credit was such a benefit, he is happy to continue the business. He wishes to use the next loan for the purchase of large-horned cattle. Since the price of cattle is currently low, he hopes to be able to purchase them at this time.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Mrs. Man N. lives in Sambuor Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns 0.6 hectar on which she makes a living cultivating rice. She would like to grow a crop in the dry season, and has decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice seeds to cultivate. She will also use a portion of this loan to buy fertilizers and fuel to make her crop larger. Mrs. Man N. is a 57-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a fisherman while the other helps her on her plantation.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds and other items.

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeurn N. lives in Doun Vong village in Kandal province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Chan Nget, earns his income by driving a motorbike which transports goods and passengers. He faces a problem because his vehicle is too old and uses too much petroleum. In order to save money, his wife has applied for a loan to buy a new motorbike. She will add this loan to her husband's savings to pay for the vehicle.

Mrs. N. is 36 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom work in a garment factory while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To help buy a new motorbike for her husband's business.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S. lives in Siem Reap Province, where the Angkor Wat Temple located. He is a motorcycle taxi driver, providing rides to passengers who want to travel around his community. Since 2006, her has earned approximately $3 a day. He is married to Cham Rat, who is 24 years old, and they have two children. His wife makes a living by making traditional baskets to sell at a local market, and earns around $2 a day. To develop his business, S. has applied for a loan to buy a trailer to connect to his motorcycle. The trailer will help S. earn additional income.

loans.use: to buy a trailer to connect to his motorcycle

loans.name: Yourn

texts.en: Mrs. Yourn C. was born in 1964 and lives in Doun Vong village in Kandal province. She is a widow with a child who works in a garment factory. Although they work hard, they live in an old house which is in poor condition. In order to improve her life, Mrs. Yourn C. is applying for a loan to buy wood with which to build a new house. She hopes she can provide better conditions to her family with this loan.

loans.use: To buy wood to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim K. is a villager in Angk village in Kandal province. She is a farmer with 0.8 hectare where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which is badly affecting her crop. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Kim K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Also, she will use the rest of the loan to hire laborers to work on the field. Her husband, Mr. Bo Buy, helps her with the plantation. Mrs. Kim K. is 31 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom attends the local school while the youngest one is only two years old.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Mrs. Rom L. was born in 1962 and she now lives in Bro Vash village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Some Noeurn, is a pig breeder. Since his pigs are getting bigger and bigger, he does not have enough money to buy enough feed to support them. Thus, Mrs. Rom L. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig feed. Mrs. Rom L. is 46 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a garment factory worker, while the other three attend the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only four years old. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for her husband's pigs.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey V. is a villager in Trompaing Anh Chanh village in Kampong Cham province. She sells fish in the local village. Since this business is doing well, she wants to expand it by selling her fish door-to-door, so she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike. Mrs. Srey V. is a 41 year old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is a laborer, and the youngest one is still at home.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Siv

texts.en: Siv C. is 38 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province. She makes baskets to sell to both wholesale customers and in the market. She learned to make the baskets from her grandparents, and earns approximately $2 a day. She is married with three young children, who all attend school. Her husband, 38, is a construction worker. To reduce the cost of transportation, Siv C. is requesting a loan to use in addition to her savings in order to buy a motorcycle to transport baskets to sell in the market.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transporting baskets to sell in the market

loans.name: Preung

texts.en: Mr. Preung N. was born in 1972 and he now lives in Bro Vash village in Kampong Cham Province. He sells coconuts and bananas. Since this business is doing well, he wants to expand it, and so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more coconuts and bananas to resell. He hopes to increase his income and improve their living conditions with this new loan. His wife, Mrs. Hang Ren, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. Mr. Preung N. is 36 years old and the father of four children, three of whom attend the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only four years old. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts and bananas to resell.

loans.name: Naem

texts.en: Mrs. Naem S. lives in Bro Vash village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a 61-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is a blacksmith. Another one is a farmer and the youngest attends a local school. Her oldest child lacks the equipment he needs to conduct his business efficiently. In order to improve his productivity, Mrs. Naem S. has applied for a loan to buy him the equipment he needs.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her oldest child's business

loans.name: Hadicha

texts.ru: Ахбутаева Хадича девушка в возросте 20 лет , замужем.Окончив школу она ходила на швейные курсы и стала мастером по пошиву женской одежды.Сейчас она на дому принимает заказы. Её муж занимается откормом скота и продажей.Поэтому Хадича хочет взяв займ закупить к скоту мужа ещё несколько баранов.Она объясняет что её мужу некогда приходить в Микроинвест, и поэтому она сама решила помочь ему в этом.Из-за того что сейчас очень дешёвый скот на рынке она хочет увеличить скот мужа.Она сама в свободное время помогает мужу по откорму скота.Хадича проживает в отдалёном кишлаке Кашка в Гафуровском районе.Её муж постух в кишлаке.
texts.en:
Hadicha A. is a 20-year-old woman and married. After finishing school, she took a sewing course and became a dressmaker. Now she does custom, bespoke work out of her home. Her husband is in the business of fattening and selling cattle. Hadicha would like to take out a loan towards the purchase of several rams for her husband. She explains that her husband would never have come to MicroInvest, so she took it upon herself to assist him with this. Since the price of cattle in the marketplace is currently low, she would like to increase her husband's herd. In her free time, Hadicha helps her husband to feed the cattle. She lives in the remote village of Kashka in the Garfurov region. Her husband is a herdsman in the village.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding of cattle

loans.name: Eth

texts.en: Mrs. Eth M. was born in 1967 and lives in Ou Chrok village in Kampong Cham province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. This business is doing well, so she has decided to expand it by applying for a loan to buy more groceries to sell. Her husband, Mr. Pheak Seak, is a farmer.  They have four children, three of whom help their parents in their businesses while the youngest child attends a local school. Her husband is seen here with her in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell from her store.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa Q. has done a good job of expanding her business. Her moron (a native delicacy made from glutinous rice) is very popular and she has sold it to support her family since 1998.  Elsa is 47 years old, has four children and works very hard to support them.  They live in the barangay of Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.  

Because her business is doing so well, she wants to expand her production and begin selling her output in big cities.  She has hired extra hands to increase her production and introduce her products to other areas.  She believes she will succeed because her products have done well wherever she has sold them.   

Her husband is a coco farmer and helps her produce her goods. They also selling bedding and sheets and raise pigs as sidelines.  They are willing to work hard and make sacrifices to help their children finish their studies.  

Because Elsa is a member of a local cooperative, she has been able to secure loans and has a good credit history.   Elsa is applying for a new loan to buy an electric rice grinder, which will help her increase her production, and to hire more help.  Elsa believes that one day she will reap great rewards from all of her labor.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Mrs. Soeun C. is 21 years old who lives in Kompong Tom Province, where she and her husband make a living growing rice and vegetables. They vary their crop depending on season. The young couple cares for two teenagers, both of whom live with them. To make their work easier and eliminate the expense of renting oxen from others, they have decided to apply for a loan to buy two oxen of their own.

loans.use: to buy two oxen to help them plow their farmland

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mr. San S. lives in Pro Yuk village in Kampong Cham province. He has applied for a loan to buy medications for his patients because the local pharmacy often runs out of what he needs. His wife, Mrs. Math Kam, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she grows rice. Mr. San S. is 56 years old and the father of five children, one of whom is a dentist. The others attend a local school.

loans.use: To buy medications for his patients.

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Phoeurn L. is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is three years old. Her husband is on the right of the photo. Her husband, Mr. Rin Ruon, is a construction worker and also helps his wife in the plantation. Mrs. Phoeurn L. is a farmer in Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham province. She owns land but she does not have enough money to purchase fertilizers to support the field.  Mrs. Phoeurn L. asks for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support the field.

loans.name: Khea

texts.en: Mrs. Khea N. is 41 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a construction worker, while another one is attending the local school, and the last is 5 years old and too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Dy Chheang, helps her on the farm. He is shown on the right of the photo. Mrs. Khea N. is a villager in Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a 2 hectacre field. It is now harvesting season, but she does not have ways to transport her rice yield. Thus, she asks for a loan to buy a cart.

loans.use: To buy a cart to transport her rice yield.

loans.name: Ky

texts.en: Mrs. Ky L. was born in 1946 and now lives in the village of Krodas Kor in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn for living. Her problem is that the soil is not sufficiently fertile. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers to enrich the soil and increase her yield. Her husband, Mr. Touch Kul, helps her work the plantation. Mrs. Ky L. has a child whose salary as a garment worker also helps the family make ends meet. She is shown with her husband in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorng T. lives in the village of Krodas Kor in Kampong Cham province. She is 39 years old and single. She lives with her family, which includes seven people. She and her parents are the breadwinners who try to work hard in order to make an income to support the household.

Mrs. Thorng T. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to improve her field, which is infertile soil. She hopes to make her crop more productive and increase her rice revenue with this loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her field

loans.name: Mei

texts.en:
Mr. Mei S. lives in the village of Krodas Khor in Kampong Cham province. He is 55 years old and the father of three children: two are palm juice collectors and the third is a farmer.

Mr. Mei S. is a farmer who cultivates rice on a 3-hectare field. His wife, Mrs. Muong Ba, helps him on the plantation. He now faces a problem: his field is infertile, which leads a poor crop. To deal with this problem, Mr. Mei S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the field and make it more productive. He is shown with his wife in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make his field more productive

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mr. Yin Y. lives in Steong Reang Village in Kampong Cham Province. He is 47 years old and the father of four children, two of whom are employed while the others are attending the local school.

Mr. Yin Y. is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. However, he does not have enough money to purchase vegetable seeds to grow another crop. Therefore, Mr. Yin Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, along with fertilizers to make his field more productive. His wife, Mrs. Phan Yorn, helps him in the plantation and is shown with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom H. is a farmer who lives in Svay Ta Thom village in Kampong Cham province. Her husband, Mr. Sot Seng, helps her in the plantation. They have seven children. One is a laborer; one is a horse cart driver; four are attending the local school; and the youngest, who is only one year old, is too young to work or study.

Mrs. Mom H.'s second son, the horse cart driver, has problems with his horse, so Mrs. Mom H. decided to ask for a loan to buy him another horse to re-start his business.

Mrs. Mom H. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a horse to pull a cart

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien R., 43, lives in Kampong Siem Reap Province. She and her husband are farmers. They earn money by growing rice and vegetable crops. They have two children, one of whom is married and the other is single and has migrated to Thailand as a construction worker. Because growing crops is their main source of income, Hien R. is asking for a loan to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing the farmland.

loans.use: Buy rice seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma P., 42, lives with her husband Martin in Barangay Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She has been a member of Everlasting Center for eight years.  During this time, she has borrowed money from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. Emma manages a fishing business. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional fishing nets and to buy a pumpboat.  Recently, the couple has been running two pumpboats and they can earn about PHP 700 daily.  Aside from having a fishing business, they also have a piggery to provide additional income. Mrs. P. says it is good to have dual businesses but you have to make sure that you handle them with much care. The success of her business lies in your hands, she added. 

Mrs. P.'s hopes are 1) to provide her children with a good education, 2) that the piggery will succeed, and 3) that their fishing business will flourish.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing nets and a pumpboat

location.town: Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Tren Chan Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tren C. is the leader of a group of five people who live in Trapaing Mteas village in Kampong Chhnang province. She sells firewood. Her husband, Mr. Lum Thol, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Even though they work hard, they still earn less income than they need to provide a better life for their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Tren C. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house. She is 35 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school and the third is still too young to go school. One member of the group, Vy S., was not available for the photo, so her husband is in the photo.

One member of this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. The end-of-term loan client is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow clients to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all AMK clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: My name is Sajida and I’m 35 years old. I completed my education until 8th grade when I lost interest in school. My parents wanted me to study further but I had a creative mind and started making designs from henna on hands. I became famous in my community. On special occasions, girls came to me for making designs on their hands. I married when I was 23. My husband's name is G.. He runs a grocery shop in the food market of Kot Radha kishan. He has a good reputation there. I am the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Both of my children attend school. Both have set their life’s ambition already. My son wants to be an engineer and my daughter wants to be a teacher. I am performing my duties of as a mother and as a wife effectively. I have successfully repaid my two loans which I took from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying for another loan to purchase more items for my husband’s grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin Theap, 37, lives in Siem Reap Province where she makes a living by growing rice. She has been a farmer since 1979. She has no children and is married to Mr. Kan Mean, 43. He is a fisherman. She works hard everyday with her business to earn money to meet her family’s needs. She needs a loan to purchase rice seed and fertilizer and to pay for plowing her farmland. Yin’s husband is shown in the photo because she was not available for the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Irshad Bashir Maish Group

texts.en:
Irshad Baji is a 41-year-old married woman. She lives in Kot Radha Kishan about a half hour away from Kasur, in Pakistan. She has no formal education because her parents couldn’t afford her tuition. Her husband, B. M., is a mason. They have two sons, who are also masons. Irshad Baji embroiders clothes at home. This activity gives her a good income, and she is happy to invest her income in her house. She is asking for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine, which would help her embroider more dresses in less time.

She is the leader of a group of women who are also seeking loans. Shahnaz Baji wants a loan to buy fabric for her clothing business. Zuhra Baji and Sugran Baji each want a loan to buy buffalo for their dairy businesses. Hamidan Baji wants a loan to stock her grocery shop.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Bashiran M. Ishaq Group

texts.en:
Bashiran Baji is 53 years old and married. She lives in Kot Radha Kishan, about half an hour away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She has no formal education. Her husband is M. I., who sells milk for a living. He sells to shops and to the community as well. They have two sons. The elder son works in the army as a cook, and her younger son is a day laborer. Bashiran Baji is a very devoted and hardworking lady. She and her husband get up early in the morning to milk the buffalo and fill the milk jars. Then she cleans the house, prepares food for her family, and does other household chores. She is applying for a loan to buy buffalo to expand her husband’s dairy business.
 
She is the leader of a group of women also applying for loans. Nusrat Baji and Sakina Baji each want a loan to buy buffalo for their dairy businesses. Kosar Baji wants a loan to stock her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Bushra M.anwar Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji is a 36 year old married woman and resides in an area named Kot Radha Kishan of city Kasur, Pakistan. It’s a half hour distance from Kasur. Her husband name is M. who is a mason. She is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. None of her children go to school. Bushra baji handles her milk selling business independently. She gets up at 4 am to start getting milk from the buffalo. She sells the milk in milk shops and earns a small profit. She is applying for a loan to diversify her milk selling business by buying another buffalo. 

She is a group leader of a few more women. Sobia baji and Hamidan baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their milk selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for a milk selling business

loans.name: Sneth

texts.en:
Mr. Sneth S. lives in Doem Pring village in Kandal province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Chham Sokly, is employed in garment factory who can make a small income. Mr. Sneth S. is a father of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Mr. Sneth S. is not presented in the picture because he is busy with his work but his wife is presented instead of him. 

Aside from being a construction worker, he is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He does not have enough money to buy pump machine to water the field. In addition, he does not have rice seed and his field is infertile. In order to solve these problems, he asks for a loan to purchase a pump machine, rice seed, and fertilizer to make his crop more productive.

loans.use: To a purchase pump machine, rice seed, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ngouv

texts.en: Ngouv S. is a 30 year old rice farmer. She owns and runs a plot of farmland for farming rice, growing rice and vegetables. She is a committed woman and works hard to earn money from her farming to support her two children, who are still young and need taking care of. Her husband,Mr.Min Mean, is 25 and farms with his wife. She is a good housewife and always saves money for building a house. S. requests a loan to add to her savings to purchase wood for building a house.

loans.use: to purchase wood for building a house

loans.name: Seema M. Sharif Group

texts.en:
Seema baji is a wife of M. S. who has been a milk seller for the past 20 years. Seema baji resides in the Kot Radha Kishan suburb of Kasur, Pakistan. It’s a half hour distance from Kasur. She is an uneducated lady but she is very responsible. She helps her husband get milk from the buffaloes and then her husband goes to milk shops to sell the milk. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband’s milk selling business. 

She is a group leader of a few women of her locality. Zareena baji and Bilquis baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery stores. Razia baji and Jana baji each want a loan to buy wood to resell. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loans.name: Sugran M.yunas Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is a 38 years old married woman and resides in an area named Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24 km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Her husband name is M., who is a government servant. She is the mother of five children: three daughters and two sons. None of her children goes to school. Sugran baji works as a midwife because her husband’s income is insufficient to meet the expenses. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institution of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy tools and medicines for her business. 

She is a group leader of a few women. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy medicines for her midwife business. Fozia baji wants a loan to buy CD’s to resell. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery store. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Saleema baji wants a loan to buy bed sheets to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy medicines and tools

loans.name: Mrs. Beun Chhum  Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank consists of thirteen members and is located in Phum Lor village in Kampong Chhnang province. They plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Beun C. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. PH. Sony, is a government officer who does not make enough salary to support the family. Even though they have two careers, they still do not earn enough income to support their household. Thus, Mrs. Beun C. decided to ask for a loan to buy three piglets to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase income and provide a better life for her family. She is 54 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is a security guard while the others two are farmers who help the mother farm and the remaining are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy three piglets to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Zareena M. Mushtaq Group

texts.en:
Zareena baji is a 45 years old married woman and resides in a city named Kot Radha Kishan which is 24 km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Her husband name is M. M. who is a delivery man. He delivers fruit and vegetables from one place to another. She is the mother of nine children: five sons and four daughters. Her elder son works in a factory. The next is a tailor. The others are free and don’t do anything. Zareena baji keeps her daughters busy in embroidery. Her daughters make embroidered cloth and Zareena baji sells it in the cloth market. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institution in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a donkey cart for her husband because the old one is wearing down.
 
She is a group leader of a few women. Bushra baji and Zubaida baji each want a loan to repair their vehicle named “Shahzore” for loading and transporting. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy rice to resell.  Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Jeo baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart

loans.name: Mrs. Hen Khoem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. HE. K. is the village bank president of eight members, all live in the Phum Lor village of Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Teng Morm, is a field laborer hired by others to work their land. EvE. though they work hard, they still cannot provide a better living for their family. Thus, Mrs. HE. K. asks for a loan to add her savings to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Parveen M.sharif Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is 50 years old and lives in the village of Kot Radha Kishan, which is about 24 km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She is uneducated because her parents couldn’t afford to send her to school. Her husband is M., and makes a living driving a tractor. They have four children, three sons and one daughter. Her oldest son works in a factory. The others go to a school near their home. Parveen baji runs a cloth-selling business, buying items from the famous city of Multan and selling them in her own town. She does this work to earn a good income and to improve her living standards. She is applying for a loan to increase her income by buying more clothes to sell. 

Parveen baji also leads a small loan group that includes Shaheen baji, who wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop and Hafizan baji, who wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Ul

texts.en: Mrs. Ul S. lives in Bro Youk village in Kampong Cham province. She is a recycling collector. She now wants to buy more products for recycling such as empty bottles, cans, plastic and so on. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Him Phoeun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Ul S. is a mother of three children who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy more recycling products

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long N. lives in the village of Krodas Kor in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder. She is 51 years old and has seven children. One child works in a garment factory and another is a construction worker. The rest attend the local school.

Her husband, Mr. Urn On, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. He faces a problem because his field is infertile. To solve this problem, Mrs. Long N. decided to request a loan so that her husband can buy fertilizer to enrich the soil and make it more productive. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: En

texts.en: Mr. En I. lives in the village of Krodas Khor in Kampong Cham province. He is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Vun Phol, raises pigs. Her business is doing well, and she wants to expand it. Mr. En I. decided to ask for a loan to buy eight more piglets for his wife's business. He hopes to increase income and improve family living conditions with this loan. He is 40 years old. The couple has three children who attend the local school. His wife appears in the photo with hI..

loans.use: To  buy eight piglets for breeding

loans.name: Parveen M.ghafoor Group

texts.en:
Parveen Baji is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives in the city of Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24km from Kasur, Pakistan. Her husband is M., who drives a delivery truck. Parveen Baji is very hardwoking. In addition to being an excellent wife and mother, she works as a seamstress from home. She sews 3 dresses per day and charges 80 Pakistani rupees per dress. She has five kids: four sons and one daughter. None of her children go to school. She would use this loan to repair her husband’s vehicle so that he can continue to earn income for the family. 

She is the leader of a a group of women also seeking loans. Kosar Baji, Nusrat Baji, and Nazra Baji would use their portion of the loan to buy fabric for their clothing businesses. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Yao Atsou

texts.fr: Yao Atsou M. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il réside à Lavie, un village situé à environ 135 kilomètres de Lomé la capitale togolaise. Il fait depuis 6 ans des pépinières de palmiers, de cocotiers, des tecks et des orangers. Il souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son activité en achetant des entrants. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour accroître son activité afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yao Atsou M. is 35 years old, married, and the father of 3 children. He lives in Lavie, a village located approximately 135 kilometers from the capital of Togo. For six years, he's been running a tree nursery (palm tress, coconut trees, teak, and orange trees). With this credit, he wishes to increase the productivity of his business by purchasing fertilizers. He counts on this opportunity to bolster his business in order to better provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for his tree nursery

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 36-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mhammad has sold fish since he was young. He is asking for a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua  to purchase fish. This is the first time that Mhammad has requested a loan. 
 
Mhammad expects that the loan will help him purchase more and better quality fish. He is respected by everyone  because of his honesty. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough capital, so he had to take a partner who wasn’t really helpful. He has been in this business since his childhood.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a 31-year-old woman who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. Hanadi has been working in retail since 2006. Hanadi is asking for a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise wholesale. This is her second loan cycle, and she has always paid on time.

 
When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough capital, but she persevered because of need. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise wholesale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 38-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Ahmad has been a mobile sweets seller for two years. 

Ahmad has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase raw materials to make his sweets. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.  

Ahmad expects that the loan will help him to expand his business. He sells sweets in his neighborhood village. His clients are his friends and family. When Ahmad first started his business, he didn’t have enough capital. He decided to do this work because of his honesty and friends' support. In the future, he plans to expand his business to other villages.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make his sweets.

loans.name: Nazmi

texts.en:
Nazmi is a 42-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. He has been repairing cars, specifically, car bodies, since 1978. 

Nazmi has requested a loan of $500 US dollars to purchase more modern tools. This is the first time that Nazmi has requested a loan. 

Nazmi's business is distinguished by the good quality of his work. His clients are his friends and others. When he first started, he lacked cash. He decided to start this business, because of his good relation with others. In the future, he plans to develop and expand his business.

loans.use: Nazmi needs the loan to purchase more modern tools.

loans.name: Alaa Al Dine

texts.en:
Alaa Al Dine is a 21-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon. He has owned an accessory shop since 2006. He sells perfumes, accessories, gifts, cell phones accessories, and cards to recharge phones. 

Alaa Al Dine has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase recharge-telephone cards, cassettes, and DVDs for his shop. This is the first time that Alaa Al Dine has requested a loan.
  
Alaa Al Dine is distinguished in his work because his business is unique in the area. His clients are friends, neighbors and students. When he first started his business, he didn't have enough cash. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Alaa Al Dine needs a loan to purchase recharge-telephone cards, cassettes, and DVDs for his shop.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 38-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. She has been a seamstress for five years. She sews linens and scarves. 

Rima has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua to purchase linen fabrics. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan.

Her clients are her friends and other people from outside her village. In the future, she plans to expand her business and increase her capitA..

loans.use: Rima needs the loan to purchase linen fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock his shop

loans.name: Faysal

texts.en:
Faysal is a 26-year-old an who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. He has been doing tattoos for five years. 

Faysal has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new tool for tattoos. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on schedule. 

Faysal is distinguished in his work because tattooing is a difficult and rare business. His clients are his friends and neighbors. The loan has influenced his life in a good way.

loans.use: Faysal needs the loan to purchase a new tattoo tool.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 55-year-old man who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, which is located in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. He has made a living repairing cars for 21 years, and has applied for a $1,000 loan from A. Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition. Ali has been a microcredit client for four years now and has always paid on time.

Ali said that previous loans have helped him support his family. He has also done well because he has lots of experience in repairing cars. His clients include friends, neighbors and people from surrounding towns areas. Another reason why Ali does so well is because he owns his shop and house.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to pay schooltuition fees.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 19-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon. Mohamad has owned a coffee shop since 2006. He sells coffee and other types of hot beverages and “narguileh,” also known as “shisha” in Egypt. 

The nargileh is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. A tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Nargileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East, and is beginning to gain popularity in the U.S., Europe and other countries. 

Mohamad has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase a new coffee machine and some merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

Mohamad's business is distinguished by its good quality, and he is known for his polite behavior toward his clients, who are friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had a partner, but that relationship did not work well, so now he is on his own. He decided to do this business, because he wanted to work on his own. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Mohamad needs the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is a 22-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon. Ziad installs aluminum. He works with all kinds of aluminum, like the aluminum used in kitchens, windows, and doors. Ziad has requested a loan of $800 US dollars from Al Majmoua to maintain his machines and purchase merchandise. This is the first time that Ziad has requested a loan.

Ziad is known for his honesty and good work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he wasn’t able to acquire all the tools needed for his work because of their high prices. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Ziad will use the loan to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 42-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He has owned a printing factory, where he also sells cardboard, since 1982. He makes gift boxes, greeting cards, calendars, advertisement leaflets, and candy boxes.  

He has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to pay school fees and purchase some supplies for his factory. Salah has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. 

When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the machinery needed for his printing factory. His clients are from surrounding villages. In the future, he plans to expand his business by purchasing more machinery and become the biggest printing factory in the area.

loans.use: Salah needs the loan to pay school fees and purchase supplies for his factory

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 51-year-old widow who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon, with her five children. Sabah has been selling clothes and underwear from her house since 1983. She sells clothes, underwear, bridal outfits, and pajamas. 

Sabah has requested a loan of $1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase winter pajamas, socks and other merchandise. Sabah has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. 

Sabah is the breadwinner of her family. Sometimes, she receives financial support for her son. Her other children are also helpful. For example, they take her place in her store when she is away. 

Sabah's business is distinguished, because she has low prices, she works from home, and she also provides credit  for her clients, who are friends, family and neighbors. When she first started her business, some of her family members helped her reach out to retail stores. She decided to start her business to support her family after her husband's death.

loans.use: Sabah needs the loan to purchase winter pajamas, socks and other merchandise.

loans.name: Nhoek

texts.en:
Nhoek Y. is a 19-year-old who lives in Saladeng Village in the Banteay Meanchey Province. She grows mushrooms to sell, and has been growing them since 2005. Her business is going well. 

Her husband, age 28, is employed as a driver with a fixed salary, and he drives very well. The young couple have two small children. She also cares for an elderly woman who can help her a little in her work. 

Because she wants to improve her family's income, she wants her husband to have has own car to drive as a taxi. Hence, she would like to request a loan, which she will use with her savings to purchase a used car for $3200 for her husband to drive.

loans.use: To buy a used car for her husband to drive as a taxi

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza is a 26 year old woman who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. She has been working as a hair dresser for seven years. Fayza requests a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for her salon and help her husband buy a car to commute to work. This will be her third loan and she has always paid on time. 
Her previous loan helped her in her life and let her support her family's needs. Fayza is special in her work because she is the only one in her area and has low prices. Her clients come from different neighborhoods. She started her business because of the need of money due to living expenses. In the future, she plans to open another hair dressing salon.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her salon and help her husband buy a car.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 40 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. He has owned a grocery store for eleven years. He is very active. He also sells vegetables in a small truck and drives around the neighborhood around his area. Hassan requests a loan of 800 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase canned food and candies for his shop. This is his second loan and he paid the previous loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase canned food and candies for his shop.

loans.name: Abdushukur

texts.en:
Abdushukur is a 39-year-old man, married with 4 children who drives a taxi and a microbus. He currently relies on a microbus for his public transport business, which he drives personally. Abdushukur has about 7 years of experience in the public transportation field, and the competition is rather high in this business even though there are so many people who need it. He requests a loan of 2000 Somoni ($ 600 USD) for the term of 6 months.so that he can maintain his vehicle, since this is the tool of his trade. With the loan he’ll purchase the spare parts for his microbus. With your support, Abdushukur will continue to progress. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his microbus

loans.name: Ousama

texts.en: Ousama is a 42 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Ousama has been selling and repairing car exhausts for two years.  Ousama is known for the rapidity of his maintenance work and his experience and wants to expand his business. Ousama requests a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase exhausts. This is the first time that Ousama has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase car exhausts.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad is a 40 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. He has been selling bread for eight years. Mouhamad is a mobile merchant; he sells bread in a small truck. Mouhamad decided to do his business because he is the first one to do it. He is special because he is the only who sells bread in his village.  He requests a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance on his house. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan.

loans.use: To do maintenance on his house.

loans.name: Islom

texts.en:
Islom O. is 28 years old. Due to lack of fees for college, Islom was only able to finish regular school. After finishing school he learned various skills, including the painting of cars. He worked in a garage for 10 years. At the beginning he worked as an assistant, and by the end he became experienced in painting cars. Thanks to his abilities he was able to buy his own house, and now he lives with his wife, who works in a local confectionery plant. They have two children. Islom dreams of building his own workshop, so as to be independent and earn more. Now he requests 2500 Somoni ($750) for a term of 12 months. With the loan he wants to purchase apparatus and necessary materials for car painting. Islom is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and such famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of apparatus and materials for car painting

loans.name: Samiha

texts.en: Samiha is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon, with her husband. She has been selling bread for twenty years. She requested a loan of $800 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase flour and a new “saj.” The “saj” is the traditional Lebanese domed metal oven in which one bakes saj bread, or markouk ("thinned") bread, and doughy confections. This is the first time that Samiha has requested a loan. Samiha is special in her work because she sells different kinds of bread. Her clients are neighbors. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour and a new “saj” (oven)

loans.name: Gulnar Safdar Group

texts.en:
Gulnar Baji is 40 years old, married, and resides in an area named Kot Radha Kishan near the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is 24 km away from Kasur. She is an uneducated lady; she couldn’t get an education because her parents didn’t allow her to go to school. Gulnar Baji has decided that she’ll send her children to school. Her husband, S., has a livestock business. He buys animals (goats and sheep) from animal markets and sells them to different butcher shops. He has 11 years of experience in this business. She is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her eldest daughter is in 10th grade. The next oldest is in 8th grade. Her youngest daughter is in 6th grade. Her sons are in kindergarten. Gulnar Baji helps her husband by sewing clothes and making embroidered dresses. She shares her income to relieve her husband from financial burden. She successfully repaid her five loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more animals to grow her husband’s business. 

She is the leader of a group of a few women in her locality. Abida Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothing sales business. Sundas Baji wants a loan to buy chairs for her salon. Marry Silvia Baji wants a loan to buy buffalo for her milk-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals to resell

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 60-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife. Mouhamad has been in agriculture for thirty years, and he also has cattle. He plants cabbage, tomatoes and white beans. Mouhamad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase a milk cow. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan.

Mouhamad is special in his work because of his experience. When he first started his work, he had some cash difficulties. He decided to do this business because of his experience, as well as to earn money to buy raw materials. In the future, he plans to expand his production of milk and yogurt.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin B., 34, raises pigs and sell piglets for breeding as well as pork. He is married and supports three children, all teenagers. His wife helps in this business. He sells his piglets to other breeders for $40 apiece and also pigs for slaughter. The business is doing well, and his customers come to his house to buy. He is asking for a loan to expand his business by purchasing more piglets, buying pig feed, and making improvements to the pigpen.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, buy pig feed, and make improvements to the pigpen

loans.name: Inomjon

texts.en:
Inomjon is the humble father of 5 children who depend on him economically and who are his driving force in life. Inomjon leases farming land for seasons, therefore he cultivates his crops and then sells them, but his profits decrease due to the land payments. Therefore, Inomjon wishes to quickly acquire his own land, where he can sow his crops and improve his revenue. To make that a reality, he needs to increase his production, and especially the quality of his products to make them more profitable in the marketplace. This will bring better profits and then he will be able to acquire a plot of land. The loan required by Inomjon will be used for the purchase of fuels and lubricants, seeds and mineral fertilizer. We hope that you will be of great help to this hardworking father.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.
