And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fuels and lubricants, seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Nirmala Riaz Group

texts.en:
Nirmala baji is a 51 year old married lady who resides in an area named Kot Radha Kishan in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is 24km away from Kasur. She is a 10th standard pass educated lady. After her education, her parents married her to a person named Mr. R., who is a factory worker on monthly wages. Nirmala baji has one son whose name is Sajid Sohail. Sajid completed his education up to 10th standard and then started to run a shop selling calling cards. In this shop he sells different company calling cards. Nirmala baji has no daughter therefore she spends most of her time making embroidery and knitting clothes. She successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more calling cards to increase the profits of her son's business. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Amna baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their milk selling businesses. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy calling cards to sell

loans.name: Ochilboy

texts.en:
Ochilboy is a farmer. Thanks to his hard work and dedication, his farm can earn enough to support his family. Ochilboy lives together with his parents and wife. Ochilboy is currently growing wheat, but after the upcoming harvest he hopes to be prepared to grow new products. In order to do this, he needs a larger quantity of fertilizers so that his crops can develop adequately. He hopes to grow high quality crops so that he can sell them for a better price in the markets. For this reason, Ochilboy is asking for a loan to increase his production and improve his products, the sales from which will fund the planting of a new cycle of crops. Ochilboy hopes that you can consolidate his production plans and sincerely thanks you.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fuels and lubricants, wheat seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Shahana Samuel Group

texts.en:
Shahana baji is a 32 year old married lady who resides in an area named Kot Radha Kishan in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is 24km away from Kasur. She owns a two room brick house, which she has lived in for the past 20 years. She is a very hardworking and responsible lady. She has a milk selling business which she handles independently. She gets up at 4 o’clock to get milk from her buffalo and puts it in milk jars, then she goes to sell it in the milk shops. She does this work to help her husband with the financial burden. Her husband's name is S., and he has a brick selling business. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. She is the mother of three kids: two daughters and one son. None of her children go to school. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Razia baji and Hamidan baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their milk selling businesses. Mona jan baji wants a loan to buy mason tools for her husband. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy medicines for her medical store. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her milk selling business

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr: Ces femmes agées entre 25 et 46 ans habittent toutes dans un quartier de mbour a côté de la mer.Elles sont toutes mariées et mere de plusieurs enfants .Pour combattre l' inactivité et chômage qui frappent les femmes ,elles menent au sein du quartier des activités de transformation  et de vente des produits halieutiques .Pour accroitre leur capacite de production ,elles sollicitent un pret.
texts.en:
These women are between 25 and 46 years old and live next to the sea in a neighborhood of Mbour. They are all married and the mother of several children. To fight idleness and unemployment that affects women, they run several businesses in the heart of their neighborhood, in the sector of fish transformation and sale. To increase their capacity of production, they are seeking this loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their capacity of production

loans.name: Fama's Group

texts.fr: Mariées et mére de famille ,ces femmes agées de 27 à 42 ans ,regroupées au sein sein d' une association s'activent dans la vente et la transformation des produits de la mer.Elles vivent à coté de la mer  .Quand les hommes partent en mer ,elles s'occupent de la maison .Avec le pret sollicité elles veulent renforcer leur activité en augmentant leur capacité de production.
texts.en:
Each one married and the mother of a family, the women in this group are between 27 and 42 years old. They live on the seaside, and their businesses consist in transforming and selling seafood. When the men go out to sea, they take care of the house. With the loan they are seeking, they want to bolster their businesses by increasing their capacity of production.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their capacity of production

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, tiene 43 años  está acompañado con la señora Iluminada Portillo que es ama de casa tienen cuatro hijos uno mayor de edad  que se dedica a la venta ambulante de mercerías y los tres son menores dependientes de sus padres. El se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de mercaderías como por ejemplo: frutas, verduras, panificados, arroz, azúcar, aceite, yerbas entre otros.
Pedro  se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de  ocho años y su local comercial se encuentra en su  casa, dónde para esto, el realizo algunas modificaciones para poder tener el espacio correspondiente para su salón comercial. 
Pedro, con sus ganancias de las ventas aporta a los ingresos de la casa, y junto con su compañera hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.
Pedro, comenta que tiene bastante venta. Es por ello que  desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías como frutas, verduras, productos cárnicos, arroz, aceite, azúcar, etc., de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona.
texts.en:
Pedro is 43 years old and lives with his partner, Mrs. Iluminada Portillo, who is a homemaker. They have four children. One is grown up, and works selling merchandise from a cart. Three of their children are still young, and dependent on their parents. Pedro sells all kinds of merchandise, such as: fruits, vegetables, flat bread, rice, sugar, cooking oil, and herbs, among other things. Pedro has been working in this field for more than eight years. His store is in his house, where he's done some renovations in order to have a space to sell his products. Pedro uses his earnings to contribute to the family's income, and together with his partner is able to cover the family's expenses. Pedro is selling a lot. Because of this he'd like to buy larger quantities of merchandise, like fruits, vegetables, meats, rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc. In this manner he can supply the strong demand in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, rice, sugar, cooking oil, vegetables, fruits, flat bread, and meats.

loans.name: Rout Afzal Masih Group

texts.en:
Rout baji is a 43 year old married lady who resides in an area named Kot Radha Kishan in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is 24km away from Kasur. She completed her education up to 8th standard but couldn’t study further due to the limited financial resources of her family. Her husband's name is A. M., who is a mason with 20 years of experience. Rout baji has a business of sewing clothes. As we all know, inflation is increasing rapidly in Pakistan and it has become very difficult for a person to support a family. She does this business to help her husband with the finances, so that he is able to meet the financial needs of the family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy another sewing machine to sew more clothes. 

She is a group leader of some more women. Naseem baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their milk selling businesses. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine to sew clothes

loans.name: Irshad M.yunas Group

texts.en:
Irshad Baji is the wife of M. Yunas and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, about 24km  from Kasur, Pakistan. She completed schooling through the 8th standard. She owns a two-room brick house in which she has lived for 25 years. She has seven children: three daughters and four sons. Her two oldest sons work in a cotton factory. Two boys attend school. One is in the 10th standard, and the youngest son is in 2nd standard. Her elder daughter is in 10th standard, and her youngest daughter is in 6th standard. Her husband works in a railway station. 

Irshad Baji runs a dairy business to help meet expenses and operates this business independently. She uses her income to pay her children's school fees, and her husband contributes his income toward house expenses. She successfully repaid five previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for another loan to buy a buffalo. 

She is the leader of a group of women also seeking loans. Majidan Baji and Naheed Baji each want a loan to buy goats for resale. Razia Baji and another Razia Baji each want a loan to buy buffalo for their dairy businesses. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for a dairy business

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia A. lives in Ermoclia village, Stefan Voda district. She has worked at Miturix-Agro Ltd. since 1999. Currently, she is the accounting officer. 

On 04.12.2006 received from a loan from Microinvest worth 10,000 lei that matured on 04.12.2008, and was repaid without any problems on 03.10.2008. The loan was requested to purchase furniture that Ms. Claudia wanted to purchase a long time ago. We hope that this loan helped her dream to become reality.

loans.use: To purchase furniture

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
La señora Alba tiene  35 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos; ella confecciona ropas interiores para damas,  emprendió esta actividad en forma independiente desde el año 2004, pues, anteriormente era empleada de una empresa de confecciones.
Ella tiene una clientela formada, comercializa sus productos al por mayor, sus clientes son mesiteros en el micro centro de Ciudad del Este y otros vendedores que viajan en el interior del país; ella solicita el préstamo para  comprar telas en cantidad y así lograr aumentar sus ventar y por ende sus ingresos, ella va consolidando de a poco su negocio y cada vez va mejorando su local y aumentando sus herramientas de trabajos.
 Ella manifiesta que todos los créditos le fueron útiles por que siempre invirtió en su negocio por lo que espera que siempre obtenga apoyo de las instituciones formales.
texts.en:
Alba is 35 years old, married, with 4 children. She makes lingerie for women. She taught herself this profession in 2004, previously she was an employee in a seamstress shop. She has a good customer base, sells her products at wholesale, her customers are the vendors in the Ciudad del Este shopping center and other vendors that travel throughout the county. She is seeking a loan to buy quantities of fabric and in this way be able to increase her inventory and subsequently her income. She is consolidating her business a little and each time improving her locale and increasing the tools for her work. She states that all the loans were useful because she always invested in her business and she hope that she will always have the support of the formal institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various fabrics

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Vicente es casado con 4 hijos, tiene 59 años de edad, su negocio lo emprendió desde el año 1985, era una época floreciente en Ciudad del Este, pero hoy en  día ha bajado su nivel de venta, pero sigue en competencia gracias a su carácter y espíritu jovial. 
Tiene mucha clientela, pero necesita una inyección de capital para comprar las menudencias en  mayor cantidad y por adelantado por que tiene mucha competencia y la única forma de conseguir barato y en forma asegurada es pagando un día antes al proveedor. Las menudencias son las partes internas de animales vacunos, cerdo, gallinas que también son muy consumidos en nuestro país. Entre ellas están el hígado que se consume popularmente como bife con cebolla acompañado de arroz, también se consume el riñón, corazoncitos de gallina, intestinos, etc.

El quiere ir mejorando su negocio para poder obtener mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Vicente is married with 4 children. He is 59 years old and he started his business in 1985 during a time when Ciudad del Este was flourishing. But today his sales have lowered, yet he continues in his business thanks to his character and jovial spirit. He has many customers, but he needs an injection of capital in order to buy large quantities giblets and organ meat and purchase them in advance because this is the only way to get an inexpensive price and assure payment a day prior to delivery. Giblets and organ meat are the internal parts of beef, pork, chicken, and are frequently consumed in our country. Among them are liver which is commonly eaten as liver and onions with rice, and also we eat kidney, chicken heart, intestine, etc. He wishes to continue improving his business in order to obtain greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy organ meat, giblets, and a scale

loans.name: Hanifan M.siddique Group

texts.en:
"I am Hanifan, a 52-year-old widow. I am a citizen of Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24 km from Kasur, Pakistan. I come from a poor family, but I have never felt badly about it." 

"My husband left me alone in this world. He died from a heart attack. I worked hard for my children. I worked as a sweeper for 5 years and then I started knitting clothes." 

"I have four children: three sons and one daughter. My eldest son runs a food business. The others work in a factory. My daughter help me to knit clothes. I am transferring my skills to my daughter so that she will be able to knit clothes indepenedently."

Hanifan has successfully repaid her four previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil and spices for her son's food business. 

She is the group leader of a group of five women in her locality. Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy thread to make shawls. Kosar baji and Bashiran baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their milk-selling businesses. Marzina baji wants a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for her decorative embroidery business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy supplies for food-selling business

loans.name: Crispín

texts.es:
El señor Crispín es casado, tiene 38 años, con 5 hijos,  tiene una despensa y un tambo. La despensa atiende la señora Julia (Esposa) y el tambo queda a cargo del señor Crispín.
La despensa tiene una antigüedad de 7 años y el tambo 2 años.
El quiere comprar una vaca de raza Holanda para su Tambo, pues, comercializa leche y tiene buen margen de ganancia, además es una actividad que conoce desde infancia por lo que la inversión es muy seguro. Sus hijos le ayudan en todas las tareas por lo que simplifica su labor. Con las ganancias que acumula quiere invertir en su casa porque le faltan más piezas para la comodidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Crispín is married, 38 years old, and has 5 children. He has a convenience store and a dairy farm. His wife Julia takes care of the store and Crispín takes care of the dairy farm. The store has been in business 7 years and the farm 2 years. He wants to buy a Holland cow for his dairy farm as he sells milk and he has a good profit margin. In addition this is an activity he has done since he was a boy so the investment is very secure. His children help him with all the chores so that reduces his labor. With the earning he accumulates he wants to invest in his home because he is missing pieces that would make it more comfortable for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a Holland cow

loans.name: Pelucia

texts.es:
La señora Pelucia se dedica en macate, es decir, ventas de prendas de vestir a créditos, esta actividad viene desarrollando hace 7 años. Ella es casada, su marido es el señor Crescencio Páez, que actualmente se dedica en la fabricación y ventas de chipitas, estamos hablando de una pareja muy creativa y con una actitud emprendedora genuina. 
La señora Pelucia tiene 36 años, tiene un hijo en edad escolar, ella se inicio en el comercio gracias al apoyo de su marido, pues, fue con el que aprendió a  negociar sus productos.

 Ya tiene más de 400 clientes y quiere seguir aumentando por lo que solicita el crédito, ella manifiesta que el crédito le da la posibilidad de aumentar su cartera de clientes porque con los ingresos que ella percibe a diario es solamente para mantener lo actual y dice que necesita mejorar sus ingresos para poder brindarle mayor comodidad y educación a su hijo, porque ellos no tuvieron esa oportunidad, por venir  padres pobres.
texts.en:
In Macate Pelucia sells clothing from home to home on credit, an activity she has been doing for 7 years. She is married, her husband is Crescencio Páez, and today he makes and sells “chipitas,” a type of corn bread. We are talking about a very creative couple with a genuinely enterprising attitude. Pelucia is 36 years old, has a school-age son, and she began her business with the support of her husband and she learned to market her products with him. Now she has more than 400 customers and she wants to continue growing her business so she is seeking a loan, which will give her the possibility of increasing her customer base because with the daily income she receives she can only maintain her business and she says that it is necessary to improve her income in order to provide greater comforts and education to her son as they didn’t have this opportunity as they came from poor parents.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jeans for women and men

loans.name: Farhat Abudl Rahman Group

texts.en:
I am Farhat and I’m a 44-year-old married woman. I am a citizen of Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24 km from Kasur, Pakistan. I am an uneducated woman, but I do not hesitate to mention it. But I’ll mention that education is very essential for growing up in life. My husband is also not an educated person. He is a milk-seller with 5 years of experience.

I am the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. My eldest son manufactures cloth on a power loom machine. My younger son runs a grocery shop. My eldest daughter makes thread and sells it in the market. The other two are getting education in a local school near the house. I help my elder daughter make thread. We both go to the market to sell it.

I successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy more milk to expand my husband’s milk selling business. 

I am a group leader of a group of five women. Anayat baji wants a loan to buy iron and plastic for her scrap business. Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy utensils to resell. Suraiya baji wants a loan to by an electric sewing machine to make embroidered dresses. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy rice and wheat to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy milk for milk-selling business

loans.name: Maryam Sarfraz Anayat Group

texts.en:
Maryam baji is a 33-year-old married woman who resides in Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24 km from Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, where she has been living for the past 15 years. Her husband, S. A., is a factory worker. 

She is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Both of her children are enrolled in a local school located near their house. Maryam baji’s father-in-law also lives with her family.

Her father-in-law has a business selling animal food. He has been selling animal food for the past 40 yeas. Maryam baji stays at home and sews clothes. She sews clothes for her neighbors and earns a  profit. She uses her income to pay the school fees of her children. She has successfully repaid her four previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more animal food to expand her father-in-law’s business. 

She is the leader of a group of three women. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy animal food to sell

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca es madre soltera con  2 hijos menores, ellos son su compañía y el motivo de su lucha de todos los días, procurando poder darles lo mejor.
Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y muy conocida en le barrio.
Su hijo mayor tiene 12 años y el le ayuda en con las tareas en  la despensa.
Consiguió montar su despensa con un poco de dinero que le había regalado su padre para poder iniciar su negocio.
Sus hijos estudian en la escuelita del barrio.
Ella es una persona muy luchadora y honesta, conocida y querida por todos los que viven en ese barrio. Ella ha demostrado ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas cumpliendo exactamente con sus obligaciones con la institución en las fechas pactadas previamente.
texts.en:
Blanca is a single mother with two young sons. They are her companions and her motivation to fight each day in order to provide the best for them. She has a well-stocked despensa (small shop that sells basic necessities) that is well known in her neighborhood. Her older son is twelve years old and helps her with all the tasks in the shop. She was able to open her shop with a small amount of money that her father gave to her. Her children study at a neighborhood school. She is a fighter and she is honest, known and loved by the entire neighborhood. She has proven herself to be responsible with her loan repayments, completing all of her obligations with the lender by the agreed-upon dates.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, noodles, breads, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Felicia esta casada con el Sr. Mario y tienen una bebita de10 meses.
Ellos trabajan juntos en un puesto que tienen en el micro centro  donde venden y repara celulares de todas las marcas.-
Ellos se iniciaron en le ramo con el capital que consiguieron con la liquidación de un trabajo que tenían. 
Hoy día ya tiene una buena cantidad de mercaderías para poder salir adelante. 
Tienen su casa en le barrio remansito y ambos demostraron ser buenas personas y muy responsable en el  pago de sus cuotas en otros créditos que llevaron anterior mente.
texts.en:
Felicia is married to Mario and they have a little 10-month-old baby. They work together at a stand they have in the shopping center where they sell and repair all brands of cell phones. They began in the industry with capital they obtained from the liquidation of a business they had previously. At present time, they have a good amount of merchandise in order to move forward and get ahead. They make their home in the Remansito neighborhood and they both have shown themselves to be good people and have been very responsible in repaying other loans that they previously carried.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various makes and models of cell phones.

loans.name: Nadejda

texts.en:
Nadejda B. lives in Baccealia village, Causeni district. Since 2005, Ms. Nadejda has worked in the SA-Elevator Kelley Grains company, currently as guardian. Previously, she worked as an aide in Brigadir Kolkhoz in the village.

This is her first loan from Microinvest. The loan was required to pay for connecting gas to her home. Now, Nadejda is going through a very difficult period, because she lives alone and she only needs to maintain herself to survive. 

Nadejda has 4 boys, three of whom are married and have a secure future. The youngest is in the army, and he has a girlfriend who is looking forward to his return to get married. Ms. Nadejda knows she can appeal to her children, but she wants to handle it herself. The most important thing is that Ms. Nadejda is happy, and she loves her children, so she knows that she will require help from them.

loans.use: For connecting gas to her home.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor Ignacio está casado con la señora Herminia Martínez de R., actualmente tienen 52 años, tienen 2 hijos, uno está entrando en la facultad y el otro en edad escolar.
El señor Ignacio tiene un taller mecánico en el barrio Las Mercedes de Ciudad Pdte. Franco, el negocio ya tiene hace 10 años, es su segunda operación con Fundación Paraguaya, es un cliente excelente y muy responsable con sus pagos. Está muy conforme con la ayuda que le está proporcionando la Fundación.
 Además de la reparación de vehículos también  compra vehículos obsoletos y quita todos los repuestos y posteriormente los vende, a muy bajo costo, pero le deja muy buena ganancia.
texts.en:
Ignacio is married to Herminia Martínez de R., both are 52 years old, have two children, one entering the university and the other is school-aged. Ignacio has a mechanic's shop in the neighborhood of Las Mercedes de Ciudad Pdte. The business is 10 years old and this is the second time working with Fundación Paraguaya. He is an excellent client and very responsible with payments. He is very satisfied with the help provided by the Fundacion. Besides auto repair, he also buys salvaged cars, removes their parts, and sells the parts at a very low cost while still allowing himself good earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used auto parts.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El Sr. Rafael esta casado con la Sra. Elsa ellos ya no tienen hijos pequeños que vivan con ellos. Tienen 4 hijos todos casados y con hijos.
Don Rafael y la Sra. Elsa tienen una pequeña fabrica de almohadas, ellos fabrican y tiene 3 vendedores que salen a la calle a colocar las mercaderías.
Ellos se iniciaron con una pequeña maquina que la Sra. Elsa tenía entonces.
Son 2 personas muy trabajadoras y  honestas.
Retiran el crédito para aumentar la cantidad de su materia prima y así  producir más.
texts.en:
Rafael is married to Elsa. They do not have children living at home, but they do have 4 children all married with children of their own. Rafael and Elsa own a small pillow factory. They manufacture and have 3 salespeople that go out to the streets and display their merchandise for sale. They began with a small sewing machine that Elsa already owned. They are two very honest and hardworking people. They request the loan in order to increase their amount of raw material in order to produce more.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various fabrics, threads, and foam/pillow fill.

loans.name: Venancio

texts.es:
El Sr. Venancio esta casado con la Sra. Eladia, ellos tienen  2 hijos menores que aun están en la escuela primaria.
El Sr. Venancio se inició en este trabajo con la ayuda de un tío que desde chico le había enseñado la profesión de tapicero.-
El junto su dinero durante varios años para poder independizarse y así dar una estabilidad económica a su esposa e hijos.
La Sra. Eladia le ayuda en algunas pequeñas cosas que ya ha aprendido de su marido.
Ellos viven en un barrio donde son muy queridos por lo vecinos y actualmente ya tienen una clientela formada.
texts.en:
Mr. Venancio is married to Mrs. Eladia, and they have 2 younger children who are still in elementary school. Mr. Venancio started to work when he was very young with the support of his uncle who taught him the profession of upholstery.

He saved money for several years to become independent and offer economic stability to his wife and children.

Mrs. Eladia helps him with some details she has learned from her husband.

They live in a neighborhood where they have an excellent relationship with the neighbors and presently they can count on a group of stable clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials such as thread, fabric and leather.

loans.name: El Manantial Group

texts.es:
El contacto para la formación fue la señora Elba M., domiciliada en el barrio Romancito Sector 5 de C.D.E. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en dicha zona.
El comité se denomina “El Manantial”, está constituido  por 16 señoras muy activas todas de la misma zona.
Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser Venta de: Pantalones, remeras, tomates, cebollas, maquillajes, polvo compacto, cremas para el rostro, perfumes,  manzanas, bananas, melones, sandias, platos, cucharas, Tenedores, cuchillos y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo.
El detalle de actividades por señora es la siguiente:
El Crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
The contact person for this group was Mrs. Elba M., who lives in the neighborhood Romancito Sector 5 de C.D.E. She contacted her neighbors and friends to set up the committee for the aforementioned area.

The committee is called "El Manantial" and is made up by 16 very active ladies, all from the same neighborhood. They carry out different activities such as sale of trousers, T-shirts, tomatoes, onions, make-up, compact powder, facial cream, perfumes, apples, bananas, melons, watermelons, plates, spoons, forks, and knives. Some of them are setting up a new business but have a fixed income. The loan will be spent on the purchase of merchandise and basic articles to be sold later.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, vegetables, cosmetics, cutlery, etc. for retail sale.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is married and has two kids. She sells clothing in the local market in Vasilyevka. She has been running this business for only a year. Tamara admits that she started learning the tricks of her trade only when this financial crisis hit all small entrepreneurs. Many went bankrupt in less than two months. She is struggling to survive and keep her business running at the moment. 

Tamara needs a 4000 Grivna loan to increase her turnover capital and her sales this holiday season, which just started in Ukraine (the holiday season usually lasts for over two weeks in Ukraine). Tamara is very prompt with her payments and accurate with her settlements. She is very devoted to her venture, and all her family is actively helping her run this venture. Tamara says that she tries not to give up and has optimistic view of the future.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Mirando Al Futuro Group

texts.es: Los socios del grupo "Mirando Al Futuro" están representados por la señora Judith  Roxana y como el nombre dice ellos (as) son gente responsable y honesta con una visión a futuro para mejorar sus vidas y la de sus familias. En general los socios (as) se dedican al comercio de productos como la artesanía, zapatos, muebles, medicamentos,  ropa mantas y ala confección de prendas de vestir y deportivas. el destino del crédito es para el incremento de su mercadería y para renovar las herramientas de trabajo así como para la compra de insumos de mayor calidad para el mejoramiento de sus productos terminados. Los socios (as) tiene experiencia en grupos solidaR. ya que no es la primera vez que participan de los Bancos comunales de la fundación Agrocapital es por eso que conocen la responsabilidad y el cumplimiento que se requiere para un financiamiento y adquirir un capital de trabajo para el mejoramiento de sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The partners of the group "Mirando Al Futuro" are represented by Mrs. Judith Roxana, and they are all honest and responsible individuals with a vision to improve theirs and their families' lives in the future, as indicated by the name of the group (Looking to the Future). In general the partners sell products for a living such as artcrafts, shoes, furniture, medicine, blankets, garments, and sportswear. The loan will be spent on increasing the merchandise and renew work tools, as well as to buy raw materials of a better quality to improve the finished products.

The partners have experience in solidarity groups as this is not the first time they participate in the communal banks of the Fundación Agrocapital, and therefore the responsability and punctuality needed to obtain a loan and a work capital to improve their income and the life quality of their families are well-known.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Chanta Arame

texts.fr: Chantal Arame T., 49 ans, mariée, 01 enfant et 04 autres en charge est membre du banc villageois de Ngueen depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut  un prêt pour renforce  son activité de vente de boissons en bouteille et canettes. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Chantal Arame T., age 49, is married and has a child, plus four others to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group Ngueen for a year and a half. She wants a loan to bolster her business selling bottled and canned drinks. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in beverages

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 3 Group

texts.es:
El contacto para  formar el presente comité fue la señora  Irmina Espínola que actualmente pertenece al comité Torype Oñondivepa 
de la zona del Barrio san Miguel, ella es amiga de la señora Zulma V. quien contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité .
 Este grupo se formo en el barrio San Miguel están en el tercer ciclo con 19 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas entre ellas.
Cada una realiza su propia actividad comercial que les permite acrecentar el ingreso de sus familias, sus mayores preocupaciones son el futuro de sus hijos. Estas actividades se detallan como sigue:
Zulma V. 	Venta de Útiles escolares 
Agar Espínola 	Peluquería 
Andrea Céspedes 	Venta De Ropa  
Isabel B. 	Venta de Bebidas
Maria Dávalos	Venta de Ropa
Nélida P.	Venta de Comidas 
Elodia G.	Modista  
Mercedes R. 	Modista 
Juana S. 	Venta De Ropa  
Aeropagita Beltrán 	Venta De Ropa  
Lilian M. 	Despensa 
Maria B. 	Venta De Ropa  
María G. 	Manicurista 
Isabel Beltrán 	Venta De Ropa  
Dionisia C.	Venta De Remedio 
Victoriana C. 	Venta de Producto de limpieza 
Celidonia E. 	Despensa 
Arcadia A. 	Venta de Bebidas
texts.en:
The contact person to set up this committee was Mrs. Irmina Espínola who presently belongs to the committee "Torype Oñondivepa" of the area of Barrio San Miguel. She is a friend of Mrs. Zulma V. who contacted her neighbors and friends to set up the committee. This groups initiated in the Barrio San Miguel, it is its third cycle with 19 members, one of the most united groups of the area.

Each member carries out a commercial activity that allows them to increase the family income. Their main worry is the future of their children. The activities are listed as follows:

Zulma V., sale of school supplies. Agar Espínola, hairdresser, Andrea Céspedes, sale of clothing, Isabel B., sale of beverages, María Dávalos, sale of clothing, Nélida P., sale of food, Elodia G., dressmaker, Mercedes R., dressmaker, Juana S., sale of clothing, Aeropagita Beltrán, sale of clothing, Lilian M., groceries, María B., sale of clothing, María G., manicurist, Isabel Beltrán, sale of clothing, Dionisia C., sale of medicine, Victoriana C., sale of cleaning products, Celidonia E., groceries, Arcadia A., sale of beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase business.

loans.name: Chantal Khoudia

texts.fr: Chantal Khoudia D., 46 ans, 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Ngueen depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut acheter de l’huile végétale, de la pâte d’arachide, du sucre et des graines d’arachide pour renforcer son commerce de condiments. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Chantal Khoudia D., age 46, has six children in her care and has been a member of the village loan group of Ngueen for a year and a half. She wants to buy vegetable oil, peanut butter, sugar, and whole peanuts to bolster her commerce in condiments. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in vegetable oil, peanuts, and sugar

loans.name: Sartawi Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo "Sartawi " están representados por la señora María Victoria y por  trece miembros D. los cuales cuatro son varones y el resto mujeres, son amigos y vecinos del mismo barrio. En su mayoría se dedican a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, pollos y repuesto para vehículos en el mercado central D. la ciudad D. El Alto. Dentro del rubro D. ventas D. producto siempre existe la competencia y en especial con el comercio D. ropa en la cual se debe tener productos acordes a al época y a la moda para no perder clientela. El destino del financiamiento es para incrementar su mercadería y cambiarla por productos D. verano e impermeables para la época D. lluvias que es lo que mas busca el cliente exigente. Los socios (as) tiene  experiencia con grupos solidarios debido a su participación dentro D. la Fundación agrocapital en otros grupos por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo así como la responsabilidad que se requiere para cumplir con los pagos y lograr el objetivo D. mejora e incrementar sus ingresos para que sus hijos tengan una mejor educación y una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The partners of the group "Sartawi" are represented by Mrs. María Victoria and thirteen partners, four male and the rest female, friends and neighbors from the same area. Most of them are dedicated to the sale of garments, chickens, and spare parts for vehicles at the central market of the town of El Alto. There is always competition related to selling products, especially selling garments as they have to be adequate for the season and in style not to lose clients. The loan will be spent on increasing the amount of merchandise and change it for products fit for summer and raincoats for the rainy season, products that are most popular among the clients. The partners are experienced with solidarity groups as they have participated within Fundación Agrocapital in other groups and they know how it works as well as the required responsibility to repay punctually and reach the objective to improve and increase their income so that their children may have a better education and a better life quality.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Lucerito Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité  fue la señora Rosana V., está casada con el Señor Diosnel Evancio es madre de 2 Hijos ella es Peluquera vive en el km 8 Monday de C.D.E. A la señora le agrado mucho el Programa de comité e Mujeres Emprendedoras contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en dicha zona.
El comité se denomina “Lucerito”, está constituido  por 15 señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona.
Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser:
Ramona A.	Venta de Frutas
Rosana V.	Peluquería
Beatriz D.	Venta De Huevo
Margarita R.	Despensa
Estela Ramírez	Venta De Ropa Interior
Eulalia Espínola	Venta De Cubiertos
Gregoria M.	Venta De Frutas
Gladys Ibáñez	Venta De Materiales De Limpieza
Asunción C.	Venta De Ropa
Maria T.	Venta De Ropa
Noelia A.	Venta De Joyas
Elisa A.	Venta De Ropa
Maria V.	Venta De Huevo y Queso
Rosana A. 	Venta De Verduras
Librada Agüero	Venta De Gallina


El Crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad para la venta como: pantalones, remeras, tomates, cebollas, pulseras, cadenas cremas para el rostro,  manzanas, bananas, gaseosas, galletitas, caramelos, melones, sandias, azúcar, leche, aceite, escobas, rapo de piso, detergente, suavizante y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo y desean invertir en una actividad extra.
Las señoras retiran un crédito de Gs 300.000 c/u
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosana V. formed this committee. She is married to Mr. Diosnel Evancio and is the mother of two daughters. She is a hairdresser and lives at Km 8 Monday de C.D.E. She is very grateful to the program of the committee and the Mujeres Emprendedoras' contact with neighbors and friends to form the committee in this zone. The committee is called Lucerito (Little Star) and is made up of 15 very active and supportive women all from the same neighborhood. They all have different professions such as: Ramona A. Fruit sales Rosana V. Hair dresser Beatriz D. Egg sales Margarita R. Shop owner Estela Ramírez Sale of undergarments Eulalia Espínola Sale of cutlery Gregoria M. Fruit sales Gladys Ibáñez Sale of cleaning products Asunción C. Clothing sales Maria T. Clothing sales Noelia A. Jewelry sales Elisa A. Clothing sales Maria V. Sale of eggs and cheese Rosana A. Sale of vegetables Librada Agüero Sale of chickens The loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise and needed items such as: pants, t-shirts, tomatoes, onions, bracelets, chains, face creams, apples, bananas, soft drinks, cookies, candies, melons, watermelons, sugar, milk, oil, brooms, mops, detergent, fabric softener, and other things that will bring in more work and provide a fixed income and allow investments in additional activities. The woman are requesting a loan of Gs 300.000 c/u.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchse of fruits, vegetables, chickens, cosmetics, eggs, candy, beverages, cutlery, plastics, clothing, foods, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Rosas De Los Andes Group

texts.es: LAS SOCIAS DEL GRUPO "ROSAS D. LOS ANDES" ESTÁN REPRESENTADOS POR LA SEÑORA LOURDES Y COMPUESTA D. 13 MIEMBROS D. LOS CUALES DOS SON VARONES Y EL RESTO MUJERES TRABAJADORAS Y EMPRENDEDORAS ES D. AHÍ EL NOMBRE. LOS SOCIOS (AS) SON GENTE HUMILD. PERO CON MUCHOS DESEOS D. PROGRESAR TRABAJANDO EN SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA D. PRODUCTOS COMO LA COMIDA, RELOJES, ROPA, ZAPATOS, FRUTAS, MOCHILAS Y MANTAS TEJIDAS. EXISTE BASTANTE COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO SIN EMBARGO ELLAS SE VALEN D. LA EXPERIENCIA Y D. LA RAPIDEZ QUE TIENEN PARA CAMBIAR SU MERCADERÍA, SIEMPRE ESTÁN D. ACUERDO AL COMPORTAMIENTO DEL MERCADO Y D. ACUERDO A LA ÉPOCA, PERO LAMENTABLEMENTE ALGUNAS SOCIAS NO LOGRA ENTRAR DENTRO D. ESTA RENOVACIÓN Y ES LA CAUSA PRINCIPAL PARA UN INCUMPLIMIENTO A SU PLAN D. PAGOS, PERO SUS COMPAÑEROS D. GRUPO SIEMPRE ESTÁN PARA DARLES UNA MANO Y EVITAR CUALQUIER CAÍDA D. LOS MIEMBROS D. SU GRUPO COMPUESTO EN SU MAYORÍA POR AMIGOS D. MUCHOS AÑOS ATRÁS. EL DESTINO DEL FINANCIAMIENTO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. MERCADERÍA E INSUMOS PARA ATENDER LA DEMANDA DEL MERCADO. LOS SOCIOS (AS)  TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS POR LO QUE CONOCEN LA MODALIDAD D. PAGO, LA RESPONSABILIDAD Y CUMPLIMIENTO QUE SE REQUIERE PARA CONSERVARSE COMO UN GRUPO D. LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL.
texts.en:
The partners of the “Rosas D. los Andés” (Roses of the Andes) group are represented by Lourdes. The group consists of 13 members, two of which are men and the rest are hardworking and enterprising women, thus the name of the group. The members are people of humble means, but with a great desire to make progress by working in sales of products such as food, watches, clothing, shoes, fruits, backpacks, and embroidered shawls. There is a lot of competition in the market, but they benefit from their experience and the quickness with which they change their merchandise. They are always prepared to deal with the behavior of the market and are prepared for the season. Unfortunately, however, some of the members are not able to enter into this new loan cycle, and this is the main reason for not complying with their payment plan. However, the other members of the group are always there to help them out and to avoid losing members of the group, which is mostly composed of friends of many years. The use of the loan is to purchase merchandise and ingredients in order to meet the demand of the market. The members have experience in loan groups, so they understand the method of payment and the level of responsibility and follow-through that is required to maintain themselves as a group with Fundación Capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Angele

texts.fr: Angele est une femme agée d'une trentaine d 'année  .Elle gere une épicerie qu' elle a mis en place a partir de fonds propres . Elle a soucrit à la caisse depuis trois (3).Pour renforcer son activité elle sollicite un pret.
texts.en:
Angele is approximately 30 years old. She runs a grocery store, a business she started out of her own money. She's been a member of UIMCEC for 3 years. She's seeking this loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her grocery store business

loans.name: Bafodé

texts.fr: Bafodé K. habite kolda au quartier Doumassou,dans la maison paternelle. Il est marié et pére de trois(03) enfants. Il tient dans cette meme maison une unité de fabrication artisanale de savons locaux à base de produits locaux (huile de palme, péte d'arachide, sel, etc.). La production est vendue à kolda meme et au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires.Il est aidé par sa femme dans la distribution de ses produits. Avec cette activité, il réussit à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Il souhaiterait bénéficier du crédit pour l'extension de son activité.
texts.en:
Bafodé K. lives in his father's house in the Doumassou neighborhood in Kolda. He's married and the father of three children. In the house where he lives, he has set up an artisanal soap production unit. The soap is made out of local products (palm oil, peanut paste, salt, etc). His production is sold directly in Kolda, as well as at the weekly markets. His wife helps him in distributing his products. Thanks to this business, he manages to provide for his family and to pay for his children's tuition. He's seeking this loan to expand his business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell soap made out of local products

loans.name: Viviane Nogaye

texts.fr: Viviane Nogaye D., 50 ans, 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Ngueen depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut acheter des légumes, et des thioub (tissus teintés) pour renforcer son commerce. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Viviane Nogaye D. is 50 years old, has 6 children to support, and has been a member of the Ngueen village bank for one year and a half. She wants to buy vegetables and thioub (dyed cloth) to bolster her business. She's seeking a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell vegetables and dyed cloth

loans.name: Vicuñitas De Tunari Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "VICUÑITAS DEL TUNARI " ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA LILIANA ELLA AL IGUAL QUE SUS COMPAÑERAS TIENE UNA FAMILIA NUMEROSAS COMPUESTA D. CINCO MIEMBROS. LAS SOCIOS (AS) SON GENTE TRABAJADORA Y MUY RESPONSABLE, EN GENERAL SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO D. MERCADERÍAS COMO LA ROPA, ARTESANÍAS, MANTA D. VICUÑA, ZAPATILLAS DEPORTIVAS, ABARROTES, REPUESTOS PARA AUTO Y A LA CONSTRUCCIÓN D. VIVIENDAS. DENTRO DEL MERCADO SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA D. LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA, LAS SOCIAS HAN APRENDIDO A COMBATIRLA HACIENDO ROTAR SU MERCADERÍA PARA PONER A LA VENTA LOS PRODUCTOS D. LA ÉPOCA, ALGUNAS D. ELLAS NO LOGRAN HACERLO A TIEMPO QUEDÁNDOSE CON MERCARÍA PASADA Y DIFÍCIL D. VENDER AL CLIENTE EXIGENTES ES POR ESTA CAUSA QUE AVECES LAS SOCIAS RETRAZAN SUS PAGOS. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. SU MERCADERÍA PARA LA ÉPOCA NAVID.ÑA EN LA CUAL HAY MAYOR DEMANDA D. PRODUCTOS Y PARA LA COMPRA D. HERRAMIENTAS D. TRABAJO EN LOS CASOS D. LOS VARONES. SU EXPERIENCIA DENTRO DEL MARCO D. GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS ES BUENA YA QUE ALGUNOS D. LOS MIEMBROS D. ESTE GRUPO PARTICIPARON D. OTROS FINANCIAMIENTOS EN OTROS GRUPOS DIFERENTES LOGRANDO CUMPLIR CON LOS PAGOS PUNTUALMENTE. EXISTE UN PARENTESCO FAMILIAR DENTRO DEL GRUPO ENTRE LA SEÑORA MARISOL Y GONZALO ELLOS SON HERMANOS PERO TIENEN INGRESOS TOTALMENTE INDEPENDIENTES.
texts.en:
The group "Vicunitas del Tunari" is represented by Mrs. Liliana Ella who just like her partners has a large family maD. up of five members. The members are hardworking and responsible people. In general they are involved in the sale of merchandise such as clothing, handicrafts, vicuna (an animal related to the llama) blankets, sneakers, groceries, auto parts, and home construction. Within any market there always exists the competition of supply and demand, and these women have learned to deal with it by rotating their merchandise in order to place on sale the items of the season. Some of them are not able to do it on time and are left with items that are out-of-season and difficult to sell to demanding customers. It is for this reason that sometimes the members are late with their payments. The purpose of the loan is to increase merchandise for the Christmas season during which there is a greater demand for their products as well as for the purchase of work tools for the men. Their experience within the realm of solidarity groups is good since some of the members of this group participated in other loans with other groups and were able to pay punctually. There exists a family kinship within this group between Marisol and Gonzalo who are brother and sister but they have totally independent incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr: Penda D., 27 ans, mariée, 01 enfant et 04 autres en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sankagne  depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut acheter du fumier, des herbes et feuilles séchés, des  engrais, payer les frais d’arrosage et de raccordement pour renforcer  son activité de culture et vente de bananes qui marche bien dans sa localité. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Penda D., age 27, is married and has one child. She also has four other children to support. She's been a member of the Sankagne village bank for one year and a half. She wants to buy manure, herbs and dried leaves, fertilizers, and pay for the water expenses, in order to bolster her business. The latter consists in cultivating and selling bananas, and is doing well in her city. The loan she's seeking will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizers, etc, for her banana plantation

loans.name: Ahji Fatou

texts.fr: Ageé d' une quarantaine d' années Ahji fatou est une femme mariée et mére de famille.A coté de ses activités ménageres ,elle gére une activité d élevage de volaille de poulets de chaire depuis trois(03) ans.son activité lui permet d'assurer l 'approvisionnement en viande de volaille pour  les  habitants du quatier .Pour faire face à la forte demende en cette periode de fin d'année ,elle sollicite un  pret.
texts.en:
Approximately forty years old, Ahji Fatou is married and the mother of a family. In addition to her household duties, she's been running a business raising poultry for three years. Her business enables her to provide poultry to the inhabitants of her neighborhood. She's currently facing an increase in demand, and is seeking this loan in order to meet it.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Lesbia Lorena

texts.es: Lesbia Lorena L.
texts.en: Lesbia Lorena L.

loans.use: To buy materials for making shoes

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora María Auxiliadora C. originaria de la ciudad de Masaya donde reside actualmente, se dedica a su propio negocio de panadería teniendo las maquinarias necesarias para la elaboración de pan dulce y pan simple y luego que el pan está hecho, ella lo coloca en las vitrinas para su venta.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo requiere de inversión directa, ella hoy en día requiere el capital financiero para la compra de la materia prima como lo es la harina, la levadura, el azúcar y las bolsas plásticas para la elaboración del pan. Por esta razón ella espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así mejorar saliendo adelante en su negocio y llevando el sustento a su hogar de habitación en Masaya.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora C. is from the city of Masaya, where she still lives. She has her own bread shop and has the necessary machines for baking sweet bread and plain bread. After the bread is made, she puts it in her store's windows. As all developing businesses need direct investment, Maria now needs a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, yeast, sugar, and plastic bags for baking bread. Because of this, she hopes that her loan will be approved so she can continue improving her business and supporting her household in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for baking bread

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya en el bello país de Nicaragua la señora Yadira M. se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa el cual es exhibida en sus estantes y se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente comerciante por la razón de que vende variedad de ropa para toda ocasión en diferentes estilos y tamaños para todos.

El negocio actualmente tiene cinco años de existir y al haberse desarrollado se espera que en los próximos años tenga mayores incrementos. Ceprodel ha sido su apoyo en el desarrollo del negocio por la razón que  ha dado oportunidad de crecer por medio de la entrega de los créditos y es por este motivo que una vez más ella ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de la ropa con el propósito de exhibirla y de esta forma continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
In the city of Masaya in the beautiful country of Nicaragua, Yadira M. sells clothing which she displays on shelves. She has shown herself to be an excellent saleswoman because she sells a variety of clothing for all occasions, in different styles and sizes for all. The business is five years old, and it is hoped that once it has been further developed, it will bring in more profits in the coming years. Kiva partner Ceprodel has helped develop this business by giving it the opportunity to grow through loans. Once more, Yadira has requested a loan to buy clothes to display so that the business can continue, as it does require investment.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam Ouologeme a 44 ans, mère de 7 enfants elle vit chez son époux dans une famille polygame avec ses enfants dans le quartier wala wala de la préfecture de Koutiala(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Issue d’une famille de commerçants, Mariam a été très vite initiée aux activités génératrices de revenues (car ses parents n’ont jamais voulu qu’elle fréquente l’école). Après une longue phase d’apprentissage auprès de sa mère, elle décida de se spécialiser dans le commerce de condiments alimentaires depuis maintenant 20 ans. La demande de la clientèle est très importante car elle est trés  connue dans le secteur et presque toutes les femmes de son entourage font leurs achats chez elle. 
Afin d’augmenter son étalage, elle se tourna vers l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il ya de cela  3 ans. Avec une expérience de 4 prêts en solidaire  (prêt de groupe) bien remboursés ,elle est à son 2eme prêt en individuel dont le 1er s’est terminé sans difficulté. 
Madame Mariam compte acheter, 2kg de fièfiè, 50kg d’oignons, 3kg de laye, 2 sachets de vermicelles, 2kg de poivres, des légumes  et autres.. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Koutiala et  vend ses condiments dans  à son domicile à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes, au comptant ou à crédit.  Espérant générer un bénéfice de 60.000FCFA, Madame Mariam Ouologuème compte les utiliser pour le  remboursement des intérêts du prêt, payer  les frais de scolarité de ses  enfants et  investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrice de revenus.
Mariam est à la recherche d’une place au   marché de Koutiala.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariam Ouologuème is a 44-year-old mother of 7 who lives with her husband in a polygamous family with his children in the Wala Wala neighborhood in the Koutiala prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Coming from a family of merchants, Mariam was introduced early on to the business world (since her parents never wanted her to go to school). After a long period of training with her mother, she decided to specialize in the sale of seasonings, which she has been doing for 20 years. The demand of her clientele is significant, as she is very well known in her area and almost all of the women in her circle buy from her. In order to increase her goods, she turned to microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. After having repaid 4 group loans, she is on her 2nd individual loan; her first one was repaid without incident. Mrs. Mariam plans to buy 2 kg of “fièfiè,” 50 kg of onions, 3 kg of garlic, 2 packets of vermicelli, 2 kg of pepper, vegetables, etc. She stocks up at the Koutiala market and sells her seasonings from home mostly to women for cash or credit. Hoping to earn a profit of 60,000 CFA francs, Mrs. Mariam Ouologuème plans to use this to repay the loan, pay for her children’s’ schooling, and invest the rest in other businesses. Mariam is looking for a spot at the Koutiala market.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seasonings

loans.name: Nanou

texts.fr:
Mariée et âgée de 52 ans, Madame Nanou Koné(mère de 4 enfants) vit  dans une famille polygame avec sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Koulikoro de la préfecture de koutiala( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Depuis sa tendre enfance elle commence les activités génératrices de revenus de toutes sortes, mais décide finalement de se spécialiser dans l’achat vente du Sounbala (un condiment alimentaire naturel aux vertus multiples fabriquées avec les noix de néré) qu’elle apprena très tôt auprès de sa grand mère (comme la plupart des femmes de son ethnie : les Minianka). Elle exerce cette activité à son domicile il y a de cela 20 ans.
Pour obtenir des ressources financières complémentaires elle décida de faire recourt à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  tous ses  précédents( trois prêts solidaires  et deux prêts individuels) elle est à son troisième prêt individuel.
 Madame Nanou compte acheter avec ce prêt, 40 paniers de Soumbala semi transformé à Koutiala lors des foires hebdomadaires auprès des transformatrices  venant des villages. Après  elle à son tour les transforme definitivement à sa manière et de façon plus présentable avec plusieurs employées. Elle vend ses marchandises dans la ville de Bamako (capitale du Mali ) et koutiala à une clientèle  feminine,  au comptant ou à crédit.. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 140.000FCFA qu’elle envisage d’utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux charges des  enfants. Elle envisage  chercher une place au marché Dabanani de Bamako afin d’élargir ses activités.
texts.en:
Married and 52 years old, Mrs. Nanou Koné (mother of 4) lives in a polygamous family with her co-wife and their children in the Koulikoro neighborhood in the Koutiala prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). From a tender age, she began all sorts of businesses, but finally decided to specialize in the buying and selling of Soumbala (a natural seasoning of multiple virtues made from the African locust nut) which she learned early on from her grandmother (as do most women of her ethnicity: the Minianka). She has been selling out of her home for 20 years. To secure complementary financial resources, she has turned to microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the last 4 years. After having properly repaid her previous loans (3 group loans and 2 individual loans), she is on her third individual loan. Mrs. Nanou plans to buy with this loan 40 baskets of semi-transformed Soumbala in Koutiala at the weekly fairs from women coming from the villages. Afterwards, she fully transforms it in her way to make it more presentable with several employees. She sells her goods in the city of Bamako (capital of Mali) and Koutiala to a female clientele for cash or credit. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 140,000 CFA francs, which she plans to use to repay the loan and take care of her children. She plans to look for a spot at the Dabanani market in Bamako in order to grow her business.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy goods (Soumbala)

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Doña Lucrecia  heredo éste negocio de sus padres; Desde pequeña aprendió el oficio de la panadería y asumió la administración del negocio desde muy joven, Se ha desempeñado con mucha eficiencia y compromiso, ella dice que adim ha sido una bendición en su vida  ya que le ha brindado créditos y capacitaciones, las cuales ha puesto en práctica en su negocio y le ha dado muy buenos resultados.
Cuenta con su esposo como principal socio y con sus hijos que le ayudan en la comercialización de sus productos tantos en el barrio como en las pulperías locales; cuenta con clientela fija lo que le permite estar en constante producción para abastecer a sus clientes. 
A doña Lucrecia le gustaría que su negocio se expandiera para obtener mayores ingresos y poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, sabe que para alcanzar ésta meta debe ser responsable. Tanto con los créditos otorgados por ADIM, así también con sus proveedores y sobre todo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucrecia inherited this business from her parents. She learned how to bake as a small girl and took over managing the business at a young age. She has worked with great efficiency and commitment; she says that ADIM has been a blessing in her life as it has provided loans and education, which she has put into practice in her business with very good results. Her husband is her business partner and their children help her sell their products in the neighborhood as well as in the local stores. She has a steady clientele which enables her to be in constant production to meet her customers’ demands. Lucrecia would like to expand her business in order to obtain greater income and be able to improve her family’s living conditions. She knows that in order to reach this goal she needs to be responsible, with the loans from ADIM as well as her suppliers and above all with her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital; invest in growin gher business and expand her market

loans.name: Violeta Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Violeta Patricia B. R. tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es casada, Esta Señora tiene 4 hijo s de los cuales sus edades son de 32 años su hijo mayor que trabaja por cuenta propia, su otro hijo de 28 años trabaja por cuenta propia otro hijo de 25 años trabaja por cuenta propia y otro hijo de 23 años que le ayuda en su negocio, su compañero de vida labora en el ingenio San Antonio, sus propósitos son de mantener activo y proporcionarle mejoras  a su vivienda y su  negocio por lo que Ella siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora, en sus sueños esta fortalecer su negocio para que este le de una mejor estabilidad económica para ella y su familia.



La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una distribuidora de productos de la pepsi, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es 8 años, ella inicia con una venta de golosinas mas tarde decide realizar un financiamiento en Fundación León 2000 logrando de esta manera invertir en este negocio por lo que mas tarde logra realizar un convenio con la empresa de la pepsi logrando que su distribuidora se convirtiera en una mini distribuidora de este producto y así  lo vuelve su medio de trabajo y sobre vivencia por la falta de trabajo que hay en el país logrando que este fuera un medio de apoyo para sus hijos y su familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar la compra de los productos necesarios para ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Violeta Patricia B. R., 53, is married. She has 4 children: a 32-year old son who is self-employed, a 28-year old son who is self-employed, a 25-year old son who is self-employed and a 23-year old son who helps her with her business. Her husband works for the Ingenio San Antonio. Her goals are to stay active and gradually improve her house and business. Violeta has always fought to get ahead. She dreams of strengthening her business so that she can gain economic stability for herself and her family.

Violeta makes a living distributing Pepsi products. Her business is located in her house and she's had the business for 8 years. She started with a snack-sales business. Later she decided to get financing from Fundacion Leon 2000 which allowed her to invest in her business and become a mini-distributor for Pepsi. The business is her way to earn a living in a country where finding work is often difficult. It also allows her to help her family. The loan is for working capital, money that she will use to buy the different products that she will resell to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El contacto para la formación fue la señora Andresa Espínola, domiciliada en el km 8  Monday de C.D.E. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina “Mujeres Valientes”, está constituido  por 16 señoras muy activas todas de la misma zona.
Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser:
Andresa Espínola	Despensa
Maria A. C.	Venta De Ropa
Brígida M.	Venta De Sabanas
Clara López	Venta De Comestibles
Rosa V.	Venta De Comestibles
Cristina M.	Venta De Medias
Agripina Espínola	Venta de Pollo
Basilia D.	Venta De Bebidas
Teodora Vázquez	Venta De Cosméticos
Maria G.	Venta De Verduras
Mercedes C.	Venta De Ropa Interior
Teresa V.	Venta De Ropa
Lidia M.	Venta De Comestibles
Maria Edil O.	Despensa
Blanca N.	Venta De Cosméticos
Basilia G.	Modista
El Crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad para su posterior venta. Las señoras retiran un crédito de 300.000gs c/u. 
 Entre los artículos que serán adquiridos tenemos: pantalones, remeras, medias, bikinis para aquellas que se dedican a la venta de ropas; otras tomates, cebollas, manzanas, bananas, melones, sandias, carne, enlatados, arroz, aceite, etc. para las que se dedican a la venta de comestibles y despensa. Las que se dedican a la venta de cosméticos comprarán maquillajes, polvo compacto, cremas para el rostro, máscara para pestañas, labiales, y otras adquirirán  platos, cucharas, tenedores, cuchillos, sábanas, pollos, medias, etc.
texts.en:
The group's contact is Andresa E. who lives at Kilometer 8 Monday in C.D.E. She contacted neighbors and friends to form the area's committee. The committee is called Mujeres Valientes [Courageous Women] and has 16 members, all women active in the area. They operate various kinds of businesses:

Andresa Espínola Grocery Sales Maria A. C. Clothing Sales Brígida M. Bedding Sales Clara López Food Sales Rosa V. Food Sales Cristina M. Stocking Sales Agripina Espínola Poultry Sales Basilia D. Drinks Sales Teodora Vázquez Cosmetics Sales Maria G. Vegetable Sales Mercedes C. Underwear Sales Teresa V. Clothing Sales Lidia M. Food Sales Maria Edil O. Grocery Sales Blanca N. Cosmetics Sales Basilia G. Dressmaker

The loan will be used to buy goods or supplies that are appropriate for each business. The members will withdraw 300,000gs each.

Some of the products that will be purchased are: pants, t-shirts, stockings, underwear, by those who make a living selling clothing; and tomatoes, onions, apples, bananas, canteloupes, watermelons, meat, canned goods, rice, cooking oil, etc., for those selling food products. Those members selling cosmetics will buy make-up, powder, face cream, eyeliner, lipstick and others will buy dishes, knives, forks, spoons, sheets, poultry, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy prouducts and supplies for various businesses.

loans.name: Torype Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El contacto para formar el comité fue la señora Ana P. que trabaja vendiendo remedio naturales en una de las principales avenidas de la ciudad. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en dicha zona.

 El comité está constituido por 18 integrantes todas tienen actividades productivas y generan ingreso dentro de sus hogares. Las actividades que realizan cada una son: 
Irmina Espínola 	Venta de Comida  
Maria P. 	Limpiadora 
Solana Ramírez 	Modista 
Florinda Báez 	Venta de Productos  Avon
Liliana G. 	Venta De Bolsos P
Fidencia P. 	Venta De Ropa Interior 
Julia A. 	Venta de Ropa 
Reina Báez	Despensa 
Maria  Asunción P. 	Venta de Comida 
Zulma G. 	Venta de Ropa 
Amelia D. 	Manicurista 
Epifanía B. 	Venta de Ropa 
María O. 	Modista 
Patricia F.  	Venta de Ropa 
Justina V. 	Venta de Comida 
Trinidad P.	Confección de Ropa 
Felicia E. 	Venta De Joyas 
Francisca B. 	Venta De Frutas 

Cada una retira un monto distinto de préstamo pero todas se comprometen en conjunto a pagar semanalmente por su crédito, para lo cual realizan reuniones semanales para juntar el dinero de la cuota, además de tocar temas de interés para el crecimiento del grupo. Ellas también realizan diversas actividades en conjunto para poder recaudar fondos adicionales que lo ahorran.

Este grupo a demostrado ser uno de los más disciplinados y organizados y ellas cuentan que se encuentran muy contentas trabajando y obteniendo capital de sus créditos.
texts.en:
The group's contact is Ana P. who makes a living selling natural medicines on one of the city's main avenues. She recruited her neighbors and friends to form the committee in her area. The committee has 18 members who have businesses and generate income for their households. Their respective businesses are:

Irmina Espínola Food Sales Maria P. Cleaning Solana Ramírez Dressmaking Florinda Báez Avon Sales Liliana G. Purse Sales Fidencia P. Underwear Sales Julia A. Clothes Sales Reina Báez Grocery Maria Asunción P. Food Sales Zulma G. Clothes Sales Amelia D. Manicurist Epifanía B. Clothing Salesa María O. Dressmaking Patricia F. Clothing Sales Justina V. Food Slaes Trinidad P. Tailoring Felicia E. Jewelry Sales Francisca B. Fruit Sales

Each withdraws a different loan amount but they jointly promise to repay the loan. They meet once a week to collect a weekly payment and to touch on issues of mutual interest. They also operate businesses together in order to collect additional funds for their joint savings.

This group has proved to be one of the most disciplined and organized and the members say that they are very happy working and using their loans to earn incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and supplies for various businesses.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
El señor Bernardo está casado con Wilma Fernández Melgarejo, tienen dos hijos, actualmente Bernardo tiene 32 años y Wilma tiene 37 años. El señor tiene un puesto en el microcentro de la ciudad donde vende sabanas, toallas, bermudas, camisetas deportivas, conjuntos varios, la señora Wilma tiene también su puesto de venta independiente del marido.
 Los negocios están uno al lado del otro, en la misma zona,  y cuentan que las ventas son muy buenas. Recientemente con algunos ahorros y con las ganancias del negocio han logrado construir para su casa propia, lo que además los ha dejado con un capital muy ajustado. El crédito que solicitan será para inyectar mayor capital a los negocios. 
En diciembre las ventas suelen ser mayores, por lo que ellos quieren estar bien preparados para poder abastecer con la gran demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bernardo is married to Wilma Fernandez Melgarejo and they have two children. Bernado is 32 years old and Wilma is 37 years old. Bernardo has a stall in the city center where he sells sheets, towels, shorts, sport shirts, and similar products; Wilma also has a stall, separate from her husband's. The businesses are next to one another in the same area and they say that sales are very good. They recently used savings and earnings from their businesses to build a house but the expenditure has left them short of funds. They're applying for a loan to inject more capital into the businesses. Sales are usually highest in December so they want to be ready by stocking what their customers will most demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
El señor Rodrigo es soltero, tiene 19 años, monto su negocio de venta de calzados con el apoyo de sus padres, pues, toda la familia es comercian también. El trabaja a medio tiempo en una casa de cambios. Su padre es quien atiende su negocio en ese horario.

 Prácticamente es  una empresa  familiar porque sus padres dedican la mayor parte de su tiempo a la comercialización de los productos y él hace los controles de stock y de las ventas.

Rodrigo es un joven comerciante y necesita de los créditos para hacer crecer su negocio y así  aumentar sus ingresos. En estas fiestas de fin de año se registran un alza considerable en las ventas, por lo que el desea aumentar su stock de mercaderías para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
