Rodrigo, 19, is single. He started a retail footwear business with help from his parents so everyone in the family is a merchant now. Rodrigo also works part-time in a currency exchange office and his father operates the footwear business while he's working at the currency exchange. It's really a family business because Rodrigo's parents spend most of their time working at the business while he manages the inventory and sales. Rodrigo is a young businessman and needs loans to grow and increase his income. Sales increase considerably around the year-end holidays so he wants to add to his inventory in order to meet demand from his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Maria Ramona

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Ramona Ramírez tiene la edad de 57 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Maria tiene 5 hijos de los cuales todos trabaja por cuenta propia y ninguno de sus hijos depende de ella, su esposo no labora, sus propósitos son engrandecer su negocio para que su venta prospere sus deseos son salir sacar adelante a su familia y poder cancelar los compromisos contraídos con la institución y en sus sueños esta proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda por lo que no ha podido realizarle los cambios deseados por la difícil situación.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería y una venta de comida, la ubicación de su negocio es su casa de habitación en telica de la alcaldía ½ cuadra al norte, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 20 años, Doña Maria inicia su negocio por cuenta propia por lo que necesita proporcionar ingresos para su familia en sus casa de habitación decide establecer un negocio de de verduras por lo que con este negocio no logro progresar mucho y decide quitar el negocio de verduras para instalar una venta de granos básicos como lo es arroz, frijoles y aceite y es así como obtiene la afluencia de sus clientes, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar la compra de los productos para la elaboración de sus comidas para ofertarlos a sus clientes ya que es visitado 3 veces a la semana.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Ramona Ramírez is 57 years old and married. She has five children who all work, and none of them depend on her economically. Maria's husband doesn't work, and she'd like to enlarge her business to improve her sales. She'd like to help her family get ahead and be able to pay back her loans. She dreams of renovating her home, but hasn't been able to make the changes she'd like because of the difficult situation. Maria runs a local store and sells meals. Her store is located in her home, in the town of telica half a block north of the mayor's office. She's had this business for 20 years. Maria started the business on her own because she needed to earn income for her family. She decided to establish a vegetables business in her house, but it didn't do well and she decided to quit the vegetable business in favor of selling grains such as rice, beans, and cooking oil. With this new business Maria earned the patronage of her clients. She'd like a loan to use as working capital, as she now has clients who come three times a week and she needs to purchase materials to make her foods so that she can offer them to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Solidarias Group

texts.es: El grupo las "Solidarias" están representadas por la señora Nancy y por doce miembros D. los cuales existen parentescos lejanos entre primos pero todos con ingresos totalmente independientes. Dentro del grupo una mayoría se dedica al comercio D. cosméticos, zapatos, abarrotes y otros se dedican al transporte publico y a la confeccion y comercializacion D. prensas D. vestir. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. herramientas D. trabajo para incrementar sus productos terminados así como para la compra D. mercadería para abastecer al mercado en épocas D. fin D. año. La competencia en el mercado D. venta D. productos es dificil D. llevar si no se tiene buena ubicación y productos D. calidad para el mercado competitivo, pero los socios (as) ya tienen experiencia en el rubro y saben como sacar a flote sus negocios y mejorar sus ingresos para salir adelante. Los socios (as) tiene experiencia en grupos solidaR. ya que trabajaron en otras instituciones por lo que conocen la responsabilidad que se requiere para este tipo D. financiamientos.
texts.en:
The Solidarity Group is represented by Nancy and by 12 other members, among whom there are distant relationships between cousins, though all of the businesses are totally independent. Within the group, the majority of members sell cosmetics, shoes, groceries and clothing, and others proviD. public transportation and tailoring services. This loan will be used to buy items needed to increase the businesses' end products. For example, it will be used to purchase merchandise for stocking up the stores for the end of the year. It is hard to weather the sales competition if one doesn't have a good location and quality products, but the group members already have experience in this area and know how to stay afloat in their businesses and improve their profits. The members have experience in these types of groups because they have already worked with other institutions and understand the responsibility associated with this type of loan.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating expenses

loans.name: Eddy Pantaleon

texts.es:
El señor de Nombre Eddy Pantaleón A. C. tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es casado, este Señor tiene 2 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes una mujer de 18 años y cursa el 1 año de la carrera de odontología y su hijo varón de 13 años que cursa el 2 año de secundaria, su compañera de vida labora como laboratorista, los propósitos que tiene  son aumentar en su producción ya que le proporcionaría mas ingresos que le han sido de beneficio tanto para su familia y para el mismo, en sus deseos esta el permanecer con salud para continuar con su trabajo, en sus sueños esta el llegar a educar a sus hijos para que en un futuro estos sean personas de bien y sean personas preparadas ante cualquier situación que se les presente.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es el destace de cerdo, la ubicación de su negocio es en malpaisillo en la siguiente dirección de la gasolinera PETRONIC 4 cuadras al sur, el tiempo que tiene de poseer el negocio es 15 años, su negocio inicia con la compra de la cabeza de cerdos ya que su papa administraba este tipo de trabajo como lo es el destace de cerdo y decide independizarse estableciendo su propio negocio por lo que recibe la suficiente afluencia de clientes y esto lo motiva a seguir adelante  su negocio por lo que necesita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdo ya que tiene que salir a las diferentes comarcas para que la compra de los cerdos le sea mas favorable.
texts.en:
Eddy Pantaleón A. C. is 41 years old and is married. He has 2 children whose ages are the following: a daughter who is 18 years old and is studying her first year in dentistry, and a son who is 13 years old and is in his second year of middle school. His wife works in a laboratory. His goal is to increase his production, since this would give him a larger income, which has been beneficial as much to his family as to himself. He hopes to continue to have good health so he can continue with his work. He dreams of educating his children so that they can be successful and be prepared to deal with any situation they might be confronted with. Eddy works in pork butchering. His business is located in Malpaisillo, at the following address: Four blocks south of the Petronic 4 gas station. He has had this business for 15 years. He began the business by buying pig heads, since his father also worked in pork butchering, and he decided to become independent by establishing his own business, which has provided him with plenty of customers, which motivates him to continue with his business. He needs working capital to buy pork because he has to go to different regions to buy the pigs that are most economically favorable for him.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Oscar Ruperto

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Oscar Ruperto M. se dedica a su actividad de agricultura dedicándose al cultivo de plátanos los cuales son vendidos en su casa de habitación en el municipio de El Viejo siendo visitado por varios clientes que le compran los plátanos y en ocasiones hasta clientes que no son del municipio.

Ceprodel le ha apoyado grandemente porque le ha beneficiado con créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de insumos para la ganadería y hoy en día solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de una bomba para riego de la siembra. Con este crédito se beneficiara porque comprará una bomba de riego para el cultivo de plátano.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Viejo, of the city of Chinandega, Oscar Ruperto M. cultivates plantains, which are sold in his house in the municipality of El Viejo. Many customers buy his plantains, sometimes even people who are not from the municipality. Ceprodel has helped him a lot because he has benefited from loans that he has used to buy supplies for cattle, and now he is requesting a new loan to buy a sprayer tank for plants. With this loan he will benefit because he will buy a sprayer tank for cultivating plantains.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sprayer tank

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 20 años, vive junto con sus padres. Es una joven muy trabajadora que desde hace un año está tratando de independizarse económicamente de sus padres, y más que ser un gasto, desea poder ser un apoyo en casa, y lo está logrando gracias al gran don que tiene en la preparación de alimentos, y para venderlos en su pequeño restaurante, el cual está iniciando. Hace 2 años abrió una tienda, la que está ampliando para no solo vender  bebidas y dulces, sino también ofertar platos riquísimos a las personas que pasan por su tienda. Gracias a este negocio Bertha tiene la esperanza de seguir creciendo. Este es su 2do crédito con MFP y nunca tuvo problema de pago, ya que es una persona cumplida  y responsable. Bertha comprará algunos productos y muebles que mejoren el atractivo de su local y  aumenten los clientes.
texts.en:
Bertha is 20 years old and lives with her parents. She is a very hardworking young lady who has been trying for a year to become economically independent from her parents. Rather than being a source of expense, she wants to be of help to her household. She is achieving this thanks to a great talent she has for preparing foods, which she sells at a small restaurant she is starting. Two years ago she opened a store, which she is expanding to sell not only drinks and sweets, but to also sell delicious meals to the people who come to the store. Thanks to this business, Bertha is hopeful that she can continue growing. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she has never had any problems paying because she is a responsible person. Bertha will buy some products and furniture that will improve the look of her business and increase the number of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and staple food items

loans.name: Deise

texts.es: Deise tiene 20 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos. A pesar de las circunstancia que le tocó atravesar nunca se dio por vencida,  estuvo siempre dispuesta a seguir adelante, desde hace 3 años se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la venta de leche, la cual obtiene todas las mañanas al ordeñar sus vaquitas, logrando con esta actividad una de las más rentables, si se le pone el esfuerzo necesario, para ello requiere alimentar adecuadamente a sus animales y vender la leche por los alrededores, caminando varias cuadras, con el fin de llevar alguna ganancia diaria a su hogar. Deise está en su 2do crédito con MFP, y se caracteriza por ser una madre joven, muy responsable en sus pagos. Con la cantidad solicitada adquirirá una vaca que le ayude a incrementar su venta de leche y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Deise is 20 years old, is a single mother, and lives with her parents and siblings. Despite the circumstances she has had to confront, she has never given up. She has always tried to get ahead. For the past 3 years she has been raising animals and selling milk, which she gets every morning when she milks her cows. This is one of the most profitable businesses if one puts in the necessary effort. In order to do this, she needs to feed her cattle well and sell the milk nearby, walking a few blocks, with the goal of bringing home some daily earnings. Deise is in her second loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is young mother who is very responsible with her payments. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy a cow that will help her increase her milk sales and thereby her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 57 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 17 años. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde muy joven trabajó vendiendo comida, pero el costo de alquiler de su local la llevaron a la quiebra, entonces tuvo que buscar otros medios para ganarse la vida y comenzó a trabajar en la limpieza de un colegio, ahí logró captar clientes, a quienes les ofrecía prepararles la comida, y así desde hace 2 años viene repartiendo comida a los docentes del colegio y para algunos alumnos, negocio que es muy rentable, ya que la preparación de estos alimentos lo realiza en su domicilio para luego distribuirlos y evita de pagar el alquiler de locales, aunque lo difícil es trasladar la comida por el peso que tiene. Esther está en su 2do crédito y va muy bien en sus pagos, está muy comprometida con su grupo de socias y con la institución. Con el dinero solicitado adquirirá utensilios para la implementación de su cocina con todo lo necesario para la preparación de la comida.
texts.en:
Esther is 57 years old, she lives with her husband and her 17 year-old son. She is a very hardworking woman. She has been selling food since she was very young, but the cost of rent at her restaurant drove her to bankruptcy. She had to find other ways to earn a living, so she began doing cleaning at a high school where she began to get clients for whom she prepared foods. For the past 2 years she has been bringing food to the teachers at the school and some of the students. This is a very profitable business, since she makes the foods at home and therefore avoids having to pay rent for a restaurant location. The hard part is carrying the food to the customers because it is heavy. Esther is in her second loan and is doing very well with her payments. She is very responsible towards others in her loan group and also with the institution. With the requested loan she will buy utensils for her kitchen so she will have everything she needs for the preparation of her foods.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food ingredients and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Estrellas Ii Group

texts.es:
La asociación “ Estrellas II” pertenece al centro focal  Villa Tejada, hace un año aproximadamente, estas mujeres han demostrado ser un grupo muy organizado y unido. La mayoría de  ella están casadas y tiene un promedio de cuatro hijos, éstos de distintas edades, desde niÑos,hasta jóvenes universitarios. Tienen la ilusión  que sus hijos  culminen sus estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en el futuro.
Existen diversas actividades dentro la asociación por ejemplo, la venta de ropa para bebes, también se dedican a la venta de cosméticos en puestos fijos y también de manera ambulante, otra actividad entre la asociación es la venta de comida  y fruta. La asociación Estrellas II necesita mayor capital para comprar mayor mercadería, y tambien para ampliar la variedad de fruta, de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias, con el objetivo de poder ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Stars II Group is located in Villa Tejada. It is about a year old, and the women have shown themselves to be a very organized and united group. The majority of the women are married and have an average of four children of varying ages, ranging from little children to college-age. The group members hope their children will complete school and have better opportunities for the future. The group members do different types of business. For example, some sell baby clothes; others sell cosmetics in fixed locations or as traveling salespeople. Others sell meals and fruit. The Stars II group needs more capital to purchase merchandise as well as to expand the variety of fruit they sell, thereby increasing their profits so they can save for their children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and fruit

loans.name: Natalie

texts.es: Natalie tiene 29 años, es casada, vive con su pareja y su hija de 6 años. Ella es una mujer muy preocupada por la apariencia física, lo que algunos consideran un defecto, pero que en el caso Natalie se convirtió en una oportunidad de negocio, ya que gracias a ello se dedica a vender productos de belleza desde hace 3 años, lo que realiza a través de catálogos, los cuales lleva a las universidades y a su mismo centro de trabajo, donde sus clientas siempre esperan verse mejor cada día, lo cual beneficia su actividad económica. Sin embargo, ha tenido algunos problemas de  pago, y para recuperar su capital  tiene que insistir y presionar a las personas, siendo esto lo más tedioso de su labor, y en base a esta experiencia Natalie evalúa muy bien a sus posibles clientes. Este es su 2do crédito con MFP, y es una  joven muy responsable dentro de su grupo. Natalie desea incursionar ahora en la venta de productos medicinales muy buenos y solicitados, para ello invertirá 200 soles y el resto en productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Natalie is 29 years old and married. She lives with her husband and six-year-old daughter. She is a woman very concerned about physical appearance, something others see as a fault, but in this case, Natalie turned it into a business opportunity. Thanks to that, she has been selling beauty products through a catalog for three years. She takes her catalogs to universities and to her workplace, where her customers wait to see her every day, which helps her economically. Nevertheless, she has had some problems with being paid and recuperating her expenses. She has had to put pressure on some people, feeling that this is harder than her actual work. Because of this experience, Natalie now evaluates her potential customers very well. This is her second loan from Kiva partner MFP, and she is a very responsible woman among her peers. Natalie now wants to sell quality medical products that are in demand. She will invest 200 soles in this, and the rest in beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medical and cosmetic products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 48 años, vive con su pareja y su hija mayor de edad. Desde que se casó viene practicando las labores de un agricultora y comerciante, ya que sus productos los llevan a vender a la capital del país para generar mayores ganancias, hace 10 años inició su propio cultivo y le va muy bien, ya que quincenalmente viaja a Lima. De la misma forma, está pensando iniciar un negocio  complementario al suyo, pero ligado a la producción, ya que es lo que más le agrada realizar. Sin embargo, lo tedioso dentro de la agricultura, es regar los terrenos  para tener las tierras altamente productivas que le generen ganancias, más no pérdidas. Rosa se encuentra en su 2do crédito con MFP, y hasta el momento ha sido muy cumplida  y responsable  con sus pagos. Para cultivar otros productos agrícolas requiere de abonos y fertilizantes, por lo que solicita la cantidad referida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and her grown daughter. Ever since she married, she has been working as a farmer and a salesperson. She takes her wares to the country's capital in order to get better profits. Ten years ago she started her own farm; it's going very well, and every two weeks she travels to Lima. Likewise, she is thinking of starting a business complementary to her existing one, but connected to production, which is more to her liking. Nevertheless, the tedious thing about farming is irrigating the land so that it will be most productive and yield the best profit, not losses. This is Rosa's second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and so far she has been very responsible in making payments. To farm other products, she needs fertilizer, and she is requesting the loan for that.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 36 años, vive con su pequeña hija Mariela de 3 años de edad. Se dedica a la venta de comestibles desde hace 3 años, luego de que tuviera que afrontar sola el cuidado de su pequeña hija de 3 años, a la cual se dedica íntegramente.  A Elizabeth le gusta su trabajo, ya que puede cuidar a su pequeña hija, permitiéndole al mismo tiempo, atender su negocio, el cual ya va creciendo poco a poco gracias a todo el esfuerzo que ella hace para sacarlo adelante. Elizabeth tiene puestas todas las esperanzas en su tienda, ya que sabe que gracias a ella podrá darle una buena educación a su pequeña, es por eso que requiere de nuestra ayuda para poder cumplir todas sus metas. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado implementará su tienda con más cantidad de productos, entre ellos panteones, que son muy vendidos en estas épocas de Navidad.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36 years old and lives with her young 3-year old daughter Mariela. She has been selling food for the past 3 years, after she was faced with being the sole caretaker of her little 3 year old daughter, to whom she is completely devoted. Elizabeth enjoys her work as she is able to care for her little girl at the same time as tending to her business, which is slowly growing thanks to all her efforts. Elizabeth has pinned all her hopes on her store, as she knows that it is thanks to her business that she will be able to give her little one a good education; it is to this end that she needs our help, to be able to achieve her goals. In her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, she was always very punctual in her repayments. She will use this loan to buy a greater quantity of products, including nativity scenes which are very popular during the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the stock of her store

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: Lizbeth tiene 22 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeña bebe. Es una joven y emprendedora madre que vela por el bienestar de su pequeña, la cual es su motivo de vivir de y el de su esposo. Lizbeth tiene su negocio de producción y elaboración de yogurt desde hace 4 años, tiempo en el cual lo ha hecho crecer más y más. El negocio arroja buenas ganancias y Lizbeth a contratado a señoras para que salgan a vender este rico producto por las calles de la ciudad de Puno en unos carritos que compró para su distribución. Aparte de trabajar, estudia, así que se le hace muy difícil realizar estas dos actividades, ya que realmente termina agotada. Lizbeth se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de insumos para elaborar el yogurt, además de nuevas rueditas para los carritos que en los que lo distribuyen.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is 22 years old, she lives with her husband and her baby daughter. She is a young, enterprising mother who is cognizant of her daughter’s well-being, which is her reason for living and that of her husband also. Lizbeth has had a business making yogurt for 4 years, during which time her business has grown more and more. The business provides good income and Lizbeth has contracted with some woman to sell this delicious product on the streets of Puno city in little carts that she bought for its distribution. In addition to working, she studies. This is Lizbeth’s first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very punctual with her payments. With the money she will buy a large quantity of ingredients to make her yogurt, in addition she will buy new wheels for her little carts which she uses to distribute her product.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make yogurt

loans.name: Mia

texts.es: Mia tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja y está en espera de su próximo bebe. Es natural de la ciudad de Lima, se dedica a la venta de ropa en la ciudad de Puno desde hace un año, pero también viaja constantemente a Puerto Maldonado donde tiene una tienda sucursal. Ella tiene como experiencia 2 años en la venta de ropa, en los cuales ha trabajado muy duro para poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica, la cual ahora espera consolidar en beneficio de su bebé, el cual viene en camino. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es viajar constantemente en su estado, pero tiene que hacerlo, ya que no puede descuidar el negocio. Mia se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de ropa que traerá desde Lima para vender en las ciudades de Puno y Puerto Maldonado.
texts.en:
Mia is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and is expecting her first child. She is originally from Lima and has sold clothing in Puno for the last year. She also travels frequently to Puerto Maldonado, where she has another shop. Mia has two years of experience selling clothes, and in that time she has worked very hard to ensure a stable income. She hopes to further consolidate her income for the benefit of her child. The hardest part about Mia's job is that she has to travel constantly. But, she understands that this is necessary, since she cannot neglect her business.

This is Mia's second loan from Kiva's partner Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been very punctual in her payments. With this loan she will purchase more clothing in Lima to sell in Puno and Puerto Maldonado.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the variety of merchandise sold

loans.name: Zarela

texts.es: Zarela tiene 34 años, vive con su hijo Mauricio de 3 años de edad. Es una emprendedora madre que se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de ropa en la ciudad de Puno con la esperanza de progresar y forjar un futuro mejor para su pequeño en el cual tiene puestas todas sus esperanzas. Zarela siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora gustándole su trabajo, ya que con él puede ofrecerle bienestar y comodidad a su hijo, es por eso que se dedica tanto a su trabajo, el cual, gracias a su esfuerzo, arroja buenas ganancias. Lo difícil es pasar tanto tiempo vendiendo y no poder pasar todo el tiempo que ella quisiera con su pequeño hijo. Zarela se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para comercializar en estas épocas de fiesta donde la venta es muy buena.
texts.en:
Zarela is 34 years old. She lives with her three-year-old son Mauricio. She is an enterprising mother who has sold clothing for 10 years in the city of Puno. She hopes to progress and forge a better future for her little one, in whom she has put all her hope. Zarela has always been a hardworking woman, enjoying her work. Through her work she is able to offer her son well-being and comfort, and it is because of this she works so hard. Thanks to her effort, she has made good profits. The difficult thing is that she spends so much time selling, she is unable to spend as much time as she would like with her little boy. Zarela is asking for her second loan from Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. With the requested money, she will buy more merchandise to sell during the holidays, when sales are very good.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Bella Vista Group

texts.es:
Pociones de amor, amuletos para la buena suerte, velas, esencias, además también elaboran mesas blancas para la buena fortuna y otros, son productos y trabajos que ofrecen las llamadas Chifleras, que ofrecen sus productos  en la tradicional calle de las Brujas de la ciudad de La Paz, además de ser una calle turística sus productos son adquiridos por personas de todo estrato social. Esta  singular  actividad es la principal dentro  la asociación Bella Vista que trabaja en el centro focal Alto Lima ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto.
Ahora ellas quieren ampliar sus ventas para esto solicitan mayores prestamos para la compra de  productos necesarios para este tipo de trabajo. Están seguras que obtendrán mayores ingresos para el bien de sus familias
texts.en:
Love potions, good-luck amulets, candles, oils, as well as "mesa blanca" charms for good fortune and other things, are some of the products and services offered by the Chifleras. They present their products in the traditional "Witches" street in the city of La Paz, both a tourist attraction and selling products to persons from every social level. This unusual activity is the main one for the Bella Vista association working in the Alto Lima center of the city of El Alto. Now they want to increase their sales, so they are requesting additional loans to purchase the necessary products for this type of work. They are sure that they will get increased income for the well-being of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Loans to purchase special products

loans.name: Estrellas De Belen Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de el alto, en la zona Ballivián  se encuentra en centro focal “Alto Lima”  a éste pertenece la asociación “Estrellas de Belén ”, bajo esta  denominación doce miembros  forman un grupo muy unido y organizado.
Existen diferentes actividades dentro la asociación, siendo la mayoría artesanos, Juana se dedica a la confección de sombreros, María Luisa realiza alfombras tejidas a mano, otras socias confeccionan polleras y mantas con bordados de distintos diseños ; todos estos productos los exponen  en las principales ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Además de necesitar mayores recursos para la compra de maquinaria especial requieren capital para la compra de materia prima, con el objetivo de aumentar su producción  y generar mayores ganancias...
texts.en:
In the Ballivián area of El Alto city you will find the “Alto Lima” center that belongs to the “Estrellas de Belén” association. 12 members form a very organized and united group beneath this name. There are various professions within the association, the majority of which are artisans. Juana makes hats, Maria Luisa makes hand-made carpets, other members make skirts and embroidered blankets of various designs. All these products are sold at the major markets in El Alto city. In addition to needing greater resources to buy special machinery, they need capital to buy raw materials with the objective of increasing their production and generating greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy materials to create products

loans.name: 21 De Mayo Group

texts.es: La asociación “21 de mayo” pertenece al centro focal  Villa Tejada ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Dicho grupo trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace más de cuatro años. Afirman que el dinero no les alcanza para los gastos domésticos diarios y gastos de alquiler ya que cuentan con numerosas familias. La mayoría de ellas tiene tiendas de barrio donde ofrecen variedad de productos. Con el mayor entusiasmo quieren mejorar sus ventas comprando variedad de productos por cajas, de esta manera generar mayores ganancias que les permita ahorrar para poder comprar una casa propia.
texts.en:
The “21 de mayo” (May 21st) group is based in the Villa Tejada neighbourhood of the city of El Alto. This group has been working in conjunction with Pro-Mujer for more than 4 years. The members of the group tell us that they lack money to pay for their household expenses and the rent for their businesses as they have large families. Most of the members own neighbourhood store which offer a variety of products. They are highly motivated to improve their sales by buying a variety of products in bulk, thereby generating greater profits which will allow them to buy their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of products for their respective grocery stores.

loans.name: Hy

texts.en: Hy M., 26, is a rice farmer and also raises pigs to sell. She raises them for three or four months prior to slaughter. She is married with two children, both of whom are teenagers and in priM. school. Her husband, Mr. Bun Chanthoeurn, is a rice farmer and has a mill for a rice grinding business. Because raising pigs and milling rice are their main income, M. would like to request a loan to purchase pig food and to purchase rice stocks to keep and resell for profit.

loans.use: To purchase pig food and to purchase rice stocks to keep and resell for profit

loans.name: Abdul Wasea

texts.en:
Abdul Wasea is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. He lives in Qala-e Adsey, and he has a general store in which he sells different kinds of materials. He needs more inventory for his business to make it more successful. 

Now he requests an individual loan of 50,000 Afghans for the term of 18 months. He wants to make his shop large and complete his necessary materials to maintain his business and support his family. 

He is very happy for this loan process in Afghanistan, especially the AFSG (Kiva's Field Partner) and Kiva. He would like to thank all lenders.

loans.use: To make his shop larger and complete the stock for his store

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Khorn C., 26, is a rice farmer and also raises pigs for another source of income. Her husband is a rice farmer and has a rice mill for providing the service of rice grinding. The young couple lives in Kralengkort Village in the Kampong Cham Province and works hard everyday with the business to support their family sufficiently. They have two children, both of whom are teenagers. With growing business, C. would like to request a loan to purchase pig food and rice to make cleaned rice to resell.

loans.use: To purchase pig food and rice to make cleaned rice to resell

loans.name: Srin

texts.en: Srin D. is a 51-year-old widowed rice farmer and lives in Pengmeaschoeung Village. She has two children. One is married and lives with her. She has much experience and works hard farming rice. Because of insufficient farmland to grow rice, D. rented farmland from her neighbors to do farming and contracted to pay at the end of the year. Rice farming is the main source of income for her family. Hence, D. would like to request a loan to pay for renting farmland.

loans.use: To pay for renting farmland

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en: Ngoun EngL., 32, is a rice farmer, while her husband, Mr. Pat Bune, also works farming rice. They both work hard on the business. She grows potatoes for another source of income. She farms on her farmland and even rents more farmland. She has three children, all of whom are young and in school. The family lives in Banteaychey Village in the Kampong Cham Province. Now her potatoes are growing, and it is time to collect the yields. Hence, EngL. would like to request a loan to pay for workers to collect the potato yield and to rent more farmland to use for her farming business.

loans.use: To pay for workers to harvest potatoes and to rent more farmland

loans.name: Yinh

texts.en: Yinh K. S., 34, is a lottery seller for a company. She lives in Phnom Thom Village in the Banteay Meanchey Province. She receives benefit from the business by taking a percentage of the amount that is sold. She has been selling since 2006 and can earn around $10 per day. She is widowed with two children, both of whom are teenagers and in primary school. She is a talented businesswoman. Now she would like to request a loan to add to her savings to purchase a house at a low price to keep and sell for profit in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase a house at a low price to sell for profit in the near future

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Mrs. Sambath P., 30, is a sugarcane juice seller who lives in Korksvay Village in the Banteay Meanchey Province. Her husband, Thorn Thy, is 32 and a motorcycle taxi driver who just recently sold this business that previously helped Mrs. P.'s business. They have three children, all of whom are teenagers and in school. With her growing business, P. would like to request a loan to purchase sugarcane stocks to make juices to sell.

loans.use: To purchase sugarcane stocks to make juices to sell

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Mrs. Khiev V. is 60 years old and a widow. She sells groceries and lives in Prey Chysak Village in the Kandal Province. She has seven children, four of whom are married and three live out of home independently. V. sells a variety of products from her house. She, alone sells groceries in this manner from her house and her business is going well. Her business is growing and V. would like to request a loan to purchase more grocery inventory for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery inventory for resale

loans.name: Din

texts.en:
Din S., 41, is a rice farmer who lives in Kandal Province, while her husband is a bricklayer. She has two children, both of whom are single and in school. S. and her husband work hard farming rice to support the family's daily expenses.

Besides farming rice, S. purchases rice from her neighbors or from another village and then resells for profits.The business has gone well and now it is time for her to restock. Hence, S. would like to request a loan to purchase rice stocks.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale.

loans.name: Saayed

texts.en:
Saayed H. is married and responsible for providing for his family. He is active in agriculture and learned this business from his father. Now, his father is unable to work in agriculture and H. works hard at growing his crops. He has plenty of land for cultivation but he is unable to make use of it all.

H. wants to take out an individual loan of 30000(AF) with a term of 27 months to purchase more stock and seed to plant all the land and to get ready for next years cultivation. This is the season to prepare the land for next years harvest. He wants to improve the lives of his family.

With this loan he can further his business and help his family in the future. His father and all his family want to thank all those who help by making kiva loans possible.

loans.use: Purchase stock and seed for farming

loans.name: Gullahjan

texts.en: Gullahjan is 54 years old, married and the father of six children. He lives in Chaharbagh in Nangarhar province. He is an educated man and he has much experience with agriculture. He is still actively involved in this work and now wants to take out 30000(AF) loan with a term of 27 months to buy livestock. In the future, he will use the animals to produce  milk and yogurt for sale at the bazaar. He wants to earn a good income for his family and especially his son. Ghullahjan would like his son to receive a higher education. He would also like to continue his relationship with Kiva and AFSG in Afghanistan.

loans.use: buying animals for his land

loans.name: Shakilla

texts.en:
Shakilla lives in district 8 of Kabul Afghanistan. She is married with two children and her husband works for a private company. She works for the government and has lived in rental housing for long time. A few months ago she decided to build a house. She bought  land and started construction. She now needs additional funds to continue working on her house.

She requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghans with a term of 12 months to complete construction and start working on starting a new life in her new house. She wants to say "I appreciate this process of lending money in Afghanistan. Everyone can use it in different ways".

She would like to thank lenders around the world for their support in providing loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete the construction of her house

loans.name: Gullam Mustafa Group

texts.en: This is Ghulam Mustafa, who is 25 years old. He is married, the father of two children and he lives in Angoorbagh in Nangarhar province. He has a tailoring shop in Jalalabad city. Mustafa has decided to make a group loan with four other members. They all work at different trades: Mujeeb operates a Public Call Office, Merwais and Shapooris are  tailors and Samsoor has a retail food shop. They would like to take out a 50000(AF) group loan with a term of 10 months (for each person 10000AF). Mustafa says that he can manage his group and that they can repay the loan on time.  They would like to thank all the lenders from around the world, Kiva and AFSG in Afghanistan, for providing this process for loan to the poor countries.

loans.use: Invest in business stock and supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.en:
Senaida A. is the representative of this small group. This particular loan is for five hard-working women from a larger group of forty women who are applying for a loan. 

Senaida has really benefited from microcredit. She came to Esperanza International a few years back with absolutely nothing. Not only did she not have an income, but she had seven children that she needed to take care of all by herself. Being a single mom is difficult, but imagine having seven kids and no real income. Many times, the kids would have to go into the streets to beg, or do whatever they could for money, and miss out on school. Life for this family was never easy.

Senaida took out her first loan and started a small business selling clothing in her area. Her pleasant personality and hard work helped her to thrive, and to start having some success. She is now applying for her 6th loan, and has continued to grow with each loan. She is starting to feel like she can proviD. for her children and put them in school. 

She has never been more happy and feels like she has something of her own. Senaida is very excited about this next loan and even more excited about what the future holds for her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for her business

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat Muntha, 29, is married and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has just started a business in 2007, cooking Khmer food and rice to sell to the numerous factory workers in her community. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, transporting passengers to different locations.

On average this couple can typically make $10/day in income, which enables them to cover their entire family's expenses and their kid’s tuition fee.

Phat Muntha would like to request a loan from KIVA to expand her food stand, making it bigger so that there is enough room for her customers. With any remainder of the loan she will buy more utensils and equipment.

loans.use: To buy more utensils and equipment and expand her business

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Mr. Chhon T. lives in Da Rap Doluos village in Kandal province. He is a fisherman. His wife, Mrs. Suo Sen, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice.

On the plantation, she faces a problem because her field is infertile. Additionally, Mr. Chhon T. does not have enough fishnets for fishing. To deal these problems, he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field. This will make his crop more productive. He will use the rest of the money to buy more fishnets for his fishing business.

Mr. Chhon T. has eight children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, and the other six are enrolled in the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. His wife is presented on the photo near him.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fishnets.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en: Mrs. Sareth E. lives in Sambou village in Kandal province. She is a 43-year-old widow with two children who are attending the local school. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectar (2.47 acres) of land to cultivate rice. On the plantation, she faces some problems because she does not have rice seed and her field sits in infertile soil. In order to deal these problems, Mrs. Sareth E. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer. She will use the rest of the money to purchase fuel to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: For a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and fuel to support the field.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. YU. U. lives in Choeung Vat village in Kampong Cham province. She is a grocer who owns a small store in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand; thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

She hopes to increase income and provide a better life for her children. She is a 69-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia T. is 59 years old and lives at Polo, Dapitan City. She has three married children. She has been faced with many challenges. Her husband, Francisco, passed away from diabetes.

Mrs. Alicia is a business-minded person. She opened a sari-sari (variety) store in 2004 with PHP 3,000. The business runs smoothly and has become her primary source of income. 

She heard of Paglaum MPC and decided to join in 2005. She has taken several loans and has expanded her business successfully. Now she is borrowing PHP 14,500 to purchase cases of soft drinks and canned goods for her sari-sari store. In the future, Mrs. Alicia wants to operate a mini grocery store.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and canned goods for sari-sari store

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Khoeurn K. lives in Peam Sala village in Kandal province. He is a fisherman who can catch a little fish to support the family. His wife, Mrs. Chim Pao, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In the plantation, she faces a problem during dry season because she does not have enough rice seeds to grow rice.

to solve this problem, Mr. Khoeurn K. is asking for a loan for his purpose. He hopes to increase his rice revenue and improve his living conditions. He is 35 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are attending the local school. The youngest is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To cultivate rice during the dry season.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.en:
Mrs. Teodosia C., age 59, lives in Miputak, in Dipolog City. She is married to Mr. Jaime C., age 62, who is a motor-cab driver. They are blessed with two children.

In 2006, Teodosia became an official member of Paglaum MPC. For her first loan, she borrowed PHP 3,000.00 and  established a small sari-sari (variety) store. Being a loyal member of Paglaum MPC for 3 years, she has borrowed for six loan cycles. She works hard for her family, despite of many challenges. Both the husband and wife have managed their business well.

Now Mrs. Teodosia is taking a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase basic goods to display in her sari-sari store. She dreams of owning a lot. Paglaum helped to uplift their lives. They are so very thankful for everything that Paglaum has done for them.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Mr. Chun C. lives in Sambou village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Suon Yorn, are farmers who own a land where they cultivate both rice and vegetables. In their plantation, they face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to cultivate rice and vegetables during the dry season. Thus, Mr. Chun C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, a fuel for a pump to water the field, and pesticides to kill insects.

He hopes to increase his rice revenue and improve his family's living conditions with this loan. He is 53 years old and the father of three children. One is a sofa maker, while the others are enrolled in the local school. His wife is in the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, fuel for a pump to water the field, and pesticides to kill insects.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mrs. Mach K. is a villager in Trapaing Prey village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she wants to expand it. She is asking for a loan to buy five more piglets and pig food to breed them. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Khat Muon, is a construction worker. Mrs. Mach K. is 40 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in the garment factory and the others are attending the local school. Her husband is in the left of the photo.

loans.use: A loan to buy five more piglets and pig food to breed them.

loans.name: Poeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Poeurn H. lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Choun Sok, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Although they work hard, in the plantation, they do not earn enough revenue to provide a better life for her family.

In order to improve the family's living conditions, Mr. Poeurn H. is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike to start a new motorbike taxi driver. He is 29 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. His wife is shown at the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to start a new motorbike taxi driver business.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan group with three members. Kim C., a member of the group, was elected to be the group leader. 

She is 26 years old and sells sugar cane juice in Rumchek Village in Battambang Province. Her business is going well because her market is crowded. She is married with five children, all of whom are single and live in the family's home. 

To improve her business, C. needs to expand her production of sugar cane juice. Hence, she would like to request a loan to purchase more sugar cane to make juices to sell. 

The other two members of the loan group are:
-- Yim S., age 20, sells rice cakes. She would like a loan to expand her business.
-- Hual P., age 43, sells fish paste in the market. She would like a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar cane to make juices to sell

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Mrs. Ith S. is a villager in Prey Preal village in Takeo province. She is a seller who owns a small store in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Kung S., is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice and vegetables.

Even though they work hard, they still earn less income than they need for their family's expenses. To improve their income, Mrs. Ith S. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is 59 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband is at the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Mrs. Khorn H. is a villager in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she does not earn enough revenue to support her family. In order to improve their living, she is asking for a loan to purchase a cow to start a new breeding business. She is 65 years old and a widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat R. is 64 years old and a resident of Kandal Province. She makes a living selling fresh fish and fish paste in local market. She currently earns an income of approximately of $7 per day. She started the business over twenty years ago. She is married with eight children, seven of whom are single and one of whom is married. 

To help meet the family's needs, two of her daughters are employed as garment workers, earning salaries of $160 per month. Her husband is a local teacher, as well as a fisherman. 

Because she lacks capital to enlarge her business, R. is applying for a loan to purchase fish to make fish paste to sell. 

She and her husband appear in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase fish to make fish paste to sell

loans.name: Hein

texts.en:
Mr. Hein M. lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. He is a construction worker. Since his work place is far from the house, he usually pays a lot of money for a motorbike taxi for transportation. He now is requesting for a loan to buy a motorbike so he can go to work himself and reduce his expenses.

His wife, Mrs. Len Yoen, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Mr. Hein M. is 48 years old and the father of two children who are attending the local school. His wife is near him on the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to go to work and reduce his expenses.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey U. is a farmer in Trapaing Prey village in Takeo province. She owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Doem Thy, is a motorbike taxi driver. Even though they try to work hard, they do not earn enough income for the family to improve their living conditions. In addition, Mrs. Srey U. family members live in an old house which needs to be repaired.

Mrs. Srey U. is asking for a loan to buy timers to fix the house. She is 31 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, three are enrolled in the local school, and the remaining one is too young to work or study. Her husband is also shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy timers to fix the house.

loans.name: Mrs. Samai Nou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of eight people, is located in Khnar Rung Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Samai N. is the village bank president; she was selected by the members. She owns 0.5-hectar (1.3 acres) to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Pen Ra, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and wine. He now faces a small problem because he does not have enough equipment to gather palm juice. In order to re-start this business, Mrs. Samai N. is asking for a loan to buy bamboo to tie with the palm tree to climb up to gather juice. Mrs. Samai N. is 41 years old and the mother of two children who are all attending the local school. 

All the members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to tie with the palm tree to climb up to gather palm juice for the business.

loans.name: Dam's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dam S. the leader of a three-member group that has requested a loan from Kiva. 

S. is a charcoal seller who lives in Rumchek Village in Battambang Province. She has three children, two of whom are married. One child is single and repairs motorcycles. Her husband is car mechanic who can earn around $5 per day. S. and her husband work hard every day to support their family. For another source of income, S. would like to request a loan to purchase groceries to sell. 

The other two members of the loan group are:
-- Mrs. Yin S. T., age 37, is a tailor. She would like a loan to purchase groceries to sell. 
-- Mrs. Kong S., age 56, sells groceries. She needs a loan to purchase rice to sell. 

These people live in Rumcheck Village in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy Phay is a villager in Khna Rong Village in Takeo Province. She is a tailor in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Nhanh Phai, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice for a living. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support the family.

To deal with this problem, Mrs. Chanthy Phay decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business, and then she hopes to increase her income after she sells her cows. Mrs. Chanthy Phay is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. The child is two years old. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Osaphea

texts.en:
Mrs. Osaphea M. was born in 1981 and she now lives in Tonle Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Tuon Srey Mom, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and wine. Although they try to work hard, they still earn little income and cannot provide better conditions for their family. Additionally, they do not have any transportation to travel to some places such as local market, the work place, and so on.

In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Osaphea M. is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike for her family to use for all their needs. Mrs. Osaphea M. has two children who are staying at home because they are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family to use to help with personal and business responsibilities.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhim P. is a farmer in Srae Spai Village in Kampong Cham Province. Her husband, Mr. Hem Ert, is a laborer who makes a small income to support the family. Although this couple tries to work hard, they do not earn enough income to support the family. In addition, the family members have difficulty generating enough water for the family's use.

To deal with this problem, Mrs. Sokhim P. is asking for a loan to dig a well in the house area and she would use the rest of the loan to buy a pump. Mrs. Sokhim P. is 49 years old and the mother of five children. Two help their parents' businesses while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of photo.

loans.use: To dig a well in the house area and she would use the rest of the loan to buy a pump.

loans.name: Non

texts.en:
Mrs. Non N. lives in Pro Keab Village in Takeo Province. She is 49 years old and the mother of four children. One of her children is a construction worker and the others attend the local school.  She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land, on which she cultivates rice for a living. 

Her husband, Mr. Nop Soeurn, uses his motorbike to transport goods and passengers to earn an income. He faces a problem because his bike is too old, making the passengers uncomfortable. Mrs. Non N. is requesting a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband's business. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Theng

texts.en:
Mrs. Theng N. was born in 1966 and lives in Prey Chuor Village in Takeo Province. She is 42 years old and the mother of five children.  Two of her children are employed in a garment factory, two attend the local school, and one stays at home. She is photographed with her husband.

Both her and her husband, Mr. Kong Chhaom, make baskets out of bamboo. Since the business is going well, they want to expand it.  Mrs. Theng N. is requesting a loan to buy more bamboo to make baskets.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to make baskets

loans.name: Phann

texts.en:
Mrs. Phann N. is lives in Prey Chuor Village in Takeo Province. She is 50 years old and the mother of four children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. She is photographed with her husband.

Mrs. Phann N. earns a living by growing mushrooms.  However, she currently does not have enough seeds to plant.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy more seeds.  She hopes to increase her income after she sells the mushrooms. Her husband, Mr. Kong Khom, helps her on the farm.

loans.use: to buy more seeds to grow mushrooms

loans.name: Neng

texts.en:
Mrs. Neng K. was born in 1961 and lives in Prey Chuor Village in Takeo Province. She has three children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, one sells cake in the local village, and the youngest stays at home doing housework. Her husband, Mr. Saom Rin, is a farmer cultivates rice on a small piece of land he owns. He is also in the photo.

She earns a living by breeding pigs. Since the business is going well, she wants to expand it. She is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget L. lives in Prey Chuor Village in Takeo Province. She is 40 years old and the mother of eight children. Five of her children help her and her husband with the business and the others stay at home.  She is pictured with her husband.

Mrs. Nget L. makes a living by cultivating rice on her plot of land.  Her husband, Mr. Mon Nhon, is a laborer and earns a small income. Although they work hard, they live in an old house and cannot provide a good standard of living for their family. In order to improve her family's livelihood, Mrs. Nget L. is requesting a loan to buy timber to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy timber to build a new house for her family

loans.name: Srey Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Mao M. lives in Khna Rong Village in Takeo Province. She is 23 years old and the mother of a one year old child.  Her husband is pictured in the photo with her.

Mrs. Srey Mao M. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land, on which she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Ti Vuthy, is a construction worker who earns a small income. Although the couple works hard, they have little money and cannot provide a good standard of living for their family.  Therefore, Mrs. Srey Mao M.’s is asking for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.use: to buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sary U. lives in Kraing Touch Village in Takeo Province. She is 58 years old and the mother of three children. All of the children are employed in a garment factory.  She is pictured with her husband, Mr. U. Phon, who is a farmer. 

Mrs. Sary U. is a duck breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy an additional 280 ducklings to breed and duck feed.

loans.use: to buy ducklings and duck feed

loans.name: Chron

texts.en:
Mrs. Chron A. was born in 1984 and lives in Angkokie Village in Takeo Province. She has two children, who are eight months and three years old. She is also a farmer who cultivates rice on her plot of land for a living. 

She is pictured with her husband, Mr. Koem Nat, who sells knives.  Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy more knives for him to re-sell in the local village.

loans.use: to buy more knives to re-sell

loans.name: Pan's Group

texts.en:
This small group is composed of three borrowers. Mr. Kok P. is the leader. He is 50 years old, and makes a living purchasing cows from far away places to raise in his house, which will result in a profit. He is called an ox trader. He is married to San Rorn, age 52, who is a rice farmer. She is a good mother of four children; three are single and one is married. Two of her children are employed; one is a construction worker at Thailand Country and another one is a garment worker in Phom Penh City.

His cattle business is the main source of income for P.. Recently, P. is lacking capital to expand his business operation. Therefore, he is applying for a loan to buy more cows to raise for sale. (P.'s wife appears in the picture because he was not available.) P. is asking for this loan along with two members:

Pan P. is 39 years old, a rice farmer. She requests a loan to purchase rice to store for sale and begin a new business for raising pigs. San H. is 55 years old, and widowed. She is a local farmer that applied for a loan to start a new business for raising pigs at home. The borrowers are people who living in Spean Tnot Commune in the Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more cows for sale.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong S. is a group leader joined by three members. She identified three eligible members and requested the loan from Kiva. S. is 50 years old and makes Khmer traditional baskets to sell. She has been in the business since 1998 and earns around $2 per day. She is widowed and cares for one elderly mother. Her business is going well and has a lot of clients who buy her products. She has one child whom she supports and pays the school's fee. Now, S. lacks money to repair her house's ladder. Hence, she would like to request a loan.

The other two members are: Chean C., 37, a widowed Khmer traditional basket maker. She needs a loan for making more baskets to sell. Luot L., 36, is a widowed fish seller. She needs a loan to purchase more fish to sell. All of these borrowers live in Boeung Village in the Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: to repair her house's ladder, so she can continue to make her baskets.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Mrs. Leng C. lives in Prey Chuor Village in Takeo Province.  She is 51 years old and the mother of three children.  Her children are all employed in the garment factory. She is pictured with her husband, Mr. Saom Roeurn, a construction worker who earns a small income. 

Mrs. Leng C. is a breeder who raises cow and pigs. Since the businesses is going well, she wants to expand it.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy a cow and two piglets.

loans.use: to buy a cow and two piglets

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia J., 47 years old, is a member in good standing at the Mangrove Center. She is married to Ricardo, who works as a "Kagawad" (Barangay Councilor). With the little honorarium of being a Barangay Councilor, they also have a little fish pond and coco farm which yields income once every three months.

What worries the couple most is how to survive in their daily needs. Even if the couple spends only within their limits, they cannot manage their finances wisely. That's why they thought of starting up a "sari-sari" (variety) store. They asked Paglaum MPC to finance their store. They said it's a good opportunity to invest in a business that they are comfortable to handle. A loan was released, with which they immediately bought canned goods and bottled drinks. They also tried selling animal foods and even fruits and spices in their little store. Emelia said that it takes a lot of patience to achieve success. In the future, they want to see their children establish their own careers and be able to expand their store into a convenience store with a wide variety of goods.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and bottled drinks to sell in their store.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum P. is a 26-year-old resident of Siem Reap Province. She earns a living by growing rice and vegetables from her home. She started her business four years ago and is currently earning an income of $5 a day to help her family's expenses.

Her husband, Ching Chorn, 26, is a fisherman. He depends on fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake, which is a main place for fish sheltering. The young couple is responsible for one child. To earn additional income and help with the family's needs, P. is requesting a loan to purchase a piglet to raise, and rice to store for sale. This will help her family's life be a little more comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase piglet to raise and rice to store for sale

loans.name: Roche

texts.en:
Roche G., who is 32 with 3 children, took risks earlier in her life as she chose to think of business options. She ventured into the ready-to-wear (RTW) business. She enjoys it a lot and being young, she still has much energy and time to sell even if she carries it door-to-door. Roche is busy with different lines of clothing like men's and women's wear, and children's wear. "Don't be shy or afraid to roam around," she laughingly shares.

One cannot get good sales if he/she is so hesitant to carry the stocks. For added value, she also ventured into selling casserole dishes, plastic wares, kitchen utensils, and even dried fish. She makes use of her time tagging along everything and anything she can sell. Her first loan has made her business complete. Neighbors and friends are her "suki" (loyal customers). Right now, her stocks are packed in plastic bags and are already placed in one corner of her house. If it is time for her to get out of her house, plastic bags made it easy for her to carry her goods. Roche wants to build a showroom where stocks can be neatly displayed. She aims to dress up mannequins and artistically attract walk-in customers. She prepares for the education of her children now, even if it is early and before their time to go to school. Roche serves nothing but the best for her customers.

loans.use: additional capital for her Ready-to-Wear Clothing lines

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Mrs. Julieta Saldon, 30 years old, is married and lives at Miputak, Dipolog City. Her husband is a tricycle driver. In her desire to help her husband, she decided to sell basic commodities such as edible oil, soap, canned goods, sugar, etc., displayed in a small table adjacent to their house. Their neighbors are their customers. The small business was going so well that she decided to expand and joined Paglaum MPC last March 25, 2008. She was able to pay her debt. Now, she avails PHP 8,000 to buy basic goods for her sari-sari store.
In the future, she wants to see all her children finish their studies. She also plans to renovate their house, including the space for her store.

loans.use: To purchase basic goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Kaniz Fatima Group

texts.en:
Kaniz Fatima baji is a 54-year-old widow and resides in an area called Kot Radha Kishan which is 24 km from the town of Kasur, Pakistan. She has been living in this town for the past 10 years. She is the mother of five kids: four sons and one daughter. Her eldest son repairs sewing machines. The next one works in a factory. The third son works in a musical group as a drummer. Her youngest son works in a gas station. Her daughter stays at home and does household work. Kaniz baji is a midwife with experience gained over the past 12 years. She is applying for a loan to buy tools for her son so that he will be able to repair sewing machines easily and earn a good profit.

Kaniz Fatima baji is the group leader for several more women. Safia baji wants a loan to buy mason's tools. Abida baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy thread to re-sell. Seema baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for carrying loads. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy steel utensils to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy tools for repairing sewing machines

loans.name: Hamidan Murad Ali Group

texts.en:
Hamidan baji is a 58-year-old widow and resides in an area called Kot Radha Kishan which is 24 km from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 15 years. She is the mother of two sons who are involved in a fruit-selling business.

Hamidan baji worked really hard after the sudden death of her husband. She worked as a maid for 5 years in a school and began a business selling fruit, then handed it over to her sons. Now, by the grace of God, her sons' businesses are going well. So she is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruit so that her sons will be able to sell more fruit and earn more profit.

Hamidan baji is the group leader for several more women. Rani baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Razia baji wants a loan to buy cold drinks for her "cold corner".

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to re-sell

loans.name: Abdujamol

texts.ru: Абдучамол отец двоих детей,жена домохозяйка.Сам Абдучамол мастер по производству мебели разных видов.В последнее время у него идут заказы на спальный гарнитур.Он со своим напарником работает на дому у клиентов.Ему понадобился кредит для закупа необходимых полуфабрикатов для его работы,фанеры, деревянные доски,и.т.д. Абдучамол первый свой кредит закончил хорошо без нарушений.Кредит помог ему как в семейной жизни, так и в работе.Он благодарен всем инвесторам за поддержку и финансирование.
texts.en:
Abdujamol is the father of two children, and his wife works as a housekeeper. He is a master craftsman who makes various kinds of furniture. Of late he has had several orders for wardrobes for the bedroom. He and his partner work in the client's home. Abdujamol is in need of a loan for the purchase of the semifinished products needed for his work, plywood, wood boards, etc. Abdujamol repaid his first loan without any mishaps. The loan helped help him out both with his family and at work. He is grateful to all the investors for their support and financing.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cabinet Maker

loans.name: Soa's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group with four eligible members. Soa S. was elected to be group leader and requested the loan to Kiva. S. is 27 years old and operates a grocery store from her house in her village of Siem Reap Province. She is married to Mr. Ngoun Thy with three children, all of whom are teenagers and attending school. Her husband is a constructiO. worker. The young couple work very hard with the business to support their family's living. To produce more income, S. would like to request a loan of $250 to purchase more grocery inventory to sell. 
The other three members are listed below:
Soa O., 38, is a widowed constructiO. worker. She needs a loan to repair her house.
Sao S., 22, is a grocery seller. She needs a loan for her husband to purchase fishing nets. 
Ren K., 24, is a constructiO. worker. She needs a loan to repair her house. 
They all live in the Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery inventory to sell & to make home improvements

loans.name: Beteliana

texts.en:
"Be brave!" Beteliana L. from the Mahayahay Center speaks for herself in starting up their fish selling business. She is married and resides at Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She said that going into business involves a lot of hard work and is often coupled with risks that may result in failures, but she is thankful that their "negosyo" (business) is doing well. Sometimes, however, they get zero income, especially when bad weather strikes.
  
She has been involved in this business since her younger years. Financial assistance came from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very grateful for the financial help. It could not have been started without Paglaum MPC.

Recently, Beteliana applied for PHP 14,000 loan for additional working capital in fish selling. Apart from the capital, she will use a portion of the amount for their side car repair. Deliveries have been paralyzed already due to the problem with their side car.

Mrs. L. dreams most of owning a multi-cab for their volume deliveries. She remembers her family always as they are the reason in all her hardwork.

loans.use: Additional working capital for fish selling

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
G. Nazokat is 35 years old. She is married with three children. Nazokat has a tailoring business at her home. Her business is sewing a national raincoat called “Chapan” for men and women. Her workmanship is very good and she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and has a good head for business.

Nazokat has had this business for 10 years and this is her fifth loan from IMON International. With her loan, she will buy more fabric and embroidery materials. She smiles when asked what her dreams are for the future. She quickly replies that she plans to open a workshop, hire seamstresses, and expand her business. With her spirit, she will surely succeed.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today it remains a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war that ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase materials for sewing national raincoats

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina T. is single, and is presently living in Dawo, Dapitan City. She is the breadwinner of the family. Avelina is a very efficient and hardworking woman who wants to help her parents financially. She is comfortable with jobs often done by men.  She enjoys work with a lots of labor rather than traditional women's jobs. She started raising one piglet belonging to her neighbor. After that, she decided to raise piglets of her own. After learning about Paglaum MPC, she decided to join last September, 2008, for the purpose of borrowing capital.
